loans.name: Kazuki

texts.en:
Kazuki 58, is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Kazuki has operated a green grocery business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and price fluctuation in her place of operation. Kazuki dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 Kazuki wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
Yessenia, es una joven soltera  muy emprendedora que a sus 19 años de edad tiene un negocio propio dedicado a la venta de ropa, desde hace 9 meses, los cuales han sido de mucho esfuerzo y lucha constante para salir adelante, gracias a esa fuerza interior con la que cuenta. Vive en casa de su tía a la cual apoya con el fruto de su trabajo, Yessenia demuestra ser una joven luchadora trabajando también en un viñedo como operaria y con los ingresos que obtiene en esta labor, los invierte en su negocio de venta ropa.

Con el préstamo al cual desea acceder, ella comprara más ropa para su negocio y así poder crecer aun mas, el mayor sueño de Yessenia es mejorar al máximo su calidad de vida, estudiar para seguir una carrera que la ayude a mejorar en su negocio y asimismo incrementar su mercadería sobre todo demostrar que ella a sus 19 años puede ser una mujer de éxito.

Gracias a la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá realizar sus sueños y no solo eso, sino también desarrollarse como una microempresaria y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Yessenia is a young single woman.  She is very enterprising and, at 19 years of age, she has her own business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for nine months and it has required a lot of effort and constant hard work in order to make progress.  She has managed to achieve this thanks to her internal strength.  Yessenia lives in her aunt's house and supports her with the fruit of her work.  Yessenia is a tenacious young woman who also works as a laborer in a vineyard.  She invests the income she makes from that work in her clothes business.

Yessenia will use the loan that she is requesting to buy more clothes for her business so that she can grow it even further.  Her biggest dream is to improve her quality of life to the max.  She would like to study for a degree which will help her to improve her business.  She would also like to increase her merchandise and, above all, show that at 19 years of age she can be a successful woman.

Thanks to the help of Kiva lenders, Yessenia will be able to fulfill her dreams.  Not only that, she will also be able to develop as a micro-businesswoman and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 51-year-old married woman living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children and construct commercial houses on her plot.

She has a poultry and livestock business that she started two years back. Her challenge has been the low prices of both milk and eggs and her dream is to venture into rearing broilers.

Viola needs the loan to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.use: to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has six children. 

She operates a chop bar (where African dishes are prepared for sale) and she also sells fried fish at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to help her husband. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase cassava for the fufu (made from pounded, glutenized cassava), maize for banku (starchy maize dumplings) and other ingredients for the preparation of the food to sell. 

With the new profits from her business, Mary plans to get a better place to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava for the fufu, maize for the banku and other ingredients for the preparation of the food to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 54-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rosemary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rosemary described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Rosemary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Conscience De Savanne Carree 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Laurette est le coordinatrice de son groupe Conscience de Savanne Carree 1, 2, 3 & 4. Elle n´ est mariée, elle  habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite.
   
Laurette es une commerçante, elle vend du charbon de bois. Ele espère que avec cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de  Conscience de Savanne Carree ont besoin d’emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes  produits de  cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, chaussurres,  etc.  Elle déclare que son défit principal est de devenir un  grande  commerçante et  son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison et faire  l´éducation de ses enfants avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Laurette is the coordinator of the 'Conscience de Savanne Carree 1,2,3&4' Group.  She is not married and lives in the north of  Haïti where electricity supplies are rare and there is very limited drinking water.  She is a retailer and sells charcoal.

Laurette hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.  The other members of the group will use their loans to support their businesses selling cosmetics, fizzy drinks, shoes, etc.

Laurette's goal is to expand her business and use her profits to build a large house and educate her children.  She hopes that she can do this with the help of the field partner, Esperanza International.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman from the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 53 years old and a mother of six children; four adults and two-school- aged. She and her husband earn a living by doing fishing business. They have been doing this livelihood for almost 40 years to support the needs of their children and able to provide food for the family. Josephine’s only goal in life is to sustain and have enough money to send her school-aged children to college. She wants them to finished their degree and become professionals someday. Josephine needs an amount to buy fishing net and new engine for their fishing boat. That is why, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans. In this way, she and her husband will be able to continue use their fishing boat and able to improve their catch for a living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and new engine for their fishing boat

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsever has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. This 40-year-old man is hard worker. He is married, has 2 children. At the beginner he borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Normicro, has bought grocery googs. 
Now Elsever wants loan amount of $600 to rent a shop and increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To rent a shop and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon N. is 32 years old and a mother of 2. She lives in Phnom Penh City with her husband, two children, her brother, and her sister. She makes her living buying vegetables in bulk at the local market, and reselling them to restaurants for a small markup. She can make between $1.25 and $5.00 per day in her business. Her brother and sister also work, and supplement her income in return for living in Mrs. N.'s home.

In the future, Nguon N. dreams of building a new house. Also, she would like to change her job to selling clothes in the market where the profits are larger than what she receives now.

loans.use: Extend her vegetable selling business

loans.name: Nobar

texts.en: I. Nobar is a dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. She is 47 and has a family of 5 members. She has a cow , but one cow don`t cover needs of big family. To buy one more cow and one calf she needs a $1200 USD loan.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong K. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their five children.  She works by selling porridge and helping her husband to operate their pool hall.  The family makes a total of $7/day from these businesses, but they would like to build another pool hall for local youth to play at.  This loan will be used to purchase another building in which they will put pool tables and charge hourly rates.

loans.use: To purchase a pool hall

loans.name: Fath Mohammad

texts.en:
Fath M. lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 4 children, two daughters and two sons. He is a shopkeeper and he has good experience in his work. He has been in this business for more than 8 years.

Fath M. wants to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to expand his inventory to make a good income. He hopes to make it possible for his children to have a better education in future. He will be very happy to receive the loan.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
When Edwin and Augusta married they left their birth city, Pukará, in search of a better quality of life. Unfortunately it didn't go well for them and they had to return to their city of birth. It was then that Augusta decided to open an artisan workshop with the help of her loving parents. She now tirelessly works every day of the week from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the late afternoon. This work has given them the opportunity to participate in a national artisan contest, winning one of the first places for the beautiful decorative works that they make from clay and plaster. Both Edwin and Augusta are very happy and satisfied, and they wish to improve the quality and variety of their merchandise and variety of paint in order to keep creating the fine adn elegant works of art. Their goal is to continue saving their earning in order to be able to give a better quality of life to their two small children. "We help Edwin and his faithful wife continue to be successful with their beautiful, elegant, and unmatched artisan work."

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que formaron su familia Edwin y Augusta partieron de su pueblo natal Pukará en busca de una mejor calidad de vida, desafortunadamente no les fue muy bien y tuvieron que volver a la tierra que los vió nacer, entonces fue que decidió abrir con apoyo de sus padres que cariñosamente los acogieron un taller de artesanía; trabajo al que ahora se dedican incansablemente desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde durante todos los días de la semana. Esta labor les dio la oportunidad de participar en un concurso nacional de artesanos, obteniendo uno de los primeros lugares por los hermosos trabajos decorativos que realizan a base de arcilla y yeso.Ahora con mucha satisfacción y alegría ambos desean mejorar aún más la calidad y variedad de sus mercaderías y para esto solicitan un préstamo de dinero que lo utilizará en comprar una considerable cantidad y variedad de pintura para seguir realizando los finos y elegantes acabados de su bello arte, a fin de seguir atesorando los beneficios económicos que obtengan para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños niños. “Ayudemos a Edwin y a su fiel esposa a seguir triunfando con su bello, elegante e insuperable trabajo de artesanía”

loans.use: Purchase special paints in order to improve the quality of their beautiful artisan products.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Julia is 35 years old and has 2 children. Maria Carmen is 32 years old with 2 children, and Victoria is 31 years old and has 4 children. They are all part of the communal bank called Sol Radiante (radiant sun). They told us that they began their businesses with a savings of just a few dollars, and that the members of the bank are a close, united group, demonstrated by the fact that if somebody has a problem, everybody helps out.

Julia makes beautiful woven handicrafts, a skill she inherited from her parents. 20 years ago she began to make the pieces on her own, together with her husband and children. She creates individual pieces and sends them to Cusco to sell. In addition, she has a small general store in her house. Victoria also works with woven handicrafts. She learned from her husband who has been doing this since he was young. Like Julia, Victoria makes individual pieces and sends them to Cusco.

Maria Carmen, on the other hand, has a shop where she sells general groceries and speciality items. She sells her things from a space she rents close to the market of Santa Clara. She brings her products from Lima, and sells them wholesale. She used to also work in handicrafts, like her friends, but she left it to begin her business which was more profitable. She began her new work 6 years ago, selling door to door and around the markets, little by little growing the business.

Julia, Maria Carmen and Victoria will use their savings for their children's education, and to improve their homes. They will invest the money in cinnamon, mushrooms, cloves, noodles, milk, rice, sugar and sodas, as well as wool, dyes and threads. All of these woman have a dream that their children will receive a good education and become professionals, that their businesses continue to grow, and that they will have happy family lives.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Julia tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Maria Carmen tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Victoria tiene 31 años y 4 hijos. Ellas pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante desde hace 13, 13 y 5 años respectivamente. Julia y Maria son fundadoras del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante, y nos cuentan que iniciaron con un ahorro de 2 dólares y que las socias en su banco son unidas y solidarias, lo cual se demuestra cuando las socias tienen algún problema y todas las socias se apoyan.

Julia hace lindos trabajos de Artesanía en Telar, arte que fue heredado de sus padres. Hace 20 años realiza los telares independientemente junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella elabora individuales y los envía a Cuzco, además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Igualmente Victoria realiza trabajos en telar, actividad que aprendió de su esposo que es artesano desde pequeño. Victoria, al igual que Julia solo hace individuales y también los envía a Cuzco.

Por otro lado Maria Carmen es comerciante y tiene una tienda de abarrotes y especerías. Ella vende en un local alquilado cerca al Mercado Santa Clara, y sus productos los trae desde Lima y vende al por mayor. Maria Carmen también fue artesana al igual que sus compañeras, pero dejó esta actividad por el comercio, que nos dice era más rentable. Se inició en este negocio hace 6 años como ambulante y poco a poco fue creciendo.

Julia, Maria Carmen y Victoria utilizarán sus ahorros para los estudios de sus hijos y para la mejora de su casa.

Ellas necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 800 soles y 800 soles respectivamente que serán invertidos en la compra de canela, hongos, laurel, achiote, comino, clavo de olor, fideo, leche, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, lanas, tintes, hilos.

Los sueños de Julia, Maria Carmen y Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, que su negocio crezca, vivir feliz junto a su pareja e hijos, y exportar sus telares.

loans.use: To invest in their respective businesses, purchasing  cinnamon, mushrooms, cloves, noodles, milk, rice, sugar and sodas, as well as wool, dyes and threads.

loans.name: Kamuli A2 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 36 years old and married with six children. She runs a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra business profits to start up a poultry business. Annet and Esther both have retail shops and want to use the loan and add in stock. Justine and Chrstine have brick laying businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to buy new salon equipment like driers and steamers and improve their retail and brick laying businesses.

loans.name: Kadiba Central E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jalia K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Jalia is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 17 and all of them go to school. Each week, Jalia makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve her business. Jalia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jalia is joined in her small group by Rose Mukarego and Madina K.. Rose Mukarego has a hair dressing business and wants to buy a dryer, hair oils and weaves. Madina K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase stock in the shop and buy a fridge.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to expand grocery business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Señora Doris belongs to the community bank Santa Bárbara, located at No 738 Jr Sucre, of the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 45 years old and a mother of two children. With the first loan received through Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, Doris decided to invest it in a business selling furniture.

Presently, she has a furniture sales business for which she wakes up very early to open, and at nights she is dedicated to her children.

With this loan of 3000 Soles, which will be paid back in five months, she will invest it in purchasing wood, bolts, lacquer, wood putty, furniture, etc.

Doris is very happy: her business is beginning to gain bigger clients, her profits are increasing, and all the effort that she makes is for the purpose of investing in the education of her kids and in this way be able to offer them a better future thanks to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Jr Sucre No 738, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Doris. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertirlo en un negocio de venta de muebles.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de muebles para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, y en las noches se dedica a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de madera, pernos, tiner, laca, masillas, muebles, etc.

Doris esta muy feliz, su negocio esta empezando a captar mayores clientes, sus ingresos aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y así poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro gracias a su trabajo.

loans.use: wood, bolts, finishing coats, etc

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S. is 49 years old and has lived in Kampong Cham province for her entire life. She and her husband have three children and work very hard to support their family. She owns a plot of land on which she has grown vegetables for the last ten years. She earns about $5 a day. Her husband, Sreng Nghel, is 58 years old and makes about $2 a day as a security guard.

All of their children work in garment factories, where they each earn $50 a month. Recently, one of her sons left his job to begin training to become a mechanic. Mrs. Bou S. is requesting a loan to pay for this son's training, as well as to buy the seeds and fertilizer she needs to grow more crops. By doing this, she will generate more income for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds, and pay a training fee for her son.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Ana Maria A. is a hardworking woman with 2 children under her care. With this business, she is able to pay tuition for her husband, who is currently studying at a public university in order to better himself. She lives in the outskirts of the city of La Paz. This is the first individual loan that she requests, taking advantage of her excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ana es una persona trabajadora que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, la señora con su negocio esta haciendo estudiar a su esposo en una universidad publica para que este se pueda superar, ella vive en una zona peri urbana de la ciudad de La Paz Actualmente es el primer credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to restock her business

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida is a much admired woman who's constancy and perseverance has allowed her to support her family through the small business that she set up that is now growing. She has a small shop in her house in which she sells basic articles that members of the community need. She would like to take this opportunity to ask for your support so that she can increase the amount of merchandise she has.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Elida, es una mujer admirable que con mucha constancia y perseverancia ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con el emprendimiento de su pequeño negocio con tendencia creciente. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en casa y a través de la cual provee artículos de primera necesidad a los miembros de su comunidad. En esta oportunidad solicita vuestro apoyo para incrementar su mercadería y ofertas dentro de su establecimiento.

loans.use: An injection to capital to better kit out her small work space/Inyección de capital para implementar su pequeño espacio de trabajo.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
In the community of Chimpa Jaran, about 15 kilometers from the city of Juliaca, the humble home of Filomena can be found. She is an exemplary mother who is very loving and dedicated to her loved ones. Filomena did not have the opportunity to go to school because she came from a family with few economic resources. But that was no reason to give up. With great priD. she decided to follow in the footsteps of her parents, who taught her farming and cattle production from a young age. Thanks to this noble work which she carried out together with her late husband she was able to proviD. her family with peace, security, and above all, an education for her dear children, of whom she is now very proud and feels very accomplished as a mother. Filomena's harvest of forage crops for her animals was affected this year by the cold weather that appeared throughout the country. For this reason she is requesting your collaboration in order to buy alfalfa to keep her dear animals well-fed and maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

En la comunidad D. Chimpa Jaran, a unos 15 kilómetros D. la ciudad D. Juliaca está ubicada el humilD. hogar D. doña Filomena, madre ejemplar, amorosa y muy dedicada a los suyos, Filomena no tuvo la oportunidad D. seguir estudios primarios ni secundarios porque provenía D. una familia D. bajos recursos económicos, pero eso no fue razón para dejar D. lidiar, es por ello que con mucho orgullo decidió sacar adelante el oficio que sus padres desD. muy pequeña le enseñaron, la agricultura y producción D. ganado, gracias estas nobles labores que en todo momento desempeñó junto a su difunto esposo pudo brindarles tranquilidad, seguridad y sobre todo, educación a sus queridos hijos D. quienes actualmente se siente muy orgullosa y realizada como madre.Filomena, en esta fuerte temporada D. helada por la que atraviesa su país se ve afectada en la cosecha D. forraje para sus animalitos, por ello requiere D. vuestra colaboración para adquirir alfalfa y mantener bien alimentados a sus tiernos animales.

loans.use:
Purchase of alfalfa for her cattle. Due to the cold weather the forage crop harvest has been affected.

Compra de alfalfa para su ganado, ya que por helado clima, se ven afectadas sus cosechas de forraje.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El T., age 37, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has sold beef to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$3 of profit per day. Her husband, Hel Ly, age 36, is a local butcher who provides meat for her to sell. Mrs. T. told a loan officer that prior to selling beef she was a vendor selling vegetables and her husband was a construction worker who built houses.  However, both had to change professions due to problems.  She told a loan officer that every month she needs to pay for food that costs around US$35 and utilities that cost about US$5. Together, this couple has three children, two of whom are employed and one is too young to work.

Mrs. El T. is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to purchase cow for her husband to kill for meat.
(Mrs. El is pictured with her husband and her son.)

loans.use: Mrs. El Tap is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a cow for her husband to butcher for meat.

loans.name: Haticha

texts.ru: Аллоерова Хатича проживает в районе Вахш . Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговое место на центральном рынке района , где торгует одеждой. Муж в России на заработках. Поэтому вся ответственность за семью лежит на ней. Ей приходится много работать для того ,  чтобы обеспечить детей. Планирует получить кредит , чтобы завезти осенне – зимнюю одежду . Это позволить заработать в период димесезонноц торговли.
texts.en:
Haticha A. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. For the last 15 years Haticha has been making a living selling clothes at the central market. Her husband is working in Russia so the responsibility for taking care of her family lies on Haticha's shoulders. She has to work a lot to support her four children. Haticha is applying for this loan in order to buy fall-winter clothes for the market stall, in order to be prepared for the coming season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. R. lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 3 children. She is part of the community bank, Lila, at FINCA Perú. Norma works as a civil engineer in her house, where she has a small office. In addition, she has a store in Ayacucho which offers the following services: Internet access, photocopies, telephone booths and printing projects. 

With her loan, Norma would like to purchase new computers and a photocopy machine for her store. With the income she earns from both her business and from her professional work, she hopes to discontinue renting a topography machine for her engineering work and instead purchase one for her home.

loans.use: To purchase new computers and a photocopy machine for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group pictured in the photo is based in the Ouk Tum Por Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The group consists of 12 people, each of whom will use their loan share for different purposes. Mrs. Sary M., 55 years old, is widowed and has four children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Sary M. is the president of the village bank loan group and earns income running her own grocery store in the local market. Her business is going well, and she would like to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Sary M. is asking for a loan to buy additional grocery products for her inventory, hoping to thereby increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term (EoT) loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

Also pictured in the photo are Matt Flannery, the CEO and co-founder of Kiva, and Zvi Boshernitzan, the Chief Software Architect at Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Urfa Yousaf Masih Group

texts.en:
Urfa baji is a 54-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is Y. M., and he is a mason by profession. Urfa baji has no kids. She keeps herself busy making embroidered dresses. First she did this work to keep herself busy but now she chooses this activity as a profession. She charge fees per embroidered dress and her fees for each dress is $3. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy mason tools for her husband.  

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (beams and ropes) for her shuttering business. Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy another bike for her rented motor bike business. Dorus baji wants a loan to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her tuition center. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche G., who is 32 with 3 children, took risks earlier in her life as she chose to think of business options. She ventured into the ready-to-wear (RTW) business. She enjoys it a lot and being young, she still has much energy and time to sell even if she carries it door-to-door. Roche is busy with different lines of clothing like men's and women's wear, and children's wear. "Don't be shy or afraid to roam around," she laughingly shares.

One cannot get good sales if he/she is so hesitant to carry the stocks. For added value, she also ventured into selling casserole dishes, plastic wares, kitchen utensils, and even dried fish. She makes use of her time tagging along everything and anything she can sell. Her first loan has made her business complete. Neighbors and friends are her "suki" (loyal customers). Right now, her stocks are packed in plastic bags and are already placed in one corner of her house. If it is time for her to get out of her house, plastic bags made it easy for her to carry her goods. Roche wants to build a showroom where stocks can be neatly displayed. She aims to dress up mannequins and artistically attract walk-in customers. She prepares for the education of her children now, even if it is early and before their time to go to school. Roche serves nothing but the best for her customers.

loans.use: additional capital for her Ready-to-Wear Clothing lines

loans.name: Suth

texts.en: Suth N., 40, pictured with her husband, is a mother of three and lives in Bati District, Takeo Province, where she operates a grocery store and earns around $40 every day. Her husband, a construction worker building house, earns about $5 a day.  Suth would now like to take out a loan of $1200 to expand her grocery store in order to meet client demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. is currently in the business of selling cocks and hens at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Jane is 24 years old and married. Her husband is a butcher. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cocks and hens.

loans.name: Marito

texts.en: Marito T., a husband and a father of two kids, does his very best to provide for the needs of his family. At 53, he is determined, enthusiastic, and able to give a better life for them. His main source of income is his small variety store handled by his wife. He spends his time fishing at night and driving a pedicab during the day. Because of Marito's strong desire to see his children finish their studies, along with his wish to quit renting a house and purchase a small home of his own, HSPFI is helping him fulfill his dreams through HSPFI savings and loans. Marito is applying for his seventh loan amounting to PHP 15,000.00 (US$325) in order to raise capital for his variety store as well as to provide maintenance for his pedicab and boat.

loans.use: for pedicab maintenance and stocks for his variety store

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a 48 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has owned a grocery store for twenty nine years. Assad requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store.

Asaad has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise and expand his stock, as well as help his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Asaad first started his business, he didn’t have the start up capital. He hopes to improve his financial situation. In the future, Asaad plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is 41 year old widow with 3 children. She sells drinks to make a living and has been working in this business for a long time. Ada is hoping for a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell, thereby expanding her business with this Kiva loan. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for stock and sale.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор Буров более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Возраст 50 лет. Абдугафор занимается откармливанием и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Продает он на скотовом рынке "Вахдат". В этом бизнесе ему помогает младший сын. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычков для откармливания и продажи. На полученную прибыль хочет купить бычка.
texts.en:
Abdugafor B. has been doing animal husbandry for more than six years. He is married and has five children. He is 50 years old. Abdugafor feeds and resells large cattle. He sells on the cattle market Vahdat. His youngest son helps him in this business. The client is asking for a loan to buy calves for feeding and resale. He will buy another calf on the received profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en: Nyoka G. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and shoes, and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes and shoes to sell. Nyoka is 39 years old and is married, with a husband that is an army officer. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Folly E. est un commerçant de friperies très dévoué. Agé de 35 ans, il est marié et père 2 enfants. Folly exerce ce commerce depuis 4 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son activité en payant des nouveaux produits de marque lui permettant de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Folly E. is a very dedicated second-hand clothing retailer. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. Folly has been in this business for 4 years. He hopes to expand his business with this loan by buying new brand-name products that will allow him to better respond to customer needs. He is counting on this chance to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products for resale

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esmeralda” esta representado por la señora Andrea y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nicolasa y su hija la señora Maribel, ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, refrescos, ropa, cosméticos y confección D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Esmeralda" is represented by Mrs. Andrea, and comprised of 12 members including Mrs. Nicolasa and her daughter Maribel, who have small businesses with individuals incomes. The majority of the group members have businesses including cosmetic sales, food sales, clothing sales. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Irene Apiyo

texts.en:
Irene lives in the town of Rongo in western Kenya. Her business supplies vegetables to local schools which they use to prepare meals for the children. She started selling to schools only at the beginning of this year, and has already experienced tremendous growth. She wants to take her loan so that she is equipped to meet the demands of the schools.

During the dry season, Irene’s own farm produces less, and she is forced to buy more from wholesalers. Rather than let her business suffer during this time, she wants to be able to continue being the supplier of choice for the schools.

Irene is raising her three children and is also taking care of three orphaned children. She says that the most important lesson to teach the young ones is to be skilled in different areas since versatility is so valuable in today’s changing world.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Hong Doek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of eight people is located in Chheu Neang Khpos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Hong D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Peou Ek, is a healer.  Mrs. Hong D. is 55 years old and the mother of child who is a person to put the music to the phone for saving. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire laborers and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Nazakat is a mother of three children. She lives in Baku where she has been farming for five years.

Nazakat is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her crop yields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en: Wasuk T. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials. Wasuk is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo, quien es electricista, y tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles y bebidas, para lo cual tiene un pequeño kiosko frente a su casa. Con este negocio logra sustentar las necesidades de su familia, además del dinero que aporta su esposo. A Carmen le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias al mismo y a su carisma ha podido hacer amistad con muchos de sus vecinos y vecinas, quienes son sus clientes regulares. El anhelo de Carmen es in creciendo con su negocio hasta convertirlo en un minimarket.
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que hay confianza y mucha comunicación entre todos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá comprando abarrotes y productos alimentación de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old. Her husband is an electrician and they have two school-aged children. For the past four years, she has been selling food and beverages from a small kiosk in front of her house. Along with the income that her husband earns, this business enables Carmen to support the needs of her family. She enjoys her work and her charismatic personality enables her to make friends with neighbors who have become her regular customers. Carmen dreams of expanding her business and converting it into a mini-market.

This is her 7th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank group because the members trust and communicate well with one another. The money she requested will be used to purchase groceries and basic food staples.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Kiganda 3 Atukuda Scovia Group

texts.en: A. Scovia is twenty-nine years old and a single mother. She is blessed with two children and cares for  one dependent child . All are attending school. She has operated a pub business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase pub items such as chairs, umbrellas, beer, etc so that she will be able to attract more customers.  A.'s small pub which can not accommodate all of her customers, so she wants to extend the place by use of chairs and umbrellas. She is a promising business lady, hardworking, whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase pub items such as chairs, umbrellas, beer, etc so that she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Florence is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and other textile materials. She hawks to sell in her community and treks as well. Florence buys the fabrics from nearby towns. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El señor Jorge es una persona que se dedica a la venta de pan molido. Su esposa, la señora Alina Bustamante, es empleada dSe un supermerdado. Ellos viven como inquilinos en la zona de Villa Litoral. Don Jorge compra el pan duro del trabajo de su esposa, ya que cada día sobra y este es reunido y embolsado en sacos y luego se los hace endurar; cuando se acumulan varios sacos de pan duro don Jorge los compra y los lleva a casa para después molerlos en una pequeña máquina moledora. Luego los vende por quintales y arrobas. Don Jorge es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo y su familia. Él solicíta el crédito para la compra de una máquina de moler mas grande por que la que actualmente tiene es una maquina manual y la que comprará es semi automática. De esta manera don Jorge espera aumentar sus ventas y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge sells bread crumbs. His wife, Alina Bustamante, works in a supermarket. They are tenants in the Villa Litoral zone. Don Jorge buys the stale bread that is left over from his wife's work each day, which are collected and wrapped in bags and left to harden. Once there are a few bags of hardened bread, Don Jorge buys them and afterwards carries them back home to grind in a small grinding machine. Later, he sells the crumbs by the hundredweight and pound. Don Jorge is a very reponsible person towards his job and his family. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a larger grinding machine since the one he currently has is a manual machine, and the one he intends to buy is semi-automatic. With the new machine, Jorge hopes to increase his sales and be able to make his business grow as well.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a machine to grind stale bread

loans.name: Fwaz

texts.en:
Fwaz is a hardworking man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and three children.

Fwaz manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.

In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Fwaz is requesting a loan of 2500 USD.

Fwaz says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga N. Thị is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nga is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm xá 1.


Nga is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nga owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Nga has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3.100.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Nga joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 4th loan Nga has taken out with SEDA.  Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đặng Thị T.  is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Nghiêm Thị M. is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Huê is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


4.  Trần Thị C. is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Nghiêm Thị D. is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


6.  Nghiêm Thị H. is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 30 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Ali has owned and operated an Internet café for ten years. He also repairs computers and sells computer accessories. People from his region know Ali well because he has a good reputation and they feel comfortable coming to his shop. His clients are people from his region, but mainly students and tourists. Ali decided to get into this business because he has experience in computers and likes working with them. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new computers for his café. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. His plan for the future is to keep on improving his shop.  He has some original ideas to keep on attracting more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new computers for his café

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en: Zebiniso G. is 34 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three wonderful kids. Her husband is an entrepreneur and doesn't earn enough for the family consumption, that is why Zebiniso has been running grocery store for the past three years. She sells fruits, sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and many other items in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Zebiniso is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Zebiniso is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $3,000 to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Zebiniso reach all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy foodstuffs to increase stock

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn H. is from the city of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Emelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emelyn makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Emelyn's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: José Fidel

texts.es:
Este cliente cuenta con un basta experiencia en le rubro ganadero y es por lo que hace la solicitud para la compra de vaquillas de vientres para la producción de leche 
 Es un hombre soltero y padre de 2 hijos los cuales trabajan con el mismo esfuerzo de padre para sacar adelante la producción
texts.en:
This client has vast experience in cattle raising. This is why he is asking for funding to buy young dairy cows for milk production. He is single and father of two children, who work with the same efforts as their father to move the production ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en: Lamin is a trader dealing in used clothing at the main market in Makeni City.  He is married to a trader and has two children in high school.  He has eight years of business experience.  He intends to increase his stock and to buy wholesale from Guinea and Freetown.  He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to settle his children educational issues and to purchase a piece of land for his family.  He is hard working and has spent his entire lifetime in the business with his wife who normally assists him in the business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: M. Cathérine a 50 ans et elle vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à AITCHEDJI Henri un enseignant, Cathérine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, un des enfants n'est plus à la charge de Cathérine et de son mari. La famille vit ensemble à Allada. Le couple supporte les différentes charges de la famille. Il y a deux ans que Cathérine a commencé la vente de sucre en poudre et d'oeufs à Allada. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l'aidant à se prendre en charge et à assurer les besoins de ses enfants. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et à Allada que Cathérine fait ses provisions. Cathérine a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Cathérine souhaite élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de beaucoup plus s'impliquer dans les dépenses familiales. Pour y parvenir, Cathérine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Catherine M. is 50 years old and for the past 20 years has lived in the Dogoudo borough of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. Married to Henri AITCHEDJI, a teacher, she is the mother of three children, all having attended (or still attending) school. One of the children is no longer dependant on Catherine and her husband. The family lives together in Allada, and the couple shares the various family expenses. Two years ago Catherine started selling powdered sugar and eggs in Allada. The activity provides income to help her take charge of her own needs and meet those of her children. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in Allada. Catherine has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. She wishes to increase the level of her activity to better satisfy her customers and become more involved in family expenditures. To reach that goal she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 12 egg trays and 3 bags of powdered sugar

loans.name: Rutabo Tweimukye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
On the face of it, K. George William seems a hard-grinding businessman. The 37-year-old married father of five school-going children sweats his guts out selling agricultural produce in a small rural town called Rutabo in Kyenjojo district. He has been doing this for the last two years.

In a month, George makes close to 30,000 shillings. This is quite modest by any standards and, as such, he requires a loan that will help him buy more food supplies for his business.

George belongs to a group and they are on their 2nd loan. They insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cereals and other produce for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 50 years old, used to have difficulty looking for financial support for her hog-raising business. When she heard of CEVI, she immediately joined to gain access to its program. She says that she has no regrets about joining the MFI because it has been a big help to her business. She hopes its program expands so that more entrepreneurs can be helped. 

Elena is married with six children. She does her best to earn enough from her business so that she can provide for her family. She applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed for her pigs. She also needs materials for her pigpen.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Gerardina De La Paz

texts.es:
Gerardina de la Paz Veliz de López tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Guatajigua , en el departamento de Morazán. Ella es soltera vive con sus dos hermanos y su madre, aprendió el oficio a los 12 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de productos artesanales de Barro (comales, ollas, jarros) es un negocio de tradición que se enseña por  generaciones y lo desempeñan generalmente las mujeres, el negocio les ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.
Gerardina  comercializa sus productos en la plaza de comercio de Guatajiagua y con visitantes de la zona, ella solicita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de diferentes clases de barros que son necesarios para que ella elabore sus cómales y ollas, ya que en la época del invierno (de Mayo a Octubre) es bien difícil obtenerlo. 
Con la compra de materiales  ella seguirá elaborando más productos durante el verano (de Noviembre a Abril)  ya que es la época más indicada para elaboración y secado. Su aspiración es mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar la calidad  de vida para su familia y diversificar la elaboración de productos de artesanía para tener a disposición cuando sea necesario.
texts.en:
Gerardina de la Paz V. de Lopéz is 33 years old. She lives in the municipality of Guatajigua, in the department of Morazán. She is single and lives with the her two brothers and her mother. She learned her occupation when she was 12 years old. She makes craft products from clay (tortilla pans, cooking or storage jars, vases). This is a traditional business that is taught from one generation to the next, and it is usually done by women. The business helps her support her family. Gerardina sells her products in the market plaza in Guatajiagua to people from the area. She is requesting the money to buy different kinds of clay that she needs to make her tortilla pans and cooking pots. The clay is very difficult to get during the rainy season. When she has purchased her materials, she will continue making her products during the dry season, since that’s the best season for making and drying them. Her aspiration is to maintain and build her business, improve her family’s quality of life, and diversify the products she makes so she can have them ready when necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clays

loans.name: Ongima

texts.en:
Ongima Emmnuel is in the business of selling groundnuts and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and pulses (lentils) to sell. Ongima is 42  and a widow. She has 7 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans and pulses (lentils) to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, tiene 39 años, es natural de Ccatca, vive en Huambutio y tiene tres hijos de las cuales uno es independiente y dos depende de ella todavía. Alejandrina y Aniceto son esposos y se ayudan mutuamente en el hogar y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en elaborar tejas de arcilla. Ya son 20 años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo.  Ellos requieren el préstamo para comprar ramas. Las ramas de arboles sirven para hacer secar las tejas y la arena sirve para mezclar con la arcillas para se ha más compacto la teja. Su actividad económica complementaria es administrar su pequeña tienda de venta de comestibles.

Alejandrina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 39 years old. She is originally from Ccatca but currently lives in Huambutio. She has three children; one is already grown and independent, and the other two still depend on her. Alejandrina and her husband Aniceto both help each other at home, and they also have a family business making ceramic tiles. They have worked in this business for 20 years now, and it has gone very well for them thanks to the dedication they bring to their work. They need the loan to buy tree branches, which are used in drying the tiles. They also need sand, which is mixed with the clay to make the tiles more compact. As a secondary economic activity, the couple also runs a small food store. Alejandrina is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tree branches and sand

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 24 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su pareja Antonio de 26 años y sus dos pequeños hijos. Hace más de dos años cultiva arveja, papa, así como verduras, zanahoria, col, culantro y lechuga. Siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso, para que pueda brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. En tanto su esposo, la ayuda en mantener bien cuidado sus campos agrícolas, pero en ocasiones trabaja como operario en otros terrenos agrícolas de sus vecinos y conocidos, ganando a diario S/. 20.00 soles, con eso cubre los gastos domésticos. Por otro lado, Alicia llega a su casa al mediodía para vender golosinas como: galleta, gelatina, flan y dulces, en la puerta de una institución educativa dentro de su localidad. Asimismo posee 16 reses que lo tienes en las altura de Palca. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar porque ahí puede observar la recompensa de su sacrificio, con el tiempo espera sembrar más verduras y arveja, e instalar un negocio de venta comida o una fuente de soda, en la casa que desea construir. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y le gusta mucho trabajar en su grupo comunal, pues participó de algunas reuniones y asegura que trabajará de manera activa, pagando puntualmente cada cuota. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, así como un saco de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Alicia is 24 years old, and she lives in a rented home with her partner Antonio, who is 26 years old, and with her two young children. For more than two years she has grown peas, potatoes, other vegetables, carrots, cabbage, coriander, and lettuce. This activity is her principle source of income, with which she provides an adequate quality of life for her family.

Her spouse helps her maintain her fields, but he occasionally works in other agricultural lands, such as those of his neighbors and acquaintances, earning a salary of 20.00 Soles, which covers the household expenses. Alicia leaves home in the midday to sell sweets like cookies, gelatin, flan, and candies in the door of a school nearby. She also has 16 cattle that she keeps in the highlands of Palca. She likes growing her plants the best because she is able to clearly see the fruits of her labor. With time, she hopes to plant more vegetables and peas, and to install a business selling food or a soda fountain, in the home she hopes to construct.

This is the first time she has taken out a loan with MFP, and she really likes working with this community bank, as she has participated in some meetings and assures that she will work hard to make her repayments punctually. With this loan, she will buy a bag of pea seeds and a bag of organic fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fullness Of Time Group

texts.en:
David S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Fullness Of Time. He is 53 years old, married and has six children whose ages range from 9 to 35. David was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For five years, David has been selling charcoal in Thinkers Village outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as an earnest man. His goal is to expand his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia D. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 58 years old and is married with eight adult children. Virginia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her 8th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Ahmenou Group

texts.en:
Annie M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Ahmenou. She is 52 years old, married and has five children who range from 12 to 30 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For two years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in Sinkor in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice, oil, beans, meat, fish, onions, tomatoes, etc. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans, meat, fish, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 61 years old and is married with five adult children. Maria owns and operates a business providing hairdressing, gowns and beauty services to local community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 9th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa de 22 años, vende ropa por catalogo a sus conocidos y vecinos, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Comenzó a vender ropa por la necesidad de mantener a su hija de dos años ya que es madre soltera, con sus pocos ahorros compro ropa de una revista y comenzó a venderlas a sus amigas y conocidos, trabaja repartiendo y promocionando la ropa por catalogo. 

Para mejorar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y mejorar su casa comprando pintura. En el futuro quiere darle una buena educación a su hija y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old and sells clothing through a catalog to her friends and neighbors. She lives in a periurban area called “Paraíso” that has dirt roads and mountains.

Since she is a single mother, Rosa began selling clothes in order to support her two year old daughter. Using a portion of her savings, she purchased clothing through a catalog and began selling them to friends and acquaintances. Her work involves distributing and marketing the clothes available through the catalog.

In order to improve her sales, Rosa wants to use this loan to buy clothing. She also will buy paint to improve her home. In the future, she wants to provide a good education for her daughter and open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell & paint for her home

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Thắng's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

T. is married and has four adult-aged children. She is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. T. has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. T. successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She is now requesting a new loan, her second from SEDA, of 6,048,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị T. is a 63-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agricultural sector raising livestock. 2. Trần Thị T. is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 3. Tô Thị H. is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 4. Đinh Thị L. is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Nguyễn Thị (20213030032) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND.
