Nelyda tiene 37 años, es madre de 5 hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Desde niña se dedicó a las labores agrícolas, machete en mano quitaba fácilmente todos los arbustos de las chacras de sus padres. Ahora, junto a su esposo trabajaban en común acuerdo para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Ellos siembran plátanos y paltas; resultándoles más rentable el plátano, porque cada 15 días lo venden desde su misma chacra a los diversos compradores que los buscan ahí. Estas ganancias les permitieron ahorrar y con ello, hace 6  meses, lograron instalar un espacio en su casa para la venta de golosinas y bebidas. Desde entonces los trabajadores del aserradero que se encuentra al costado de su vivienda son sus principales consumidores, quienes constantemente le compran sus gaseosas y galletas. Por ello, Nelyda se siente muy motivada en incrementar los productos que ofrece en su pequeña tienda.
En su tercer crédito con MFP, del que se siente muy agradecida por las facilidades brindadas, así mismo se compromete con todas las actividades que organiza su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más bebidas gaseosas y también fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y mercadería para su tienda

loans.name: Conteh United Group

texts.en:
The people pictured here are Obai C., Amasu C. and Saphie K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They named their group C. United. This is the first loan for which these entrepreneurs are applying. With the help of this loan, they will be able to make enough profit to feed their children, pay their school fees, and save some money for unforeseen situations. 

Obai C. (on the right) is the leader of the group. Obai is forty years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Obai sells medicines. He has been in the business for three years now. He will use this loan to buy more drugs to add to his drug store.

loans.use: purchasing more drugs for his drugstore

loans.name: Boye Guèye

texts.fr: Boye Guèye N. a 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" depuis un an et demi. Elle a sollicité ce prêt pour le renforcement de son activité de couture. Elle est détentrice d'une machine à coudre, soit elle fait la confection des vêtements sur mesure en fonction des commande qu'elle reçoit, soit elle coud des habits avec des tailles différentes et les vends en prêt à porter. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Boye Guèye N. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" for 1½ years. She’s requesting this loan to bolster her sewing business. She possesses a sewing machine, whether to make custom clothing by the special orders she receives or to sew outfits of different sizes to sell as ready-to-wear. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her sewing business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Emilio S. les está haciendo falta la elaboración de la barda y el portón al frente de la casa, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar esta mejora.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la barda y colocar el portón, ya que para el es muy importante, porque es para la seguridad de su familia cuando en no este en casa. 
Ya que es padre de dos hijos de mediana edad y quiere la seguridad para ellos cuando salgan a jugar.
Don Emilio es empleado de un restauran de comida Mexicana en el departamento de mesero, con este ingreso planea pagar el préstamo, ya que los gastos familiares será las propinas que recibe por atender muy bien a solos clientes que consumen en el restauran.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio S. needs a gate and fence in front of his house; currently, however, he does not have the money to build them. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy the materials and hire a contractor to build the fence and install the gate; this is very important to Emilio because the fence and wall will provide safety to his family when he is not around. Emilio has two young children and he wants them to be protected when they play outside. Emilio works as a waiter for a Mexican food restaurant. With the income from this job, he plans to repay the loan. The family expenses will be covered by the tips he receives for providing excellent customer service at the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a dividing wall and front gate

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de carros de segundo uso, aunque sabe que esta es una actividad en la que predominan los varones, ella no se deja menospreciar y realiza muy buenas ventas, ya que tiene un amplio conocimiento sobre automóviles y es una vendedora muy honrada, lo cual ha hecho que sus clientes confíen en ella.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre el carro que más les conviene, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en la calle en busca de un comprador. 
Para más adelante, espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener más carros para vender.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si desea acceder a otros créditos; en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de autos, ya que por estas fiestas navideñas tendrá mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 40 years of age, is a very hardworking woman. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. She works in the purchase and sale of used cars. Even though she is aware that this work is dominated by men, she does not let them overlook her and she does very good sales now that she has enough knowledge about automobiles and is a very reputable seller, something that has made her clients trust her. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers and advising them about the car that best suits them. She has been in this business for 10 years and what she finds most difficult is having to spend the whole day in search of a buyer. For the future she hopes to increase her business and have more cars to sell. This is Mercedes' third loan with MFP and she knows to pay it on time if she wants to receive other loans. She is a very active member of her community bank. She will use the 1000 Nuevos Soles to invest in the purchase of cars since there is increased demand in the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Merchandise

loans.name: Yusri

texts.en:
Yusri is 26 years old and married with no children. He sells tennis shoes.Yusri uses the profits from his sales to support his elderly parents, who he takes care of and is responsible for. 

Yusri's business is growing very well, that's why he is applying for a loan of $2000. He wants to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy L. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Mean Mech, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is far from the irrigation system and has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Vy L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the rice field. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family living with this loan.

Mrs. Vy L. is 43 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are farmers while the other one is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her husband's rice field

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and has seven children, whom he has seen through school. His wife is a businesswoman and he runs a wholesale shop where he sells food and employs three employees. Previously, Faulu Kenya offered him a loan which helped him add stock, expand his business and educate his children.  

He intends to add stock and expand his store with the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan. Thomas hopes to buy rental houses and a car for his business. His dream is to have more shops. Thomas describes himself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To add more stock and expand the store

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru: Косимов Косим проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Косим имеет высшее образование.  Он более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Косим в основном откармливает и продает скот. До этого он преподавал в школе. Косим хочет увеличить количество скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Kosim K. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. Kosim has a higher education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. Kosim mainly raises and sells livestock. Previously, he used to teach at a school. Kosim wants to increase the quantity of livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. is 38 and married with 6 children (ages 1 - 18).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Maria has 3 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Maria joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maria T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Marianela es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Marianela viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes en general, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor y reparte a las tiendas.
Marianela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Marianela son construir un hotel y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) comunal bank. She is 32 years old, married and has one son. Marianela travels to the “Ayacuchana Jungle” where she sells groceries in bulk, mostly to other stores. She needs a loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,075) to buy rice and sugar. She hopes to someday build a hotel and also hopes that her son can have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Héctor Manuel B. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante y habita en el barrio  la Florida.

El señor Héctor B. es casado y su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía es operaria de limpieza,  ambos luchan para mantener su familia en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Hector works as a security guard in the Chichadega city hall and lives in the Florida neighborhood. He is married and his wife also works as a cleaning lady for the city hall. They both struggle to provide the best possible conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata S.  est âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs  autres ménages au  quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école, issue d’une famille de commerçants, elle commença très tôt auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires, des habits et ustensiles de cuisine, les activités génératrices de revenus.
Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités, elle choisit de se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente de calebasses.   Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis  maintenant  29 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 54 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter,  100 colis de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants  Ségou.
Madame  Fatoumata S.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra d’acheter une charrette et un réfrigérateur. 
Son ambition est  de construire une maison à usage d’habitation
texts.en:
Mrs Fatoumata S., aged 58, is married and the mother of six children. She lives in a traditional family with several other households in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mrs Fatoumata S. did not attend school. She took very early an interest in income generating activities and, since she was born into a family of merchants, she began to work with her mother who sold food condiments, clothes and kitchen utensils. She tried several activities and finally decided to specialize in the trade of calabashes. She has been in this business for 29 years and enjoys a solid reputation among her many customers. She wanted to increase her working capital to meet her customers' demand and came to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has worked with this institution for 54 months. She was granted 3 solidarity loans and 3 individual loans, which have all been repaid on schedule. This is her fourth individual loan. She will use it to buy 100 packages of calabashes in the villages surrounding Ségou. She sells for cash and credit to a clientele made up exclusively of women. Mrs Fatoumata S. expects to earn 75,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to buy a cart and a refrigerator. Her ambition is to build a house for residential use.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calabashes

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, age 47, owns a store where she sells vegetables and other merchandise. She also raises pigs. She has four children, all of whom attend school. One of Rosana's dreams in life is to have all her children finish college and have successful lives. 

Rosana is a member of CEVI and is grateful and happy to have access to its programs. She tells us that her loans have helped both her business and her family. She is now applying for a loan of Php15, 000. She will use it to buy more vegetables and other merchandise for her store. She also hopes to buy additional piglets and food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mirna Esmeralda

texts.es: Mirna Esmeralda B. D. G. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Apopa, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja junto a ella en el negocio, así mismo vive con su sobrino D. 15 años D. edad y su suegra, la cual se dedica a cuidar al joven y a ayudar con los quehaceres del hogar. Mirna se dedica a la venta D. zapatos deportivos, para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo sandalias y zapatos formales para dama. A pesar que cuenta con varios años D. tener el negocio, ella no posee una gran variedad D. zapatos, por lo que desea poder adquirir nuevos estilos y diversidad D. colores y tallas, D. manera que tenga muchas más opciones que ofrecerle a  las personas y D. esta misma forma por el hecho que el negocio esta ubicado en el Parque Bolívar, en el centro D. San Salvador, todos sus productos están a la vista D. la gran afluencia D. personas que transitan en el lugar, desea poder tener diferentes estilos D. sandalias y zapatos para captar D. esta manera mucho más la intención D. las personas; Mirna espera lograr esto por medio D. un préstamo solicitado a Integral por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero para llevar a cabo lo anterior.
texts.en:
Mirna Esmeralda B. D. G. is 37 years old, and lives in Apopa, located in the San Salvador department. She lives together with her husband who also works with her in the business. Their 15 year old nephew also lives with them, and her mother in law, who looks after the young boy and helps around the house. Mirna works selling sports shoes for men, women and children, and also sandals and formal shoes for women. Although she has had the business for several years, she doesn't have a large variety of shoes, and for this reason she wants to acquire new styles and a diversity of colours and sizes. This will mean she has greater options to offer her customers. Her business is located in Bolivar Park, in the centre of San Salvador, and all her products are seen by a large number of people who are in transit in the area. She wants to have different styles of sandals and shoes to capture the attention of more people. Mirna hopes to achieve this goal via a loan with Integral, which will help her achieve the aforementioned goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and sandals

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Chantale

texts.en: Chantale is a single mother, age 42. She has 6 children between the ages 4 and 24. She is sending 5 children to school with her small income that comes from selling salted fish at the fish market. With the loan, she would like to purchase better quality fish for her business and increase her stock as well. She has been selling fish since 1992, starting with just 50,000 CFA (about $100). She has a reputation in her community that she's like a business "man" because she's very strong and exact with her business deals.

loans.use: Purchasing better quality fish for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria, tiene 43 años, es separada y tiene dos hijos, ella es madre y padre de  para sus hijos y les da lo mejor para que ellos puedan ser felices.  Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cuidad de Huambutio y su segunda actividad económica complementaria es vender alfalfa. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.  

Victoria se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Association member Victoria Q. F. is 43 years old, separated, and has two children for whom she acts as both mother and father, giving them the best she can to make them happy. Her main business activity is selling groceries and she has a small grocery store in the city of Huambutio. Her supplementary business activity is selling alfalfa. Victoria Q. F. needs a loan to buy more goods such as rice, sugar and so on. She is grateful for this opportunity and is therefore committed to making the loan repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is 32 years old and married. She operates a fish market business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it. In 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP (her portion of the group loan) which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace wants a loan to clear more land and purchase tea plantlets to expand her tea plantation. In her area, most people rely on tea planting for survival and they have managed to improve tea productivity in Uganda as a whole. She has been in the tea-growing business for 10 years and dreams of becoming a model farmer. Grace started with a small garden that has grown over the years. Like any other farmer, Grace faces the problem of pests and weeds. 

At the age of 32, Grace has four children between the ages of 11 and 2 years old. They live in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

loans.use: To clear more land and purchase tea plantlets to expand her tea plantation

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Sa Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people who all live in Chek village, Takeo province, have selected Mrs. Sareth S. as this village bank president. She was born in 1969. Each member will use their portion of their loan in varied ways to support their businesses. 

Mrs. Sareth S. is a pork and fish seller at her local market, where she can earn a large profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Voeurn Hen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sareth S. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables and pork to resale. 

She is a mother of two children, both of whom are attending school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and pork to resale

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: Dámaso tiene 62 años, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos básicos de cocina como achote, canela, pimienta, sal, comino. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, por lo que ha sido de mucha ayuda. Ha demostrado ser un apersona que paga sus cuotas puntuales, tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que todos los días recorre muchas calles para ofrecer sus diferentes productos. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar canela, salsa de tomate, salsa inglesa, anís, romero, ajo, pimienta y curry. Desea tener un lugar estable para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dámaso is 62 years old, single, and has two children who are studying. He has a business selling basic cooking products such as achiote, cinnamon, pepper, salt, and cumin. This is not the first loan he has taken, and the ones he already received were a great help. Dámaso has demonstrated that he is a person who submits his payments on time. He has been in business for more than six years and spends every day traveling through several streets to offer his various products.

This loan will be used to buy cinnamon, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, anise, rosemary, garlic, pepper, and curry. He wants to have a stable place for his business so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cinnamon, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, anise, rosemary, garlic, pepper, and curry

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old and is married with five adult children. Felix owns and operates a business using a multi-purpose cab to deliver vegetables to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Felix plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto R. N. tiene 33 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos de 10, 8, 7, 6, y 4 anos. 

Luis Alberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Luis Alberto se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y trigo mayormente. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo cada semana. 

Solicita el credito para comprar las semillas para agricultura. Viendo como se produce este ano, se aumenta sus cultivos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y dar algo a la familia. Las lanchas eran fuerte este ano, pero espera superar. 

Le gusta jugar el futbol y el boli.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto R. N. is 33 years old.  He is married and lives in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province.  He has 5 children, ages 10, 8, 7, 6 and 4.

Louis Alberto is a member of the San Isidro rural cooperative, which is located an hour and a half from San Miguel.  There are a total of 10 members, the majority of whom are dedicated to growing corn and wheat.  Luis Alberto is a farmer, who plants primarily corn and wheat.  He does his shopping and sells his product in San Pablo every week.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds for farming.  Seeing how production is this year, he increases his crops.  His goal is to continue working and give something back to his family.  

He enjoys playing soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To buy seeds for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old single from Lebanon. She has been running a tailoring factory for the past 30 years. With this large amount of experience, she has become well known in her town and its surroundings. She produces women's clothes such as robes and skirts and delivers her products to the clothing stores she works with. She used her first loan provided through Kiva to perform maintenance for her machines. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to continue maintenance for her other tailoring machineries. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her factory and expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on tailoring machines

loans.name: Hilol

texts.ru: Алимардонова Хилол проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сама Хилол имеет среднее образование. Более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Она в основном закупает скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Hilol A. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 47 years old, married and has 4 children.  Her son works in Russia.  Hilol has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years.  She breeds livestock at home.  Hilol primarily buys livestock for future resale.  Her husband helps her with this business.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto V. Chacón, tiene la edad de 36  años, es casado, vive con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad por el momento. El quiere comprar abonos y los herbicidas para la mantención del tiquizque y  la semilla del frijol para su posterior siembra. Además, el cuenta con el terreno apto para este proyecto con 3 manzanas de tiquizque sembradas y 4 hectáreas que quiere sembrar de frijol. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y a su vez generar más ingresos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tiene problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva. También, el no   ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene como metas generar  ganancias para su bienestar y darles una mayor calidad de vida a su familia, también a su vez ir generando el dinero para los pagos del préstamo y esperar que le quede un dinero adicional para las temporadas que no se cosecha o se produce en la tierra.
texts.en:
Roberto V. Chacón, 36, is married and lives with his wife and three children who are his greatest priority at the moment.  He wants to buy manure and herbicides to care for the tiquizque (starchy tuber) and for bean seed for subsequent planting.  He has a field that is appropriate for this project with three manzanas (Central American area measurement) planted with tiquizque and four hectares that he wants to plant with beans.  He has been a farmer for several years and wants to grow and generate more income.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has no problems with his property but does want it to become productive.  He has not taken any loans from State-owned banks.  FUDECOSUR offered the loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

His goals are to generate profits for his wellbeing and to provide a better quality of life for his family.  He also wants to produce income to repay the loan and hopes that he will have some left over for the seasons when there are no harvests or when the land is fallow.

loans.use: For bean planting and help with tiquisque (starchy tuber).

loans.name: Kagabi Multi-Purpose-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Twaha K. belongs to the Kagabi Multipurpose Group - Mpigi. He has been running his timber business for eight years in the Kasubi Market. It is a business that this married father of five says brings in weekly proceeds to the tune of 100,000 shillings. 

Twaha also gets additional earnings from a poultry business. He was at first into tree cutting. Twaha describes himself as meticulous and visionary. With this loan, he says he is going to revamp his business with purchases of enough timber to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more timber for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 38-year-old married man and father of five children. He has worked as a car painter for 20 years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy used cars, fix them and trade them in order to increase his income. Ali is happy with his work and seeks perfection at all times. He is working hard to open a big maintenance garage in the future.

loans.use: To buy used cars, fix them and trade them

loans.name: Kayi Youyou

texts.fr: Youyou a 2 enfants  en charge et est âgée de 33 ans. Elle  est mariée à un transitaire. Pour participer au ménage, elle fait la vente de produits génériques. Elle achète ses produits au Ghana à Accra et au Togo-pharma. Dans cette activité, elle compte 4 ans et redistribue ensuite dans une pharmacie à Adakpamé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renouveler les stocks.
texts.en:
Youyou is 33 years old and has two children. She is married to a shipping agent. To play her part in the household, she sells generic pharmaceutical products. 

Youyou buys her products in Accra, Ghana and at Togo-pharma. She then sells them to a pharmacy in Adakpamé. She has been involved in this business activity for four years. 

She is requesting a loan to replenish her stocks.

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel V. S. tiene 43 años de edad, concubinado con la señora Clementina hace 22 años atrás, viven en Colomi hace más 18 de años en la Comunidad Chomoco hacia el sud, tienen 1 hijo dependiente.                                                                                                                                                  
El señor Angel V. y su esposa son agricultores venden papa, haba, oca, papaliza en la feria semanal de Colomi, De tal modo ellos necesitan un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) por la temporada que esta a bajo precio, por esta razón se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a visitar a la zona para otorgarle un crédito , el señor Angel nos cuenta que siempre le gusta aprovechar costos bajos así para luego tener mejores ingresos hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Angel V. S., age 43, has been in a common-law marriage with Clementina for 22 years.  They have lived in Colomi towards the south in the Chomoco community for over 18 years.  They have one dependent child.

Angel V. and his wife are farmers.  They sell potatoes, beans, oca (an Andean tuber), and papalisa (another Andean tuber) at the Colomi weekly fair.

They need a loan to buy organic fertilizer (fowl) during the time that prices are low.  That is why he took the initiative to visit the area in order to get a loan.  Angel tells us that he always like to take advantage of low costs in order to have better income in the future.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to his farming activity

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old and lives with three family members.

In 2008, Amir opened his own food market in a populated area. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling and shutters and renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling and shutters and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 34 years old, owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells soft drinks, food, shampoo, perfume and other products. She typically makes around $2.50 of profit each day to support her family and have a comfortable life. She has been married for many years to Srim, 34, who is a local farmer as well as fast-food seller in and around his community using his existing motor vehicle. They have three children and all of them are students in the public school.

Sok S. runs her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very large as her business has recently reached a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Sok S. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. She will use the rest of her loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband because the old motor has been broken while being used. These are the reasons why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more food, soft drinks, shampoo, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Erika Del  Rosario

texts.es:
Erika es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio sus ventas hace seis años, con el objetivo de apoyar a su familia económicamente.
En donde comienza a vender ropa, cosméticos, por catálogos y adquiere clientela, gracias a su esposo quien labora como supervisor en una empresa privada y financiamiento que obtuvo por medio del préstamo en Afodenic en donde sus productos aumentaron, y ha logrado la captación y aceptación de sus clientes, el cual vende al contado y al crédito.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara ropa escolar, cosméticos para lograr mejor demanda, por el curso de años.
texts.en:
Erika is a small merchant. She began her activity six years ago with the aim of giving financial support to her family. She began selling clothes and cosmetics through catalogues. She acquired customers thanks to her husband who is a supervisor in a private company, and she was granted loans by the microfinance institution Afodenic. She expanded her product range and successfully won and kept customers. She sells for cash and on credit.

She will use her new loan to buy school uniforms and cosmetics to meet the higher demand over the course of years.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of school uniforms and cosmetics to increase her sales

loans.name: Gbomuma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Gbomuma” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva partner, SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is residing in Waterloo together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a security guard and her children are attending school. For 12 years now, Fatmata has been selling flour, groundnuts and caustic soda. She has requested a loan in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.
Also shown on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.

loans.use: To buy flour, groundnuts and caustic soda in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Máxima Maria tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Pues busca la forma de sobrevivir para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios,  ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, pues fue así que decide ofrecer ciertos productos como cremas, colonias y así la mayoría de de sus clientes le hicieron la fama que ella es una excelente vendedora. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo pues así comprara talcos, cremas, pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios. Sueña con tener su propia tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos.
texts.en: Máxima Maria is 36 years old. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. She is seeking a way to live and pay her household expenses. She started this business with her own money, since she has been able to get ahead with a lot of hard work. She decided to offer certain products such as creams and colognes. Most of her customers gave her good publicity because she is a good saleswoman. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital. She will buy powders, creams, nail polish, and lipsticks. She dreams of having her own store where she can offer her products.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, nail polish, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Genny

texts.es:
En el año 1977 Genny  V. D. Benítez, mujer casada y con 3 hijos en las edades D. 26 a 34 años,  despertó su gusto por embellecer la imagen personal y profesional D. la gente, así fue como empezó capacitándose  y practicando lo aprendido en  diversas salas D. belleza  D. la ciudad amurallada D. Colombia, Cartagena D. Indias, donD. adquirió gradualmente  una clientela propia. En el año 1985 cuando contrajo matrimonio por sugerencia D. su esposo, instaló su salón D. belleza en su casa, su experiencia y seriedad en el servicio la llevó a incrementar su clientela  y hoy su negocio es muy reconocido en el barrio. Su esposo es taxista y maneja  ingresos  variables y el negocio que con su apoyo inició, ha servido D. mucho para el  sostenimiento D. este hogar y para lograr sueños conjuntos, como la educación D. sus hijos. Actualmente Genny esta ahorrando para  adquirir su vivienda propia y esta es su   meta y gran desafío, al que ella y su cónyuge  se han propuesto, desD. hace mucho tiempo.
Su credikiva es el octavo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores ha logrado capitalizar su microempresa, adecuar  el local  y comprar diferentes equipos muy  necesarios para el buen manejo D. ella.   Su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra D. productos para  la Belleza Capilar  en mayor volumen, con  los cuales ahorrará y también los negociará entre sus clientes,  que al pedirle asesoría se convierten en un mercado potencial para intervenirlo.  En un futuro  Genny  espera hacer más confortable sus instalaciones y ella sueña con  tener un local a un lado D. la casa, la que mas adelante planea comprar, y en lo que ella y su esposo están dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Genny V. D. Benítez is married and has 3 kids who range in age from 26 to 34 years old.  In 1997 she took an interest helping people improve their personal and professional appearance.   As a result, she began to teach herself and to practice what she learned from various beauty salons located in Cartagena, Columbia, where she gradually gained a customer base.  In 1985, the year she married her husband, she opened a beauty salon in her home. 

Her experience and dedication to her work lead to an increased customer base.  Today her business is very well known in her neighborhood.  Her husband is a taxi driver and his income varies.  Genny’s business, that she started with the help of her husband, has aided greatly in sustaining their home and in reaching their common goals, such as their children’s education.  

Currently, Genny is saving in order to acquire their own home, for which she and her husband have been budgeting for a long time. 

This will be her eighth Kiva loan through Funcación Mario Santo Domingo.  The previous loans served as start-up capital for her small business.  She was able to get it ready and buy the necessary equipment.  

She plans to use the loan to buy hair care products, in bulk, in order to save money.  She will sell the products to her clients, who, when asking her advice, become potential buyers.  Looking forward, Genny hopes to make her salons more comfortable.  With that, she hopes to open a salon on one siD. of her home, which she plans to buy.  Towards this end, she and her husband are directing all of their effort.

loans.use: To purchase hair care products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana y su esposo son una pareja ya grande de edad, los hijos que tuvieron  ya son personas que están mayores y cuentan con sus propias familias. Por lo que estas personas ya se encuentran solos, que solo dependen de su misma pensión que reciben cada mes. 
Juana desea remodelar su cocina ya que con los años se fue deteriorando y necesita algunas mejoras para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Juana and her husband are a couple who are already advanced in years.  Their children are grown up and have their own families.  For this reason, Juana and her husband now live alone.  They now rely solely on their pension that they receive every month.

Juana would like to remodel her kitchen since it has worn out over the years and she needs to make some improvements.  In order to carry out her project, she needs to buy materials and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Guadalupe J. que tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria ya que sus padres no tenian los recursos para darle mas estudios, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que asisten a la escuela en su cominidad.

Doña guadalupe nos platica que que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella nos platica que vende refrescos en su casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos platica que la venta es buena ya que "no sabemos comer sin un refresco en la mesa", ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos para resurtir su credito. ella desea en un futuro poder construir un pequeño local en el cual vendera sus refrescos y espera poder invertir un poco en abarrotes para hacer crecer su negocio.
ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion ya que con este credito podra hacer crecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec which has a very large lake that provides a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  Guadalupe J. lives in this community.  Guadalupe is 33 years old and only studied up to the second year of elementary school since her parents didn't have enough money to pay for any further studies.  She is married and has two children who are attending elementary school in her community. 

Guadalupe tells us that a little over two years ago she decided to start working in her own business so that she could help her husband with their household expenses and pay for their children's education.  She tells us that she sells soft drinks from her home.  She sells to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She says that her sales are good because "we don't know how to eat without a soft drink on the table".  Guadalupe needs this loan to invest in buying soft drinks to restock her business.  In the future, she would like to build a small sales location where she could sell her soft drinks and she hopes to invest a little in groceries so that she can grow her business.

Guadalupe is very grateful to Fundación Realidad since this loan will enable her to grow her business and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks

loans.name: Los Heroes Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Los Herores" estan ubicados cerca del centro del Municipio de San Felipe del progreso, para mayor referencia hay un Hospital General y una unidad Deportiva cerca del domicilio donde se reune el grupo, los integrantes son 8 personas y viven muy cerca cada una, se conocen desde hace vaR. años y todos confian en cada uno del grupo, el grupo en general comenta que se llaman así porque de todos los nombres que mencionaron vaR. ya estaban ocupados y el de los Heroes les gusto mas, los 8 integrantes son personas que se dedican al comercio por ejemplo este es el caso del Señor Rogelio que se dedica al comercio y su negocio es vender productos de limpieza como: suavitel para lavar la ropa, tambien clarasol y fabuloso para lavar los pisos y hacer el aseo de la casa. Don Rogelio lleva 4 años con este negocio por eso comenta que pasa por vaR. desafios como transportar el producto en una camionetita y hacer el gasto diario de gasolina, tambien como la camioneta se usa diario y son distancias grandes las recorre se tiene que hacer el servico seguido de la camioneta y hacer vaR. cambios, otro desafio que encuantra es que los precios suben y el tiene que dar un puco mas caro, si esto pasa don Rogelio sale perdiendo ya que sus clientes le reclaman porque volvio a subir y a el no le conviene porque va perdiendo clientes y los gastos que el hace con su camioneta sigen siendo los mismos ó mas caro, Don Rogelio dice; "el prestamo me va beneficiar por medio de los ingresos que vaya teniendo por medio de las ganancias de cada producto que se venda, de esta manera yo pueda mantener a mi familia" mis metas son engrandecer el negocio hasta poner un local para evitar tantos viajes, como tambien saber elaborar el producto, ya que compro el producto echo, pero no se como prepararlo y que tantas cosas sirven para hacerlo, Don Rogelio tiene 3 hijos, el pequeño es un niño de tres años, los dos mas grandes estudian la escuela primaria y la secundaria, don Rogelio vive en union libre hace ya 14 años y de edad tiene 46 años, vive en casa propia y su esposa es ama de casa, Los demas compañeros de don Rogelio son comerciantes tambien y sus negocios son los siguientes;
1.-Elidia, tiene un tienda de abarrotes
2.-Sonia, cria pollos y guajolotes y productos de belleza
3.-Anastacio, vende frituras chcharrones de cuadro
4.-Ma Agustina, vende ropa de segunda mano
5.-Natalia, vende pollos y verdura
6.-Georgina, tiene un taqueria
7.-Lilia vende Jarceria. Estos son los 8 integrantes del grupo de los "Heroes" y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group is called "Los Heroes" and they are situated close to the town centre of San Felipe del Progreso (for further reference: there is a General Hospital and a sports centre near to the house where the group meet). There are 8 members in the group and they live close to each other. They have known each other for many years and they all trust each other. As a group, they say that they have called themselves by this name because all the names they came up with were already taken, and they liked their chosen name best. The 8 members all run businesses, as is the case with Señor Rogelio who runs a business selling cleaning products: 'Suavitel' for laundry, along with 'Clarasol' and 'Fabuloso' for cleaning floors and other surfaces in the home.
Don Rogelio has run this business for 4 years and he tells us that he has faced many challenges, such as transporting the products in his little van; having to pay daily for gas; also as he uses the van daily for travelling long distances he has to take the van for services and pay for maintenance. Another challenge comes from rising costs which means he would have to sell his products at a higher price. If this happens, Don Rogelio ends up operating at a loss as he does not pass on these price rises to his clients. If he keeps on increasing his prices then he will lose his clients, and the costs that he must pay for his van continue to be the same or higher. Don Rogelio says, 'the loan is going to improve the income I receive from the sale of each product, and so I will be able to provide for my family'. His goals are to increase the size of his business until he has his own shop, so that he will not have to make so many journeys, as well as learning how to make the product, as he currently buys the product ready made but does not know how to prepare it and many items are needed to make it. 

Don Rogelio is 46 years old and has three children. The youngest is three years old and his two older children are at primary and secondary school respectively. Don Rogelio has been with his partner for 14 years, they live in their own home and his partner is a housewife. The other members in Don Rogelios group are also businesspeople, and their businesses are as follows:   

1.-Elidia, runs a general store
2.-Sonia, raises chickens and turkeys and sells beauty products
3.-Anastacio, sells fried snacks
4.-Ma Agustina, sells second hand clothes
5.-Natalia, sells chicken and vegetables
6.-Georgina, sells tacos
7.-Lilia sells domestic products. These are the 8 members of "Heroes" and their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for laundry and domestic cleaning

loans.name: Mwanafuraha

texts.en:
Mwanafuraha is a married woman with 5 children, 2 of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Mwanafuraha has been operating a grocery selling business where she sells vegetables and fruits to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a charcoal selling business, which contributes as her other source of income. 

Mwanafuraha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry hot season, the availability of vegetables and fruits is minimal and the demand is high, while during the cold rainy season the availability of green grocery is high in supply and demand is low. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in her business in the future.

With this loan for 30,000 Kshs, Mwanafuraha wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Jhon Henry

texts.es:
Jhon Henry es un joven emprendedor que asume los gastos del hogar donde vive con su madre, desde pequeño este emprendedor se sintió atraído por las ventas, fue entonces cuando estando apenas en el colegió decidió empezar a vender algunos dulces en su casa, después de graduarse y debido a la falta de oportunidades para continuar con sus estudios decidió crear su propia tienda la cual ha ido surtiendo poco a poco con las ganancias generadas. 

Actualmente Jhon Henry necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido de carnes frías y pollo congelado debido a que en este tipo de productos para la demanda actual, este crédito se traducirá en mayores ingresos y así caminar poco a poco hasta convertir su sueño de tener un gran supermercado en una realidad.
texts.en: Jhon Henry is a young businessman who is responsible for the household expenses where he lives with his mother.  From the time he was young, Jhon was drawn towards sales.  It was then that he started selling a few sweets and snacks from his house while he was still in school.  After he finished school, and with little opportunity to continue his education, he decided to open his own shop where he slowly began to stock more and more everyday items such as groceries and household goods.   Today, Jhon is requesting the loan to purchase an assortment of frozen meats and chicken.  With the current demand for these items, this loan will translate into greater sales and income, so that little by little Jhon can convert his dream of having a large supermarket into a reality.

loans.use: to purchase frozen meat and chicken to sell

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 56 years of age.  He is married and is blessed with 3 children. He has been growing rice for almost 30 years. His net income from the last crop is 35,000 PHP. 

Arsenio is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He felt glad that his business income is now good enough to support his family's daily needs. He would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in his next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of his business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Wangeci

texts.en:
Wangeci has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years. She is 45 and the single mother of five school-going children.

Wangeci was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 27,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more goods for resale in her shop.

In the future, Wangeci hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods for resale.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la Ceiba un vecindario ubicado en la ciudad de León, ella es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo y tres son independientes, ella es comerciante , su nivel académico es básico solo curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria. El oficio de comerciante lo aprendió por medio de su madre ya que tenia un tramo en el mercado de venta de mercadería en general y ella ayudaba a su mama a vender, al cumplir 22 años comenzó a vender ropa ambulante y posteriormente puso un negocio de venta de comida y vender sopa en su casa.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa y zapatos para vender. Pues la visión que tiene de su negocio es tener una tienda de ropa y mercadería en su casa. Desea mejorar y expandir su negocio tener estantes donde poner su mercadería exhibirla con una mejor presentación y atraer mas clientes y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and lives in La Ceiba, a neighborhood of the city of León.  She is the mother of five children, two of whom are still in her care and three of whom live independently.  She is a saleswoman.  She has a basic level of education, as she only studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She learned the sales trade from her mother since she used to have a stall in the market where she sold general merchandise and María helped her to sell her products.  When she reached the age of 22, María started selling clothes as an itinerant vendor and then she set up a business selling food and soup in her home.

María requested this loan to buy merchandise such as clothes and shoes to sell.  Her vision for her business is to have a store in her home where she sells clothes and merchandise.  She would like to improve and expand her business and have shelves where she can better display her merchandise and attract more customers.  She would like to enjoy better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor julio cesar vive en la ciudad de Managua  es padre de familia responsable en su trabajo .
Don julio visito nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en el  cambio del techo de su casa de habitación .los materiales que el señor va a comprar es cinc, madera ya que con la llegada del invierno es necesario hacer eso cambio.
Agradece  a ceprodel ya con este financiamiento podrá mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Cesar lives in the city of Managua. Through his work, he has demonstrated that he is a responsible father.

Don Julio visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he can invest in the replacement of the roof on his house. He plans to buy materials such as zinc and wood. With the arrival of winter, it is necessary to make this change.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for this loan so that he can improve his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and established a retail store four years ago. The cash inflow from it satisfies their needs. The store offers highly demanded merchandise - grocery, school and office supplies. Neda normally receives PHP 7,000 a month. This includes other irregular sources of income.

Neda joined GDMPC earlier this year. It has been her long time plan to join the cooperative, which was currently realized, for an opportunity to access the quality services offered. On her first loan application, she is requesting PHP 5,000. With the loaned amount, she can now purchase grocery supplies to sell at a profit.

 Neda expects to earn more income and expand the scope of her business to improve her entrepreneurial capacity and current living situation as well.

loans.use: To purchase grocery supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La señora  María Estela vive en un barrio  en el que las personas   viven en un lugar que es como una ladera y se puede ver todo el pueblo, ella es casada  con el señor  Jorge Amín y con quien procreo  dos hijos  que aun  viven con ella.

   Estela se dedica a su hogar y también  trabaja de afanadora en  banco, así también solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la  compra  de materiales  para elaborar piñatas en la que  practica desde hace cuatro año  y le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido también  buen resultado.

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya  que  recibió  curso y le gusto practicarlo y ve que si le está  dando buen resultado ya que le encargan  en la fiestas de cumpleaños  y la elabora como sus clientes prefieren.

    Lo que más desea es que a hora que ya tiene un local  pueda agrandar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos  y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Señora María Estela lives in a neighbourhood that is like living on a hillside where you can see the whole town. She is married to Señor Jorge Amín with whom she has 2 children who live with her. 

Estela takes care of her home and also works as a cleaner in a bank. She asked for the loan in order to buy the materials to make piñatas, something she has been doing for 4 years and which is going well with good results. 

She was inspired to take up this craft as a result of a course she took. She likes to practice and see that it is paying off, being hired for birthday parties and making the piñatas that her clients prefer. 

What she wants most of all, now that she has a place to work, is to grow her business to improve her income and continue working.

loans.use: to buy the materials necessary to make piñatas.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 27 and has been involved in mixed farming for 5 years, producing vegetables, eggs and timber for the local market. She is married and has 4 children, all in schooling.

Hellen has made a third loan request, with Juhudi Kilimo, for a loan of 100,000 KES. With the loan, she will purchase a power saw for her lumbering business and poultry birds to boost her poultry farming business. She says she will also use the income to buy dairy a cow for her dairy farming business too. She adds that previous loans have uplifted her living standards and she believes the third loan will make it much better.

She notes that the high cost of feed is a challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw and poultry birds

loans.name: 02.06.03.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Lý is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 02.06.03 Đông Hải solidarity group. With her 2 dependents, she lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs Lý has a service business tailoring clothes. Lý has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to provide tailoring and clothing repair services. 

In 2010, Lý joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has since successfully repaid 6 loans from them.
In the future, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines to provide tailoring and clothing repair services.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen un hija a su cargo actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Ramona desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos economicos  para poder realizar de una sola vez la mejora a su humilde vivienda ;  ya que es de muy escasos recursos , ella necesita comprar zinc ya que en tiempos de lluvia se inunda la vivienda  y algunos materiales de construcción como bloque , cemento , arena , entre otros para cambiar de tablas a concreto , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos no fuese posible realizar el sueño de ver  su casita convertida en un techo digno .
texts.en:
Ramona lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her husband helps her with household expenses; they have a daughter in their care.  Her plan for the family is to improve their quality of life.  Ramona has worked for a private firm for several years.  

The greatest problem she currently faces is not having economic resources to improve her humble dwelling all at once because her resources are so limited.  She needs to buy metal sheeting because during the rainy season her house floods and some other building materials like concrete block, cement and sand, among other, to change from wood panels to concrete.  

She is grateful for the support Afodenic, though Kiva funds, provides because without that support it would be impossible for her to make her dream of turning her little house into a proper home come true.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Arsenita

texts.en:
Arsenita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arsenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arsenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arsenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school aged children. He’s the only income provider of his family. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past seven years and this is his only main income source. He took advantage from two Kiva loans and we note that he has a very good repayment history. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van including changing its wheels. This will help him proceed with his business operation targeting larger clientele . In the future, he plans to collect enough money and buy a bigger van.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van including changing its wheels

loans.name: Carlomagno

texts.es: Carlomagno, de 27 años de edad. Vive en compañía de sus dos suegros, su pareja, sus dos cuñados, y tres sobrinos, en casa de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Carlomagno es el dar servicio de transporte contando para esto con un mototaxi que es de su propiedad, con el cual sale todos los días a la ciudad de Pucallpa a recorrer sus calles en busca de pasajeros locales y turistas, brindándoles un buen servicio y en ocasiones logrando ganarse la amistad de sus clientes. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y se siente satisfecho de por los ingresos que le genera, ya que gracias a ello logró solventar los gastos de su hogar, y con lo que ha ahorrado pudo comprar su propio mototaxi. Sin embargo debe cuidarse mucho para evitar los asaltos de vehículos. Su plan próximo es comprar otro mototaxi y así dar la oportunidad de empleo a otra persona.  Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de otro mototaxi, para lo cual cuenta con unos ahorros y más el préstamo, logrará pagar la cuota inicial de la nueva unidad, así podrá tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Carlomagno is 27 years old. He lives with his in-laws, his partner, his two brothers-in-law, and three nephews in his in-laws' house. Carlomagno has a transportation service, in which he uses a motorcycle taxi that he owns. With it, he goes out every day to the city of Pucallpa to ride the streets in search of local passengers and tourists. He provides them with good service and occasionally wins the friendship of his customers. He has been doing this for five years, and he is satisfied with the earnings it brings in for him, since through it he was able to meet his household expenses, and with what he has saved he was able to buy his own motorcycle taxi. Nevertheless, he has to be very careful in order to avoid vehicle assaults. His next plan is to buy another motorcycle taxi and thus provide the opportunity for employment to another person. This will be his third loan with MFP, and he hopes for the support of each one of you in order to continue with his work. He will use the amount requested to purchase another motorcycle taxi, which he will pay for using some savings plus the loan. He will be able to make the down payment for the new motorcycle. In this way, he will be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del centro poblado Poccona, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos de la región.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que utilizará para comprar cuarenta arrobas de habas, cañihua y cebada.
Su esposo tuesta los productos y Elena se encarga de venderlos molido, a veces su esposo se va a zarandear habas a la localidad de Yunguyo.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Candelaria” which is located in the central village of Poccona in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and has five children who are of school age.

Elena has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN. The money was invested in her business of selling regional products.

She is requesting a new loan of 1000 PEN so that she can buy 40 units of beans, quinoa, and barley. Her husband will acquire these products and Elena will be in charge of selling them after they have been milled. Sometimes her husband travels to the town of Yunguyo to acquire the beans.

Her dream for the future is to continue working in her business and improving her income. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings.

loans.use: to buy 40 units of beans, quinoa, and barley.

loans.name: Rufina M

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Rufina from Chitungwiza, a high-density suburb located about 30 km from the capital city, Harare. She is married and has four children, three attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Rufina runs a clothing business selling ladies' outfits, menswear and shoes. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge is competition with established companies. 

Rufina has requested a loan of $600 to buy clothes and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be in a position to pay school fees and look after the family. 

In the future, Rufina plans to open a shop in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sreyneat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district, Sreyneat is 31 years old and has made her living as a peasant who grows maize and peanuts. She has been in this business for more than three years. She has four children who help her work on the farm. 

Sreyneat leads a group of two female members who are with VisionFund this loan cycle. She wants to use the entire loan to pay for labor in harvesting maize crop and plowing her farmland, and to buy maize seeds for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her maize crop and prepare land for planting. Also, she hopes to sell the crops for a good price to earn more income to live better.

loans.use: To pay for labor in harvesting maize crop and plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Pablo Boanerges

texts.es:
Pablo Boanerges tiene 46 años es casado vive con la esposa  y con los hijos de 15 y 18 años. Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 30 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  comprar un terreno.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Pablo Boanerges is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife and children who are 15 and 18. He lives in the América township in the canton of Ventanas.

The communal bank "Unidos Venceremos" [Together We Win] is located in the América township belonging to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short-cycle farming, growing corn and rice.

Pablo has devoted himself to growing corn for 30 years. He purchases his supplies in Ventanas and sells his crops in the market there as well. 

The requested loan is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for growing corn and rice. The loan has allowed him to increase his earnings for family consumption and for investment. His dream is to have his own plot of land. 

In his free time he likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilize for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Boris Carnot Dagobert

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, il se lance dans la vente d’huile en 2000  quand il arrête ses études en classe de terminale par manque de moyen.
Au commencement il avait la capacité de s’acheter seulement un a deux bidons d’huile  de 25 l, et depuis qu’il est client de Hope sa capacité d’achat a largement augmenter.
A l’octroi de ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en ajoutant 25 bidons de 25 l d’huile et 10 bidons de 25 l d'huile de palme, et après ses produits sont vendus en détail  auprès de ses potentiels clients.
Très pragmatique, il a une grande capacité de vente  et a pour projet d’ouvrir un grand dépôt d'huile  d’arachide et d’huile de palme.
texts.en:
Boris Carnot Dagobert, aged 38, is single and cares for two children. In 2000 he left school in his final year because he lacked financial resources, and began selling oil. In the beginning he could buy only 1 or 2 cans of oil of 25 liters, but when he became a client of the microfinance institution Hope S.A., his purchasing capacity increased substantially.

He will use this new loan to increase his inventory by buying 25 cans of oil of 25 liters and 10 cans of palm oil of 25 liters and then he will sell his merchandise to potential customers.

A very pragmatic man endowed with a great ability to sell, he plans to open a large warehouse of groundnut oil and palm oil.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and groundnut oil.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself as an  innovative and God-fearing woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy and  viable area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more  clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. Perla has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for almost 11 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy snacks, canned goods and vegetables to sell. Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell including snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 31 years, food kiosk owner at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of three who has been in this business for the last fifteen years doing well, and the husband gives her additional support.

This is her first borrowing to finance her business, she will use the money to  purchase cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves, sugar and the anticipated profit to open up a second business of firewood. She hopes to own a restaurant in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves, sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy shares from stock exchange market

loans.name: Raesa

texts.en: Raesa has 10 years experience in tailoring. She buys cloth, threads, and other materials needed to design and sew clothes for customers in her neighborhood. She requests a loan of $175 so she can purchase an electronic sewing machine which will enable her to create more designs and clothes and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine sewing supplies

loans.name: Amid

texts.en: Amid A. is 27 years old and a young businessman. He lives in Saatli and rents a small store where he sells stocks, towels, kerchiefs, gloves and other small things since 1998. He is married and has one child. In  he applied for a $1000 USD loan to enlarge his store, and he plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make it even larger and to begin selling women’s clothes.

loans.use: Mr. Agayev would like to enlarge his store and begin selling women’s clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
