loans.use: Invest in new merchandise

loans.name: Gandab

texts.en: Gandab is a 57 year old widow with four children. She lives in the Hasanli village in  Salyan region of Azerbaijan, where she has owned and operated a vineyard for the last twenty years. Gandab has applied for a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita, is a woman who works very happily, she spends as much time as possible in her small shop attending to all the residents of her community. She has four sons whom she adores and tries to give them everything they need. However, recently she went through one of the biggest scares of her life - her youngest son (only seven years old) fell on the farm and unfortunately on one of the machetes they use to cut their crops. This resulted in a very deep cut to his small stomach, and he had to be urgently transferred to the hospital in the city of Merced, where he was hospitalized for a week. As a result of this unexpected tragic accident Margarita had to incur various expenses due to the hospitalization of her son. This is why she has asked for a loan to help them improve their sales and bring in more business. You can help make this family live as happily and united as before.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Margarita, es una mujer que trabaja muy alegremente, le dedica el mayor tiempo posible a su pequeña tienda a la que concurren todos los pobladores de su comunidad en busca de los artículos que necesitan diariamente. Ella tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son su adoración y a los que les brinda todo cuanto pueda tener, sin embargo una mañana pasó por uno de sus mayores sustos y preocupaciones, su menor hijo de tan sólo siete años cayó en su chacra y por desgracia sobre el machete que utilizan para cortar sus productos que por su naturaleza ocasionó un corte muy profundo en el estómago del pequeño, quién tuvo que ser trasladado con urgencia al hospital de la ciudad de la Merced en donde recibió atención y estuvo internado por una semana. A consecuencia de este inesperado accidente Margarita tuvo que realizar diversos gastos frente a la hospitalización de su pequeño hijo para su pronta recuperación y bienestar.Es por eso que pide y solicita un préstamo que les ayude a mejorar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos y recuperarse de esta terrible tragedia.Tú puedes hacer que esta familia siga viviendo tan feliz y unida como hasta ahora..

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell in her small grocery store.

loans.name: Sauleola

texts.en: Sauleola lives near the town area. She is from the village of Vaigaga and she is fifty-five years of age. She is a grandmother but she is still active at running her business, while providing lunches for all the students of Vaigaga Primary School. She sells Ice cakes, pork buns, chocolates, snacks, and ice cream which are the favourite munchies for children. She sells her products five days a week and she manage to earn $500 WST ($200 USD) a week. This is her major source of income and she is still running her business successfully. She is one of the active members of the programme and she is very honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her canteen business and for home improvement

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
A married father of two children, Mr. Kokou Etse is 30 years old and has owned a general store for the last two years. His shop is located in the Assahoun market. With this loan, he would like to increase his business capacity by purchasing five bags of rice, ten boxes of canned goods, five bags of granulated sugar, seven boxes of soap and five boxes of milk. This will allow him to meet his customers’ constantly growing demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de 02 enfants, monsieur Kokou ETSE est âgé de 30 ans et propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 02 ans. Sa boutique est installée dans le marché de ASSAHOUN. Il souhaite par le présent emprunt augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant 05 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de boîtes de conserves ; 05 sacs de sucres en poudre, 07 cartons de savons et 05 cartons de laits. Ceci pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante

loans.use: Purchase of 5 bags of rice, 10 boxes of canned goods, 5 bags of granulated sugar, 7 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of milk in order to meet customer demand, allowing him to increase his sales and earn a higher profit so he can improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en: Fatimon B. is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells cooked food in her community. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2002. She requests a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more foodstuffs for cooking food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khan Y., 54, is a widow with one child. She works selling second hand clothes in a market and makes around $3 a day of profit. Her daughter, Ms. Oun Sreymom, 18, is a singer in a restaurant. On average, she earns $5 in daily wages.

Mrs. Khan Y. needs to add to her clothes inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth K. is a 60-year-old widow with five children who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and makes about $1 a day. One of her children is married and lives away from home, two have opened a small shop Phnom Penh city where they earn about $5 a day selling food, and two others are farmers.

The business in Phnom Penh city is doing very well, which is why Meth K. has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy more chairs, tables and other supplies. This will allow the family to expand the business and earn more income.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more chairs, tables and other supplies.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi A.  is a manufacturer of a local gin (beverage). He is married and has four children. Business is doing very well and he wishes to increase production and sales. He is requesting a loan to purchase additional raw materials for production of the local drink.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production of a local beverage.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S. lives in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a middle(wo)man who buys bitter melons from villagers and resells them for a profit. Mrs. Phorn S.’s business has improved, so she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Phorn S. is requesting a loan to buy more bitter melons to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Soy Sun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phorn S. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Phorn S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. Last year, one of her children got malaria and she spent $125 to have her cured. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more bitter melons to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is a mother of 3 school age children and is the wife of a mototaxi driver that who supports her work. She sells breads and snacks to a variety of friends and neighbors who place their orders biweekly and who Olga responds to politely. Besides this activity, she also sells chickens at various markets which she does to periodically supplement her daily earnings and above all for the cost of educating her children. Therefore, now wants to increase sales of her products and this requires an amount of money that would help to soon become a distributor and sell at wholesale. Olga looks to you in search of this economic support she needs. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es madre de 3 hijos quienes aún son escolares y es esposa de un esforzado chofer de mototaxi a quien apoya con su trabajo, ella vende panes y bocaditos que ofrece a diversas amistades y vecinos quienes quincenalmente hacen sus pedidos y doña Olga los atiende amablemente. A parte de esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de pollo en los mercados, lo que realiza periódicamente como un apoyo adicional en los ingresos diarios de su hogar y sobre todo para los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Por ello, ahora desea incrementar la venta de sus productos y para ello requiere de una cantidad de dinero que le ayudaría a convertirse pronto en distribuidora y vender al por mayor. Olga recurre a usted en busca de ese apoyo económico que necesita.

loans.use: Increase in capital to buy additional merchandise to sell at wholesale.

loans.name: Tuhfanisso

texts.ru:
Tuhfanisso R. lives in the Jallolidini Rumy region. She is 49 years old, divorsed, and lives with her son. To provide for her family, she owns a business. She sells clothing. So that she could purchase seasonal items, she plans to obtain a loan. She will be paying off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахматова Тухфаниссо проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Разведена. Живет с сыном. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью занимается бизнесом. Торгует на рынке одеждой.Для того , чтобы закупить сезонный товар к осеннему сезону , планирует получить кредит и завезти товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Thi Van's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Vân năm nay 35 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0001. Vay 5.152.000 đồng. Chị Vân vay vốn cùng chồng đi buôn nứa về để đan giường và làm tráng bánh đa. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Ngoài ra, chị còn làm công tác xã hội như làm chi hội phó phụ nữ thôn. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000đồng/ ngày.
Trong nhóm chị gồm:
<li> Nguyễn Thị Phương: 40 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0002. Vay 4.704.000đồng. Chị Phương vay vốn để làm nghề mỳ và chăn nuôi.
<li> Tô Thị Hiệp: 38 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0003. Vay : 4.704.000 đồng. Chị Hiệp vay vốn để chăn nuôi và làm nghề tráng mỳ bán.
<li> Nguyễn Thị Thanh: 61 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0004. Vay : 3.808.000 đồng. Cô Thanh vay vốn để chăn nuôi.
<li> C. Thị Bé: 43 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0006. Vay: 3.808.000 đồng. Cô Bé vay vốn về để chăn nuôi.
<li> Nguyễn Thị Thu: 49 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0005. Vay: 4.704.000 đồng. Cô Thu vay vốn về để đi chợ buôn bán hoa quả.
<li> C. Thị Ninh: 51 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0007. Vay: 4.256.000 đồng. Cô Ninh vay vốn về để đi chợ buôn bán quần áo.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Vân (13.03.0001), 35 years old, borrowing 5.152.000đ. With her husband, she trades bamboo for bed-knitting and produces dry pancakes. She has two school age children. Besides, she also performs social work T. help the village's women. The family's income is about 200.000đ per day. Her group includes:
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Phương (13.03.0002), 40 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. make noodles and raise animals.
  • Ms. Tô Thị Hiệp (13.03.0003), 38 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. make noodles and raise animals.
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thanh (13.03.0004), 61 years old, borrowing 3.808.000đ in order T. farm animals.
  • Ms. C. Thị Bé (13.03.0006), 43 years old, borrowing 3.808.000đ in order T. farm animals.
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thu (13.03.0005), 49 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. buy and sell fruit at the market.
  • Ms. C. Thị Ninh (13.03.0007), 51 years old, borrowing 4.256.000đ in order T. buy and sell clothing at the market.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading and animal farming

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en el Jr.16 de Noviembre Nº.161-AA.HH. “Las Américas” del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 1 hija mayor de edad, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos  de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de ropas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco  Comunal. 

En la actualidad  cuenta con el negocio de producto de belleza venta de “UNIQUE y NATURA”, brindándole grandes ganancias, permitiéndole pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con el  préstamo de S/.1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses invertirá en la compra de : 1 vitrina y productos de UNIQUE y NATURA. 

Marina demuestra alegría en su rostro, por la oportunidad que le  brinda la vida, y por ende agradece al Movimiento de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Galacticas 2" which is located at Jr.16 de Noviembre Nº.161-AA.HH. "Las Américas" of the Callería district in the department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old and has a daughter. She used the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos to invest in the sale of clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Her current business consists of selling "Unique y Natura" beauty products. This business has been profitable for her and has allowed her to pay her loan promptly. The current loan she is requesting in the amount of $600 will be used to purchase a display case and "Unique y Natura" products. Mariana will repay this loan in 4 months. Mariana's happiness is reflected in her face. She is happy for the opportunity that life has granted her and is grateful to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of display case.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo A. est un vaillant commerçant à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgé de 45 ans, il est marié et père de 5 enfants. Etant donné que la demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus exigeante, Kodjo désire avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle. Il va dans le même sens une augmentation de ses profits et par là une amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kodjo A., 45, is a hard-working businessman in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is married and the father of 5 children. Since his customers' demands are becoming more and more exigent, Kodjo wants this loan to restock his shop to respond to the needs of his clientele. With this done, he will also see an increase in his profit and thus an improvement in his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise to re-sell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs. Vanny S. is a villager in Ang Doung village in Kandal Province. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a driver in the company. The others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Sun Phang, is a fisherman. Mrs. Vanny S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. In the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have rice seed and she needs to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. To solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan and she would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy K. is a villager in Takoul village in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns one hectare to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Loem Sin, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than is necessary to provide better conditions for the family. Also, the family members live in an old house. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Thy K. decided to ask for a loan to combine with her savings to build a new house for the family. Mrs. Thy K. is 35 years old and the mother of five children -- two of whom are construction workers, while another two are attending the local school, and the youngest one is only a year old and too young to work or study.

loans.use: To help build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim T. has been running her business for a long time. She was born in 1964 and is married. She sells groceries out of her house for income, and she can make around US$ 5 per day. She has three children; two of them are married and live away from home, and the other one is single and is employed as a garment worker. She is married to Nou Korng, age 46, and makes a living raising animals at their home.

T. is operating her business well because she is skilled in communication with her village. Because the grocery store is T.'s important source to earn income to help meet her family's needs, she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery inventory for sale. She lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Koumassifio   T.

texts.fr: Né le 22/11/1962 à Aného, M D. T. Koumassifio est marié et père de quatre enfants. Très entreprenant, il sollicite un financement pour acheter un petit frigo pour la vente des produits congelés. Sa femme étant alitée depuis 3 ans, il est seul à s’occuper de la famille. Ce fonds de roulement lui permettra de   dégager des bénéfices qui pourront l’aider dans l’éducation de ses enfants et le traitement de sa femme.
texts.en:
Born on November 22, 1962 in Aného, Mr. T. Koumassifio D. is married and the father of four. A very enterprising man, he is requesting financing to buy a small refrigerator for selling frozen products. Because his wife has been bedridden for three years, he alone takes care of his family. As working capital, these funds will enable him to clear a profit that will help in educating his children and in providing treatment for his wife.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small refrigerator for selling frozen goods

loans.name: Belawu

texts.en:
Belawu M. is 50 years old. She is widowed and has four children. All her children are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood where she sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, etc. She also sells other food stuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, pepper, etc.

It has been her dream to expand her shop by adding other food stuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She hopes to receive GH¢900 to restock her inventory. Belawu belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’ which means ‘It is only God who can do it’.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Frnacisco inició el negocio para tener más ingreso ya que con el sueldo que gana en su otro trabajo no completa con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó el negocio en Julio de 1999 inicio el negocio con un préstamo que le hizo su mamá, quien también se dedica a la venta en mercados ambulantes, con eso empezó el a vender  aparatos electricos.

Actualmente le ha ido bien ya que se ha incrementado su inventario, y tiene más mercancia, pudo comprar una camioneta, que es indispensable ya que los mercados en donde se instala son ambulantes y la necesitaba para trasladar su mercancia sin que se le maltrate.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $6,000 para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco started his business to have more income since the pay that his other job gave him did not pay for all of the expenses of his house. He started the business with a loan that his mother gave him in July of 1999. His mother makes a living by selling at traveling markets. His business specializes in the sale of electrical appliances.

The business is doing well since its inventory has increased, it has more merchandise, and Francisco could buy a small truck, that is indispensable since he has to transport his merchandise to various marketplaces without mistreating it.

He needs a loan by $425 to buy merchandise and to be able to continue with its business

(Translated by Tyler of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Oladunni

texts.en: Oladunni sells onions in the retail market. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She started her business in 2006 and is hoping for a loan of NGN50,000 to purchase more onions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
N. Safina, 41, is a businesswoman with one school-going child. Since 2007, she has run a hardware shop located in Kibuli Kampala. She is using the loan to purchase more hardware to expand her business.

Her future goal is to renovate her houses so she can rent them out at higher rental prices.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo en el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Ana R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y algunas bebidas en las cercanías del mercado específicamente cercana a una estación de buses.

Actualmente, la señora Ana ha venido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para ofrecerlas. Es de importancia destacar que a sus 64 años de vida, sigue esforzándose por salir adelante en su negocio que requiere de mucha inversión.
texts.en:
With great effort, Ana R. sells fruits and drinks in the wholesale market of Managua. She is located close to the bus station in the outskirts of the market. Ana has now come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy fruits to sell. It is important to point out that at age 64; she continues to strive to get ahead in her business. The business needs a big investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Otuchopi 2 Akwir Beatrice Group

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a 25-year-old single businesswoman; she has five children, all going to school.

She has been dealing in her business of manufacturing local brew since 2001. She is using the loan to purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale. Her business has enabled her to take care of her family and pay her children’s school fees. Her future dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for making local brew

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie G. is managing a small parcel land that is used as a rice farm. She is 39 years old and has three children. Her ultimate goal in life is to send all her children to school. She is doing her best to support the needs of her family.

She wants to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming necessities that will improve her harvest. If she improves the harvest she will earn a lot of money and be able to easily buy the things her family needs. 

The program that CEVI offers has helped many farmers sustain their livelihoods. CEVI provides not just loans, but also training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: Farming necessities

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
V. Trần Thị (1303020295) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising water buffalo to sell. V. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon sells automobile spare parts. He is 30 years old and married with a child. He has been in the business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more automobile spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 35years old and married with three children; she lives in Lagos state and has been in wood business for six years. She says her husband does this trade with her jointly. 
	Francisca hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more wood to sell, she says thank you and promise to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Griselda Reynaldina

texts.es:
Griselda, le ayuda a su esposo en la comercialización de ladrillos ya que tienen un vehículo que hace el servicio de transporte de ladrillos en cantidad, es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y otros de su familia. 
Vive en la zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para construcción ( construcción de una habitación y mejorar sus condiciones de vida )
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda sells bricks with the help of husband. They own a vehicle for transporting large quantities of bricks. This is the only source of income to cover the cost of food and other expenses for their family. Griselda lives in her own home in the Llojeta district in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used for constructing a room in her house. This is Griselda’s fourth loan with IMPRO, which will give her the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in her house

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte H. is 30 years old, married with 3 children aged between 5 and 1.

Callixte has an experience of 8 years in shopping by working from 7h00 A.M to 8h00 P.M. After realizing that his investment is too low to get enough profit, Callixte is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a  for the purpose of increasing the profit.

With this profit, Callixte hopes to buy a house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (pollos y gallinas) y recientemente, desde hace 6 meses, tiene ganado vacuno. Todos los días cuida y alimenta a sus animales, ordeña a sus vacas y la leche que extrae la vende, siendo ésta, un ingreso económico más para su hogar. Paralelamente a esta actividad, Claudia también siembra papa y maíz, cuya cosecha la vende al por mayor a los comerciantes del mercado de su ciudad. Estas actividades le sirven para sostener su casa y su deseo a futuro es tener más cabezas de ganado e implementar un establo grande y de mejor infraestructura.
Es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy activa en su banco comunal y su deseo es seguir participando en su grupo de forma solidaria y responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono para la siembra de alfalfa que será el alimento para sus animales; también adquirirá semillas de papa y más pollos para su granja.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Me llamo Francisco Javier González tengo una pequeña familia la cual la forman  mi esposa Francisca Aracely y mis dos pequeños hijos. Hemos pensado con el tiempo la necesidad que se tiene de ampliar la vivienda ya que nuestros hijos van creciendo y van necesitando de su propio espacio, el cual nos llevo a pensar en la construcción de un cuarto mas, es por ello que les solicitamos su apoyo para poder llevar a cabo este proyecto, nosotros somos gente trabajadora, mi esposa y yo trabajamos en un negocio dedicado a la venta de mercería y papelería en este empleo llevamos 5 años y gracias a Dios nos ha ido muy bien hemos podido sacar a delante poco a poco a nuestros hijos en sus estudios y esperamos poder tener un mejor confort en la vivienda con este proyecto.
texts.en:
My name is Francisco Javier González, and I have a small family, made up of my wife Francisca Aracely and my two small children. We have been thinking about the necessity of expanding our home since our children are growing and need their own space. That made us think about building another room, which is why we are asking for your support to complete this project. We are hard-working people. My wife and I work in a business dedicated to the sale of sewing notions and stationery. We have been doing this for 5 years, and thanks to God it has gone very well. We have been able to help our children move forward in their studies little by little, and we hope to have a more comfortable home with this project.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Las Blanquitas Group

texts.es: El  banco comunal “Las Blanquitas” están representadas por la señora Blanca A. y conformada por 14 miembros muy trabajadores que van cursando su primer ciclo con muchas expectativas. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a ala comercialización D. diferentes productos como venta D. muebles, comidas rápida,  joyas D. plata, ropa abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, confección D. prendas típica como blusas y mantas, venta D. tarjetas telefónicas y el transporte público D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que las socias se encuentran bien ubicadas en el mercado central por lo que tienen clientela a la cual le gusta mucho la mercadería que ofrecen. El destino D. financiamiento es para ampliar sus negocios con la adquisición D. mercadería más acorD. a las exigencias D. sus clientes, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a agilizar su producción para obtener un producto terminado mas acorD. a su mercado, otros D. los socios destinarán el financiamiento a la compra D. algunos repuestos para la reparación D. su vehículo. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidaR. por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Las Blanquitas” communal bank, represented by Blanca A., consists of 14, hard-working, members who have high expectations of their first lending cycle. Most of the members sell a variety of products like furniture, fast food, silver jewelry, clothing, groceries in neighborhood stores, cosmetics, making regional clothing like blouses and blankets, telephone service card sales, and public passenger transportation. As far as competition goes, these members are well situated in the central market so they have a client base that likes the merchandise they offer. The financing will be used to buy merchandise which is more in demand by their customers, raw materials and tools which will help them speed up production to have products that are more in tune with market demands. Other members will use the financing to buy replacement parts for their vehicles. The members have worked with communal banks in the past so are aware of the particular working modalities but, still, are grateful for the economic support and trust provided by fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta M. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ruta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Ruta has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.   Ruta is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ruta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is from the village of Ramos East. She is 41 years old. Rosita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells the pigs she raised. In 2009, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita B. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Merlita owns and operates a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Sok Lay's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of six people who are located in Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sok Lay H. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is fruit seller in front of a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Sokun Cha, is a construction laborer. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers in the garment factory while the other two are attending the local school.

Although members of the family each have business activities, they are still in a poor condition economically. Thus, Mrs. Sok Lay H. would like to apply for a loan to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 31 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 20 years. He also cares for one orphan. Jean Paul lives in Kimironko where he owns a shop selling a variety of goods, including food and cosmetics. This is his 2nd successful year in this business. His working hours are from 7 AM to 8 PM every day.

Jean Paul is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more goods, including food, like rice, peas, and corn flour, because they seem to be in higher demand than other goods sold in his shop.  If the sale of these additional goods is as successful as is expected, Jean Paul will earn more profit which, in turn, will allow him to continue taking care of his children and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza D. is 32 years old, married to a soldier, and has four school-aged children. She is currently in the business of selling beer and sodas at a bar, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Tereza hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: El Sr. Guzman L. Ruìz de  54 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos que son independientes. Cuenta con  casa propia de material de esteras ubicada en el Caserío de Lujaraja. Trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 3 años de experiencia. Su conyuge también es obrera de campo. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Guzman L. Ruìz is 54 years old. He has four children who are independent and he has his own home, made of thatch, located in the Lujaraja region. He works in the fields for an agricultural business, and has 3 years' experience. His spouse also works in the fields.

Guzman is an enterprising person, who thanks to his determination is able to meet his family's needs. He seeks this loan so that he can rebuild his home, which was affected by the earthquake of 2007. His dream is to be able to finish his home with the goal of improving his quality of life. He is very appreciative of the support that this loan will bring him.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Abraham Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Abraham Antonio O. M., tiene la edad de 29 años, vive en el humilde Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casado y tienen dos hijos pequeños, de los cuales el mayorcito estudia la escuela primaria, dentro de los planes familiares esta la culminación de la construcción de su casa.

El trabaja como Bombero en la gasolinera de Ticuantepe, él compro gracias a su propio esfuerzo, un terreno el cual se lo vendió su tío, actualmente está en la legalización de esas tierras. Ese terreno lo compro para la construcción de su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como Bloques, cemento , arena y laminas de zinc, con esto él daría comienzo a las edificaciones.

Ellos son personas humildes, que con su trabajo han evolucionado en gran medida y que con el apoyo económico les permitirán mejores condiciones sociales.
texts.en:
Abraham Antonio O. M. is 29, and he lives in the humble Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. He is married and has two small children. The oldest goes to elementary school. The family has plans to finish building their house. He works as a fireman in the Ticuantepe gas station. Thanks to his own efforts, he bought a piece of land from his uncle. He is currently involved in the legalization of this land. He bought this land to build a house. That is why he is requesting a loan. He will buy construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, and zinc sheeting. With these materials he will start building. They are humble people, who have evolved greatly with their work. The economic help will allow them to have better social conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of his house

loans.name: Amigas Compartiendo Exitos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “AMIGAS COMPARTIENDO EXITOS”

La alcancía comunal “AMIGAS COMPRATIENDO EXITOS” trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD 6 meses, una D. sus miembros es la señora Dina que tiene 51 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos D. L. cuales 3 ya son independientes.
Muchos años atrás Dina se dedicaba a la venta D. zapatos, ella misma viajaba a otros lugares del país para comprarL. y en Lima L. vendía, pero por el mal gobierno D. ese entonces, provocó que L. pasajes y L. productos subieran D. precios radicalmente e hizo que Dina dejara D. viajar, por lo tanto dejó D. dedicarse a ese negocio.
En la actualidad Dina se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y dulces, como gelatinas, mazamorras, queques, tortas, etc. negocio que realiza en la entrada D. su casa, ya tiene 8 años con su negocio, desD. que comenzó con solo 35 vasos para gelatina, ahora tiene 90 vasos L. cuales L. distribuye a sus clientes fijos y a las personas que quieran degustar sus productos.
Empezó con la idea D. querer ganar más dinero para cubrir L. gastos D. su casa, así desD. entonces ha conseguido desenvolverse en el negocio D. L. dulces, también gracias a sus ganancias ha dado educación a sus hijos, y terminar D. construir su casa.
El préstamo actual lo usará para capital D. trabajo, ya que su plan es la D. mejorar negocio.
El sueño D. Dina es tener un par D. tiendas dentro D. una galería para ponerL. en alquiler y así ganar un dinero fijo mensual.
texts.en:
The "Amingas Compartiendo Exitos" [friends sharing successes] Communal Bank The communal bank "Amingas Compartiendo Exitos" [friends sharing successes has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for six months. One of the members is Dina, who is a 51 year old mother of five; three of her children are already living on their own. Many years ago, Dina was working selling shoes. She herself would travel to other parts of the country to buy shoes to sell in Lima. However, due to the poor government at that time, travel tickets and product costs increased significantly, so Dina had to stop traveling and stop working on her business. Currently, Dina sells candies and sweets such as gelatin, puddings, cakes, pastries, etc, a business which she operates from the entryway to her home. She's been working at this business for 8 years, starting with just 35 gelatin molds. Now, she has 90 molds which she distributes to her steady customers and to those who would like to try her products. She started with the idea of wanting to earn more money to cover the expenses of running her home and since then, she has been able to get involved in the sweets business. Also, thanks to her earnings, she has been able to educate her children and finish building her home. The loan itself would be used for work capital, since her plan is to improve her business. Dina's dream would be to have a pair of shops insiD. a mall to rent them out and be able to gain a steady monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Madres Trabajadoras”tiene  casi  3 años de formación y trabaja de forma bien organizada  con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, para este ciclo se integraron 4 señoras que se interiorizando sobre las actividades todas realizan ya que ella también deseen desarrollar alguna actividad  productiva para ayudar a sus familias. 
Incluyen entre las actividades que las integrantes realizan la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso.
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
La señora Blanca P. es una de las integrantes  quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, desayuno y almuerzo.
Ella con la ayuda de su familia prepara los comestibles todos los días para ofrecer a sus familias. Cada día cuenta con un menú diferente, entre ella se puede mencionar, como los GUISOS de arroz y fideo, bifes, tortillas, empanadas, milanesa, caldos y otros.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para los comestibles que ella prepara.
texts.en:
The Madres Trabajadoras (Working Mothers) Group has been around for almost three years, working in conjunction with Fundación Paraguaya. Most of its members are already involved in productive activities. During this loan cycle, 4 new members have joined, and they have been learning the ropes about business since they, too, want to develop some sort of business to help out their families. The members sell products like fruits and vegetables, and homemade food like meat, chicken, or ham and cheese empanadas.

They hope for a better future for their children, which is why they double their efforts to provide them with the tools they need for their development and upbringing.

Ms. Blanca P. is one of the group members who sells breakfast and lunch. With her family's help, she prepares meals to sell to other families every day. The menu changes daily, and some dishes include: rice or noodle stew, steak, tortillas, empanadas, breaded cutlets of meat, soups, and other meals.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, bread, milk, eggs, rice and noodles

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio E., 58 years old, owns a small sari-sari store and sells various types of goods in Banga, South Cotabato. She has one child. She works so hard to be able to help her husband provide for all the needs in their family. In her store, she also displays feed because a lot of people are raising pigs in their location. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: Additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité  La Familia se encuentra en su 1er ciclo ellas son señoras de la zona de Laurelty .
Todas ya están comenzando con una actividad que  les pueda mejorar su ingreso.
Así la señora  María comenzó con la actividad de venta de ropas y tiene mucha esperanza  ya esta  muy entusiasmada y confiada de que este trabajo dejará ganancia  para ayudar a su marido con  los gastos de la casa especialmente para la alimentación.
Solicita un préstamos para la compra de artículos que desea vendar especialmente para esta temporada fría como edredones, ,mantas de lana, camperas, busos, pantalones y otros.
Agradece  por la oportunidad que ellas tienen con el comité de mujeres ya que les facilita con el crédito que se les otorga.
texts.en:
The committee called “The Family” is in their first loan cycle. They are women from the “Laurelty” zone. They are all beginning an activity that they hope will improve their income. Mrs. Maria is starting a business selling clothes. She has a lot of hope. She is very enthusiastic and confident that this work will help her earn money to help her husband support their household. She hopes it will help with the cost of feeding their family. She is asking for this loan in order to buy articles of clothing that she would like to sell. She would especially like to buy winter clothing such as comforters, woolen blankets, jackets, sport jackets, pants, and other items. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has with the women’s committee. They facilitate the loans that are given to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothing such as comforters, woolen blankets, jackets, sport jackets, pants, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es una mujer con iniciativa, de 56 años de edad,  mujer que apoyado a sus hijos para que tengan una vida mejor, hoy en día trabaja como cocinera en un colegio desde hace varios años.
Su casa es de concreto y ha ido con los financiamientos haciendo las mejoras, para una mejor seguridad de su  familia. Con este préstamo embaldosara el porche y cambiara varias hojas de zinc de su techo que están en mal estado.
Para lograr una mejor higiene en el porche ya que aun es de tierra, así como poder dormir tranquila sin que se le pase el agua en este invierno.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria, 56, is a woman with initiative. She helped her children to have a better life, now she has worked for several years as a school cook. Her house is built of concrete, and she has taken loans to make improvements for the greater security of her family. With this loan she will tile the porch and will replace some zinc shingles on her roof that are in bad repair, providing greater cleanliness for the porch which currently has a dirt floor, and being able to sleep peacefully without leaks this coming winter.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Angostura en la provincia D. Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Melchora; ella tiene 71 años D. edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 1 hijo la socia tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella se dedica a administrar su tienda, la socia también cría animales menores, ella tiene pollos, gallinas y cuyes; La socia es muy conocida en el distrito D. Angostura y la gente la quiere y aprecia mucho, ella sabe que por la edad que tiene no es fácil adquirir un préstamo y es por todo ello que está muy feliz D. seguir siendo miembro del banco comunal; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche al por mayor para la tienda abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member is part of the communal bank, Virgen Purificada-Angostura. She lives in the district of Angostura, a province of Saylla, in the department of Cusco. Her name is Melchora and she is 71 years old. She is a widow and has one son. She has a small grocery store and spends her time running it. She also takes care of small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She is well-known in the district of Angostura and the people are very fond and appreciative of her. She knows that because of her age it is not easy to obtain a loan and as such, she is very happy to continue to be a member of this communal bank. She is asking for a loan to invest towards the purchase of products in bulk for her shop, such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk. She deeply values and is very grateful for the credit that she has been offered from which has allowed her business to grow and her quality of living to improve. As such, she promises to make timely payments on her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita M. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 38 years old. Anecita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Anecita is married. To make a living, Anecita operates an "RTW" buy and sell clothing sales business. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Anecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
La señora Juana es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas.
Ella dos a tres veces a la semana dependiendo de las ventas elabora las chipas y los lleva hasta el centro de la ciudad donde están sus clientes mayoristas y también individuales.
Todo el trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de su marido y sus hijos, así ello se trabajan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ingrediente para la elaboración de chipas, como almidón, grasa, queso, leche, harina de maíz y otros.
texts.en:
All of the members of the committee are very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the valuable support it has offered them to be able to improve their financial conditions in society. Juana is one of the members and she makes and sells chipas. Two or three times a week, depending on sales, she makes the chipas and takes them downtown where she has wholesale and individual customers. She does all of the work with her husband and children and in this way they work together to get ahead. She is asking for the loan to purchase ingredients, such as starch, lard, cheese, milk, corn meal and others.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy starch, lard, cheese, milk, corn meal and others.

loans.name: Betrece

texts.en: Betrece K. is currently in the business of selling medicine in a medical clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more medicine to sell. Betrece is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to upgrade her medical clinic into wards for admitting patients.

loans.use: To stock more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extend her farming land

loans.name: Joey

texts.en: Joey M. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 32 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Joey owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as lotion, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Joey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Joey plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Las Samaritanas Group

texts.es: Doña Elena es casada, tiene cinco hijos, y se dedica a la tejeduría trabajo que ha sido D. gran beneficio para ella, ya que D. esta forma ha podido sufragar sus gastos tantos personales como familiares, su arte es la elaboración D. Cortes Tipicos. Es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal "Las Samaritanas" integrado por catorce mujeres quienes también son artesanas dedicadas a la Tejeduría. Se organizan para poder apoyarse y ayudarse en obtener un crédito y aumentar el capital D. cada una. El objetivo principal del grupo es mejorar su negocio y vender por mayor y asi garantizarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena is married, has five children, and is a weaver. This work has been of great benefit to her, because this way she has been able to defray her personal and familial costs. Her art is making traditional skirts. She is the president of the "Las Samaritanas" communal bank, which is maD. up of 14 women who are also artisans who work as weavers. They organized in order to support themselves, to help themselves to get a loan, and to increase each of their capital. The principal objective of the group is to improve their businesses and to sell wholesale, as this will guarantee a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto D. F. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. He is 52 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ernesto owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Ernesto joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fifth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Mary has a salon business, which she has had for 4 years.  She also does brick laying.  

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids and paying the workers of brick laying.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Mary hopes to own a day care center.  Mary is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her business.

loans.use: braids and paying the workers for brick laying

loans.name: Santos Brigido

texts.es: Santo Brigido, tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil soltero, se dedica a la artesania en este caso la tejeduria, teje servilletas las que son comercializadas en el pueblo de san Francisco el Alto,este negocio es propio de Santos Brigido. Este trabajo le ha dejado buenas ganancias y con este a estado contribuyendo a los gastos familiares,y quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, para comprar materia prima y asi poder elaborar mas tejidos y devengar mejores ganancias, ya que tiene espíritu de emprendedor. Quiere tener exito en la vida por eso solicita dicho préstamo para ampliar el capital de su propio negocio,
texts.en: Santo Brigido is 19 years old, single and works in the handicrafts business.  His craft is weaving.  He weaves napkins which are sold in the town of San Francisco El Alto.  It is his own business.  The work has made him good profits with which he has been contributing to his family's expenses.  He would like to increase his working capital in order to buy raw materials so that he can do more weaving and earn more proit since he has an entrepreneurial spirit.  He would like to be successful in life which is why he is requesting this loan to increase the capital of his own business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es:
Mireya es una pequeña comerciante que ah crecido gracias a su tenacidad y empeño a su trabajo en la venta de ropa nueva y usada y una variedad de cosméticos en donde ha captado clientela por sus muchos años en el negocio.
Iniciando con poco capital propio, que su esposo dio, de su trabajo como electricista,  y apoyo de la institución con sus créditos siendo este el decimo en donde invertirá en la compra de mercadería. Como ropa para dama, blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, ropa para bebe, toallas, sandalias, cosmético. Entre otros que vende.
Contenta porque cada día mejora su inversión, también está ganando un dinero extra trabajando como tutora de programa social. Lo que significa que podrá pronto hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Mireya has a small business and, thanks to her tenacity and hard work, has grown her business selling new and used clothing and a variety of cosmetics.  She has been popular with her customers for many years.  She began her business with a bit of money her husband gave her from his job as an electrician, as well as with the support of this institution.  This is her tenth loan that she will invest in purchasing merchandise, such as women's clothing, blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, baby clothing, towels, sandals, and cosmetics, as well as others.  Happy because each day she earns back part of what she has invested, she is also earning extra money working as a tutor at a social program.  This means she will soon be able to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing: skirts, shirts, underwear, baby clothing, makeup, and sandals

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 44, married to Jane Wanjiru, and they have two children. Peter and his spouse operate the green grocer shop together and this has been Peter’s business for four years. 

Due to the fact that Peter has successfully repaid three loans with KADET LTD, he is one of the clients who has maintained a good credit history with KADET LTD. He has applied for his fourth loan, which he plans to use to buy 10 bags of potatoes, five bags of cabbages, two cartons of coriander, three bags of carrots, and five crates of tomatoes, all worth 80,000 shillings. He looks forward to being the supplier of the above named product to all small scale sellers in Zambezi area.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the green grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To trade goats

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La señora Margoth C. S., es originaría de la localidad de llano grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es  madre soltera con una hija de nombre Jasive Hernández C. de diez años. 

      Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos aliñados y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos ha estado obteniendo buenos ingresos en su hogar.

      Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que para salir adelante tenía que tener una actividad del cual obtuviera dinero y con ello cubrir los pequeños gastos que se generan en su familia y también apoyar a su hija para que siga estudiando.

     De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo ahorra para que cuando se le termina su mercancía tiene de donde sacar para comprar más y su clientela no se vea limitada con la compra que quieren realizar.
 
     Pues a un esta viendo que su sueño es que con el tiempo logre tener una casa propia ya que en la que vive es de su mama y pues no es igual que tener la suya.
texts.en:
Margoth C. S. is from Llano Grande, in the town of Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is a single mother with a 10 year-old daughter called Jasive Hernández C..

Margoth's business is selling seasoned chicken.  She says that her business does well and that she has made good profits from it for her household.

Margoth started out in this business because, in order to get ahead in life, she needed a business which would make her money with which she could cover the small expenses that her family incurs and which would allow her to support her daughter so that she could continue studying.

Margoth saves the profits she makes in her business so that when her merchandise runs out she has money available with which to buy more.  This means that her customers aren't limited in making their purchases.

Margoth's dream is to be able to own her own home since she currently lives in her mom's house which is not the same as having her own.

loans.use: To buy live chickens that she will later sell seasoned (as meat) in the same region

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama F. operates a grocery shop at Abura. Ama has acquired a junior high level of education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of groceries to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another shop.

loans.use: To buy other varieties of groceries to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem V. is 44 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She earns a living by raising cows from her home. She raises them both for selling and for slaughtering. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The couple has eight children, seV. of whom are single and one is married already. 

In order to increase her daily revenue, Khoem V. would like to request some funds from Kiva to buy a few young cows for feeding. She will sell them when they are big enough.

loans.use: to buy a few cows to feed and then sell when they are big.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reynaldo de 31 años de edad,  es originario de la comarca Lamai, Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es casado con 1 hija de 7 años de edad que estudia la primaria en la escuela localizada en la comunidad Lamai. Don Reynaldo es agricultor tiene mas de 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio siembra ,pues le dedica mas de ocho horas al día  de lunes a domingo, debido a su situación económica el no pudo seguir estudiando  y solo logro cursar el sexto grado de primaria. El inicio sus actividades de forma tradicional, ya que su papa tenia una plantación de hortalizas ,tales como tomate ,pepino y chiltoma .Empezó a sembrar este tipo de hortalizas a los 13 años de edad, después siguió sembrando el solo ,debido a que su padre se enfermo y no pudo seguir ayudándole. Solo se ha dedicado a siembra tradicional y hortalizas. Pero hoy en día se ha dedicado a la plantación de  tabaco, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra tabaco que es donde obtiene mayor ingreso, y lo vende a comerciante que lo compran para exportarlo a Cuba. El tiene que viajar casi por dos horas desde Pueblo Nuevo hasta Estelí para poder tener  acceso a un crédito e incluso cuando se le dificulta vender su producto fuera de su comarca tiene que viajar distancias a un mas largas ,también vende frijoles que el mismo siembra a fuera de su casa.
El solicita el crédito para compra de insumos, como fertilizantes, abonos y plaguicidas para proteger el cultivo de frijol y sacarlo como un producto de calidad y le genera buenas ganancias.
Su próxima meta es de tratar de sembrar mas cultivos y de poder invertir en mayor tecnología para así poder obtener eficiencia y eficacia de sus productos y sobre todo  mejorarle el nivel de vida a su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 31 years old and native of Pueblo Nuevo in the town of Estelí in the region of Lamai. He is married and has a seven year old daughter who attends elementary school in the community of Lamai. Don Reynaldo is a farmer who has engaged in his business for fifteen years. He works more than eight hours a day, Monday through Sunday. Due to his financial situation, he was not able to continue his education and only finished school through the sixth grade.

He started his business activites in a traditional manner. His father had a vegetable farm where he grew tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell peppers. Reynaldo started planting vegetables at the age of 13. Afterwards, he continued planting alone because his father became ill and was not able to assist him. He has spent most of his career planting vegetables in a traditional manner. Today he plants tobacco. He has a small parcel of land where he grows tobacco so that he can generate more income. The products are sold to a trader who exports them to Cuba.

Reynaldo has to travel almost two hours from Pueblo Nuevo to Estelí so that he can apply for a loan whenever he has difficulty selling his products outside of the region because he must travel even longer distances. He also sells beans outside of his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as fertilizers, composts, and pesticides to protect his bean crops so that he can produce a quality product that generates good earnings. His next goal is to harvest more crops and invest in better technology so that he can gain greater efficiency and effectiveness in growing his products. Reynaldo does all he can to improve his family’s standard of living and his business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, compost, and pesticides for his bean crop

loans.name: Karin Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karin Pilar; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica la venta de material de construcción como ladrillos entre otros más, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más material de construcción para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Karin Pilar is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Karin Pilar is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells construction materials, like bricks and other items.  She has worked at this business for a long time, and she works with her husband.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more construction materials for her business.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: El señor Sabino, con el dinero del préstamo construirá un muro de cerramiento en su vivienda; su principal fuente de ingreso es de albañil en construcciones privadas y su esposa es ayudante en su trabajo, vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de La Paz. Sabino y su esposa tienen 5 hijos.
texts.en:
With the loan money, Sabino will build an enclosing wall at his home.

His main source of income is working as a builder on private construction projects, and his wife helps with his work. They live in their own house in the Alto Llojeta area of La Paz. Sabino and his wife have 5 children.

loans.use: to build an enclosing wall around his house

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert A. E. is thirty-seven years old and married. His wife is a businesswoman and they have three children, aged between ten and two years old. 

Robert's business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega.  Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane, and commonly known as the sugar belt region. He sells cereals, which include maize, beans and peas, to the local people. He has been in business for four years now. Robert says that this business is profitable and that the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to purchase more maize and beans to grow his business. He hopes to grow his business into wholesale and in the future purchase a plot of land where he will put up a residential house. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz María es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la coordinación de vendedoras por catalogó actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años y su esposo como empleado de una maquiladora desde hace 9 de esta manera escomo obtienen ingresos para el sostén familiar. La señora tienen una vivienda que desde hace 8 años empezó a vivir ahí y donde ha visto crecer a su hijo, esta casa le trae muchos recuerdo ya que es el patrimonio que piensa dejar a su hijo cuando crezca. En este momento desea iniciar la construcción de un cuarto en planta alta para tener mayor comodidad para esto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Luz María is a very hard-working woman whose job is coordinating women who make catalog sales.  She has been in this line of work for 6 years.  Her husband has worked in a cross-border assembly plant for 9 years.  In this way, they both make income to support their family.

Luz María owns her own home.  She has lived there for 8 years and it is where she has watched her son grow up.  This house has many memories for her and it is the asset that she would like to leave her son when he grows up.  Luz María would like to start building a room upstairs in her home so that her family can live more comfortably.  For this reason, she needs to buy materials and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to build upstairs in her home

loans.name: Nelson Ovidio

texts.es:
Nelson, reside en San Miguel, es empleado y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la sastrería, vive con su familia.
El aprendió el trabajo con su madre y en base a eso gano experiencia y hoy día atiende la sastrería en sus ratos libres, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, botones, esta inversión le ayudara a tener la materia prima necesaria para realizar los trabajos en ropa.
Para Nelson su objetivo es tener ingresos extras, no depender únicamente de su empleo, crecer con la sastrería y al mismo tiempo bordado.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in San Miguel and is employed.  In his spare time he does tailoring.  He lives with his family.

He learned these skills from his mother and based on that he gained experience and today tends to his tailor shop in his free time.  He is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread and buttons.  This investment will help him have raw materials available to do work on clothes.

For Nelson, his objective is to earn extra income and not depend solely on his employment, to grow with the tailor shop as well as with embroidery.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Tado

texts.fr: Revendeuse de maïs, d’ignames et de bois de chauffe  à domicile depuis six ans, Mme  Amavi est veuve avec 02 enfants à charge. Elle s’approvisionne à kpalimé (une ville de la région des plateaux  située à 120km au nord-ouest de la capitale Lomé) et à Bassar (ville de la région de la Kara située à 450 km au nord de Lomé) elle a 59 ans et  s’est fixé  un objectif : se battre pour éduquer convenablement ses enfants.
texts.en: Madame Amavi has been selling corn, yams and firewood from her home for the past 6 years. She is a widow with two children in her care. She sources her goods from Kpalimé (a town in the region 120km northwest of the capital city, Lomé) and from Bassar (a town in the Kara region, 450km north of Lomé). She is 59 years old and has set herself the task of seeing to her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
