Oliver is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Oliver has a shoe sales business, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Oliver hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Oliver is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her more knowledge about how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también es director de su grupo musical llamado Machupicchu, el trabaja con eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños y bautizos y su esposa trabaja en la tienda de abarrotes, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de propietario de grupo musical. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, harinas y fideos y también para implemtar su grupo musical como comprar parlantes.
                                                  
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “YAHUAR MAQUI” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is 52 years old, he is married and has 3 children. He alternates his daily chores with two activities: he runs a general store and he is also the director of a musical group, Machupicchu, which is contracted for events such as weddings, birthday parties and christenings; his wife works in their general store. Thanks to these two activities, he succeeds on providing for his children. He wants to enlarge his grocery store and to improve his musical group. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products for the general store such as rice, sugar, milk, flour and noodles; he will also use part of the loan to buy loudspeakers for his musical group.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayments of his dues.

loans.use: To buy products for the general store such as rice, sugar, milk, flour and noodles, and to buy loudspeakers for his musical group.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda  is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Rosalinda  has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more breads, biscuits & canned goods to sell.

Rosalinda  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy breads, biscuits & canned goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 59-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a butcher for 25 years and enjoys his work. Ali is well known in the region for his good reputation, hardworking personality and devotion to his family.
To improve his business, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the second time. He will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator to keep his meat in, plus a new meat-mincing machine to provide customers with good quality products. He might also hire an employee to help in responding to customers' needs faster. His previous loan had a good impact on both his social and financial situations. Ali might also expand his business by starting a snack area in his shop, which might lead to a small restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and a machine to mince meat.

loans.name: Aura Gregoria

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 47 años de edad,  vive con sus hijos, quienes le apoyan en  su negocio. Vive en el distrito de Cayalti,contanto en su vivienda con los servicios básicos de agua y energia electrica, su comunidad esta dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Aurora se dedica hace varios años a la venta de refrescos y bebidas de diferentes sabores, en el exterior del mercado llamado La Parada  en el mismo distrito de Cayalti. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera diaria a los trabajadores de dicho mercado y a personas que concurrentes al mismo.
   
Aurora desea comprar más insumos, como cebada , soya, entre otros  para la preparación de sus bebidas y para surtir su negocio y preparar bebidas de otros sabores, ella piensa  aumentar su margen de ventas por ello esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles ,para cumplir con sus objetivo.

Aurora es una persona con buenas referencias, ella  tiene  una familia unida, además demuestra tener buen caracter y ser responsable.
texts.en:
Aurora is 47. She lives with her children, who support her in her business. She lives in the Cayalti district and has her own home with basic water and electric services. The residents of her community work in trade, agriculture and livestock.

Aurora has sold pop and drinks of various flavours for several years. She sells outside of the La Parada market in the Cayalti district, where she lives. She offers her products daily to the workers and customers of the market.

Aurora wants to purchase more supplies, such as barley and soy, for making her drinks, and to stock her business and prepare drinks of other flavours. She plans to increase her sales margin, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve her goal.

Aurora has good references. She has a united family and has demonstrated herself to have a good character and to be responsible.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing her drinks.

loans.name: Benjamin Rafael

texts.es:
Benjamín, vive con su madre, y tres sobrinos, el se dedica a brindar servicio de diseño grafico, escaneo y fotocopias, tiene 15 años en el negocio, atiende de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas e impresoras, también comprara tinta y papel, con estos materiales estará preparado para atender a la clientela que en su mayoría son estudiantes.
El objetivo de Benjamín es superarse, desarrollar su negocio, y contar con más clientes para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Benjamín lives with his mother, and three nephews, and devotes himself to providing graphic design, scanning and photocopying services. He has been in this business for 15 years and is open for business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Currently he is seeking a loan to provide maintenance to the machines and printers. He will also purchase ink and paper, with which materials he will be prepared to serve the clientele which is mostly students. 

Benjamín's objective is to better himself, develop his business, and have more customers in order to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to maintain the machines and printers, and also to buy ink and paper.

loans.name: Dianisa

texts.es: Dianisa tiene 24 años, es una mujer encantadora, muy alegre y dinámica para el trabajo, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su padre, su hijo y su sobrina quienes dependen mucho de ella. El trabajo de Dianisa consiste en la venta de ropa y productos por catálogos, este trabajo lo hace ya desde hace unos cuatro años, lo hace en su casa y cuando no hay clientes cerca sale a vender sus productos por la carretera y entre sus compañeras de trabajo, ya que labora en una embotelladora por medio día. A Dianisa le encanta su trabajo, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, como es alegre siempre anda sonriente y tiene muy buenos clientes, en el futuro quisiera instalar una bodega, así logrará aumentar sus ingresos. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo, pues se siente muy agradecida por los prestamos recibidos anteriormente, ya que fueron muy bien utilizados. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos como variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Dianisa is 24 years old and is a lovely woman who is very lively and energetic about her work.  She is a single mother of a 2 year old.  She lives in her own house with her father, her son and her niece, who rely heavily on her. 

Dianisa's work involves the sale of clothing and products from catalogs, which she has been doing for four years.  She works from home and when there are no customers around, she goes out to sell their products out on the street and among her fellow employees, as she works in a bottling plant for half the day.

Dianisa loves her job.  She likes to be in contact with people as she's always smiling and happy, and she has very good customers.  In the future, she would like to open a store, and in this way be able to increase her income. 

This loan is her 8th with MFP;  therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you to continue her work.  She feels very grateful for the loans she received previously, as they were used to good effect. With the amount requested, she will buy products such as a variety of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 21 years old.

Maria is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Maria earns about 6000 PHP from farming. She also runs a sari-sari store business. She said the store is helpful in meeting her family's daily needs.

Maria plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Maria hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay (in the photo) is a silk weaver, while her husband, Thorn, is a house builder and does construction work. They live across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children:  three sons and two daughters.

Lay is asking for another loan of $1,100 US in order to buy a new motorbike because the one she has is old and breaks. She will also use part of the loan to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

loans.use: to buy a replacement motorbike and weaving material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Vivian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Wilhelmin

texts.en:
Wilhelmin is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Wilhelmin has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Wilhelmin aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Emigdio De Jesus

texts.es:
Emigdio, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, es soltero, agricultor y ganadero, dicho negocio surgió gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron el oficio y lo apoyaron para sacar adelante el negocio, trabaja todos los días a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semilla mejorada, herbicidas, abono, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas y sus ingresos económicos.
Su mayor sueño es obtener buena cosecha, ser un agricultor en grande y vivir tranquilamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Emigdio lives with his mother and siblings.  He’s single.  He’s a farmer and raises livestock.  This business arose thanks to his parents who taught him the occupation and supported him to move the business forward.  He works every day, all day in the fields.

He’s asking for a loan to buy farming supplies like improved seeds, herbicides and manure.  This purchase will help him improve his crops and his income.  His greatest dream is to obtain a good harvest, to be a great farmer and to live in peace with his family.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds, herbicides and manure.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is 47 years old  and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her 3 year old daughter. 

He started his taxi service in 2008 with his own car. He has many regular customers and he is known for his excellent service. His daily income is 25,000-35,000 MNT.  Now that winter is approaching, he needs to change the tires and replace a few parts in preparation for the harsh winter. He is requesting 800,000 to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. 

To make a living, he owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Early in 2011, Jimmy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed and other supplies for the fast growth of his pigs.This loan will be the first taken out by Jimmy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to invest back into the business to double his profits.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for pigs' growth.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila nació en la  ciudad de Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Lucila tiene 80 años de edad, es viuda y  vive con su hija y sus nietos. Lucila desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.   

Lucila desde muy niña se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Las reuniones de la socias son cada treinta días en la ciudad  de Ollantaytambo. Lucila requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas.

Lucila se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
80-year-old Lucila lives the city of Ollantaytambo, which is where she was born. She is a widower and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. Lucila conducts her daily economic activities in Ollantaytambo.

Lucila began to work in agriculture as a young girl, and is doing very well thanks to the effort she has put into her work. She belongs to the village communal bank called "The Friendship of Ollantaytambo", part of the Arariwa Association in Ollantaytambo. The member meetings take place every thirty days. 

Lucila requires this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, and likewise agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Rose sells her products retail at the market and has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through frying chapat. The main business challenge(s) for Rose include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big, acquire a delivery van and  also start selling wholesale. Rose lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendicion nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como también en lo económico.
La Sra. Elisa es una de estas mujeres emprendedoras, ella comenta que tiene una despensa, la cual es bien surtida, con esta despensa ella surte a sus vecinos. Comenta que tiene muy buenas ventas ya que gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Su meta es seguir creciendo y ampliar su local.
Elisa solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: The committee Blessings was born through the management and support of a group of working women.  The group is from the city of San Lorenzo, and the members’ main goal is that each woman grows personally and financially.  Elisa is one of the entrepreneurial women who has a well-stocked shop that serves her neighbors.  She has good sales because she has been doing this for a long time and has a well-defined client base.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business.  She requests the loan to buy food, drinks, milk, bread, and other supplies with which she will stock her store and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: buy food, drinks, milk, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Marie Clementine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 53 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants dont tous sont maries, elle ouvre une alimentation , il y'a de cela trois ans, quand elle prend sa retraite et pour subvenir a ses besoins , elle ouvre une boutique d'alimentation.
Elle connait un grand succès depuis qu'elle s'est lancée dans cette voie, dans sa boutique on trouve un peu de tout , les gens ne vend plus loin pour s' approvisionner, des ces differents prêts, elle a agrandi son commerce,et elle a eu a faire des repayements avec beaucoup de régularités et  et avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va encore s'approvisionner en produits de premières nécessités comme des cartons de lait en poudre, de lait concentre, des boites de conserves comme des cartons des sardines,des cartons de corned-beef, des macédoines, mais doux,champignons,des sacs de farines, sacs de sucre et des bidons d'huile.

Tres entreprenante, elle tient a aller loin avec son projet, agrandir son magasin dans peu de temps  et continuer jusqu'à ce qu'elle ouvre une autre boutique dans un autre quartier.
texts.en:
Marie Clementine, age 53, is single with two married children. Three years ago, she opened a grocery store when she retired. She's been having a lot of success since she started in this field. In her store, one can find a bit of everything, and people comes from afar to purchase her products.

Thanks to her various loans, she was able to expand her business. She repaid her loans with great regularity, and she will use this new loan to resupply her stock of food staples, such as boxes of powdered and condensed milk, canned food, sardines, corned-beef, macedonia, sweet corn, mushrooms, sacks of flour and sugar, and cans of oil. 

Very entrepreneurial, she wants to go a long way with her project: rapidly expand her store and business, until she's able to open a new store in a different neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy food staples (milk, flour, sugar, oil, etc)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 42 años, Carmen se describe como una persona sencilla, humilde y muy responsable en el trabajo que realiza. Carmen es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en Otavalo Provincia de Imbabura.

Carmen se dedica junto con su esposo y un sobrino a la fabricación de bloques mismos que se utilizan para construcción de casas, edificios, etc. Carmen trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2008, el préstamo que solicita actualmente es para la compra de nueva maquinaria ya que la actual está con muchos problemas y no les permite realizar su trabajo eficientemente. Con esta inversión Carmen y su familia podrán optimizar tiempo y su producto será de mejor calidad, proceso en el cual ayudará a sustentar gastos y necesidades en el hogar mediante los ingresos.

El sueño de Carmen es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 42 year old woman who describes herself as a very unassuming, humble, and responsible person in the work she does.  Carmen is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Otavalo Province of Imbabura.

Carmen, together with her husband and nephew, makes cement blocks that are used for building houses and buildings, etc.  Carmen has worked with Fodemi since 2008.

The loan she is now requesting is to buy new machinery.  The one she has now has a lot of problems, and it does not allow them to work efficiently.  With this investment Carmen and her family will be able to optimize time, and their production will be of a better quality.  This income from this process will help her cover the expenses and household necessities.

Carmen’s dream is for her children to go get an education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy new machinery to make cement blocks because the current one does not work very well.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben is a charismatic 39-year-old man with a family for whom he has always dreamed of providing well. In his current business as a small-scale tea farmer, he is unable to sufficiently meet the financial needs of his family. Reuben joined REV and expressed an interest in the solar business. Because of his charisma, Reuben is part of a number of groups and is well known for mobilizing people in his community in development activities. His main group is a self-help group that runs a merry go round micro-finance system ;members contribute regularly and the money given as a loan to one or more of the group members on a rotating basis. Reuben introduced the solar lantern to his group members since most of them lack electricity in their homes and are in need of lighting. So far, he has sold some lanterns to some members but lacks the capital to increase his stock. Therefore, Reuben needs $700 to stock more lanterns to sell to the members of the groups he works with.

loans.use: to buy more solar lanterns to sell

loans.name: Baraah

texts.en: Baraah is 30 years old married woman and has two children lives with them in a refugee’s camp which called Baqaa, ‎Hadeed who appears in the photo because Baraah is conservative woman is a student in university majoring computer ‎information system, but his family are facing a financial crisis that prevent them to cover his semester fees. And here is ‎Baraah come to help her little brother to achieve his dreams and because she is very helpful sister she decided to apply for ‎an educational loan to help her brother Hadeed to cover his semester fees and buy the books he needs.‎

loans.use: To cover her brother`s university fees

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is orginally from the State of Guerrero, but 10 years ago she saw the need to emigrate to the community of Pedro Escobedo in the State of Queretaro, looking for better opportunities as their financial situation was in grave trouble. With a few savings she had she started a stand selling seafood, the very same one that today still exists and has evolved with satisfaction over the years. Inocencia has fought hard for her family and with all her effort she has managed to give them what they need.

she now requires a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise, and therefore increase her sales and expand the business. Help her grow. She will thank you. Become part of her effots. Don\'t doubt it any longer. Your generosity will be of great help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Inocencia es originaría del estado de Guerrero, pero hace 10 años se vio en la necesidad de emigrar a la comunidad de Pedro Escobedo, en el estado de Querétaro, en busca de una mejor oportunidad, pues su situación económica estaba en graves problemas. Con un poco de capital que tenía llegó y estableció un puesto de venta de mariscos, mismo que hoy sigue vigente y que al pasar de los años ha ido evolucionando satisfactoriamente. Inocencia ha luchado mucho por su familia y con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado darles lo necesario.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía, incrementar sus ventas y poder así ampliar su negocio. Ayúdala acrecer, ella te lo va agradecer, vuélvete parte de sus logros, no lo dudes más, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She had her education in Takoradi up to junior school. She followed with a vocation in the textile sector. Her specialisation is the use of chemicals in dyeing cloth to give it a new colour altogether.

Nancy supplies her cloth to schools, private organisations, and individuals as well, both within and beyond the city.

Nancy 'graduated' from the 'TEACH' sessions facilitated by KRABAN in October 2006. Her objective is to use the KIVA loan to acquire a shop in which to display and sell her 'tie/dye' cloth.

loans.use: Structure Construction

loans.name: Seyidurre

texts.en: Seyidurre A. is 53 years old, she is married and has three children. She sells kitchen utensils in her small store. But selling only kitchen utensils is not enough to cover her family's needs. She plans to use the loan to open the second part of her store and sell clothes.

loans.use: Mrs. Allahverdiyeva would like to open the second part of her kitchen utensil store to sell clothes.

loans.name: Jacinta.

texts.en:
Jacinta is newly wedded but her husband cannot provide her with the much needed capital for business. Things got worse when her supportive father passed away. The high interest rates of local banks discourage her from getting a loan but with the advent of GHAPE in her community, she has found refuge. She is confident investing in pig farming as it is an old activity and she has acquired a lot of training in this field.
Her community has been benefiting from her activities in terms of the manure they get.

Given a loan of $100, Jacinta plans to buy two more piglets and 80kg of composed animal feed.

She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Buying of piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: C. Elshan was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict region Gubadli, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He is 40 years old and the father of three children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He is homeless and staying in a worker’s  hostel in Sumgayit city. Elshan opened his business in 1997. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family’s food and important consumption needs. Now, he wants to borrow $800  to open a big vegetable section at his counter and he thinks this could improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To add a vegtables section to his counter

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children. She owns a grocery store, where she sells products needed to make "chipas" (which are a typical meal of Paraguay) like flour, cheese, eggs, oil, etc.

The products needed to produce chipas make for good sales because Carmen's business is located in an area where chipas are predominantly produced. Her workday begins very early in the morning, with the purchase of these raw materials from their suppliers. These suppliers are in the city Eusebio Ayala (Barrero Large).

Carmen says that this business of selling products for the development of chipas required financial capital and without the loans given to her by the Paraguayan Foundation, she wouldn't have been successful. To be successful in this business, one must have sufficient inventory of the necessary products because the prices constantly change, hence the profitability constantly changes, which affects the small producers.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale in her grocery, such as soda, beer, sugar, meat, milk, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmen tiene 37 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de una despensa y también vende productos para elaborar chipas como almidón, queso, huevo, aceite, etc.

Las materias primas para elaborar chipas (la chipa es una comida típica de Paraguay) tienen buen movimiento de ventas ya que su negocio se encuentra en una zona eminentemente productora de chipas y su jornada laboral se inicia a muy temprana horas de la mañana con la compra de éstas materias primas de sus proveedores que principalmente se encuentran en la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala (Barrero Grande).

Carmen comenta que en éste negocio de vender productos para la elaboración de chipas se requiere de capital y gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo hacerse de capital ya que de lo contrario el negocio no será rentable porque uno debe contar con stock suficiente de éstos productos ya que el constante cambio de los precios que se sucede en el mercado hace que juegue directamente con los costos y por ende la rentabilidad y principalmente éstos cambios de precio afectan a los pequeños productores es de ahí la importancia de contar con un capital de trabajo.

Ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías para vender en su despensa, tales como gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, carne, leche, etc.

loans.use: To purchase products like:  sodas, beer, sugar, meats, milk, etc. (Para la compra de gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, carne, leche, etc.)

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta prepares and sells fried vegetables to earn a living. She and her husband,who does not currently have a job, have three children. Marta runs her very small business from her house, and she is working hard to attract as many customers as possible.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase vegetables to continue her business. Marta envisions that her business will grow a lot in future. She hopes to increase her sales and income so that she can improve her needy family´s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to keep on running a small business.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es:
Crecencia is a 39 years old single mother, and has six children. Her youngest children are six and eight years old, and they are the only children that are under her care at this time. She lives in a neighborhood called North Laurels, where there are scarce economic resources, and most live in unfavorable conditions, where potable water is scarce. For 15 years, Crecencia has had a local store in her home, from which she sells milk, basic grains, and other products. With this business, Crecencia has been able to raise all of her children and help them get ahead. Crecencia would like to sell new products that she still does not offer her clients, such as cheese and chicken, because she does not have enough income to purchase them for re-sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Crecencia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales sólo dos están bajo su cuido, ya que son menores de edad, de 6 y 8 años. Ella habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, en donde los pobladores son de escasos recursos económicos viven en condiciones muy desfavorables y existe escases de agua potable. Desde hace 15 años doña Crecencia tiene una pulpería en su casa en la cual vende leche, granos básicos, entre otros productos, con este negocio doña Crecencia ha podido sacar adelante a todos sus hijos. La señora desea invertir en nuevos productos que todavía ella no ofrece a sus clientes, debido a que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, entre estos productos están la carne de pollo y queso.

loans.use: Purchase new products such as cheese and chicken to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice U. is 38 years old, and she has 7 children. She comes from the Shibiri Area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food. She has been in her business since 1998. She needs the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more drinks and food items.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items for sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence M.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase another electric sewing machine. Florence is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 19 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 180000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and construct a house. Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Edith W., Hamidah N., Monica K., and Ruth K.. Edith W. has a business running a kiosk and wants to add more stock. Hamidah N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Monica K. operates a business selling clothes and wants to increase her inventory. Ruth K. is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to put up another kiosk.

loans.use: To add working capital to tailoring business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old and is married with one child, age 10. Asha has been selling bed sheets since 2004. She works from 7am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.id:
Mohammad I. sells fruits. He travels with his motorbike around Kuta to sell his fruits. He obtains his fresh fruits from the nearby market. He plans to expand his business by opening his own kiosk yet he is constrained by capital. Hence he really hopes for help with capital to expand his business. Now he lives with his second wife in Denpasar. His first wife has passed away.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Mohammad I. adalah sebagai penjual buah-buahan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motornya, dia berkeliling sepanjang Kuta untuk menjajakan buah-buahan. Buah segar yang dijualnya dibeli dari pasar terdekat lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Dia berencana mengembangkan usahanya dengan membuka tempat berjualan sendiri, tetapi dia terkendala modal. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengahrapkan bantuan modal sehingga bisnisnya lebih berkembang. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama istri keduanya di Denpasar. Istri pertamanya sudah meninggal dunia.

loans.use: To get a kiosk

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mr. Khon K. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to his farming, he is a construction worker. Mr. Khon Khutl’s plantation business now has a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy the cows that he needs to plow his rice field. Thus, Mr. Khon K. asked for a loan to buy two cows.

Mr. Khon K. is 38 years old and the father of five children, four of whom attend school while the youngest one is too young to work or enroll in school. His wife, Mrs. Kan Vich, is a farmer. Previously, Mr. Khon K. obtained a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborer to plow his rice field. Last year, two of Mr. Khon K.’s children got lung disease and dengue fever, so Mr. Khon K. spent $125 to have them cured. His wife and his daughter appear with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to plow his rice field

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hang Thi D. is a 49 year old woman. She is living with her husband and her 2 children, who are going to school. Before her participation in TYM program, like many other local families, her family income is mainly from farming and live-stocks. In 2001, she first borrowed money to invest in live-stock. Then she switched and courageously invested in grocery retailing. At the moment, the family main income is from her grocery store. Her husband, while not working on the farm, is the one to go and purchase goods from wholesalers. Thanks to the stable income, they managed to improve their living condition and support their children’s education. She plans to borrow the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy grocery goods.
The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.
 Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị Đỗ Thị Hằng năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống cùg chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi  tham gia Quỹ tình thương, cũng như các gia đình khác tại địa phương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Năm 2001 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Nhưng vốn là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.Ngoài thời gian làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi tại gia đình chồng chị còn đi lấy hàng từ các đại lý lớn về cho chị bán. Nhờ có thu nhập ổn định gia đình chị đã có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong uốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng gia dụng phục vụ cho bà con địa phương.
Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Grocery retailing

loans.name: Mrs. Vat Pheaktenao Group

texts.en: This group, which consists of six members, is located in Preaek Thum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vat P. is the group leader and she sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Vat P. wants to expand it. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation. Her husband, Mr. Meas Chanuth, is a construction worker. Mrs. Vat P. and her husband are married without any children. They live in poor conditions because they have only a bike for traveling and a television in their household. Mrs. Vat P. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovan R., 35, and her husband, Mr. Chheang Saum, 61, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have no children.

Mrs. Sovan and her husband have been selling porridge and fried bananas since 1998. The couple need to expand their business by add more types of food such as Chinese noodle and coffee. They need to buy chairs and tables and build a new shelter to serve their customers. Therefore, Sovan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials for selling noodles and to build a new shelter for her business.

loans.use: To build a shelter and purchase materials for selling Chinese noodle.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Copaiba Mz. A Lt. 2, AA.HH José D. San Martín del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada, su esposo es Jubilado del “Ministerio del Interior”. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, realiza sus actividades desD. muy temprano para luego atender su negocio.   
  
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1.500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando abarrotes en general: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 paquete D. aceite, detergentes,1 paquete D. fideos, etc.    

Rosa manifiesta que las mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras siempre saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a client of the Juan Zaplana Belliza Bank which is located in Jr. Copaiba Mz. A Lt. 2, AA.HH José D. San Martín, in the district of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali state. She is 54 years old and is the mother of three grown children. Her husband used to work for the Ministry of the Interior but is now retired. With her first loan of S/.300 from the organisation Manuela Ramos, Rosa decided to buy and sell groceries. At present she has a small store. She starts her chores very early so she can then attend the store. With this loan of S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy more groceries: a sack of rice, a container of oil, detergent, a box of noodles etc. Rosa shows that hard-working, determined women will always succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items for her store.

loans.name: Cesiri (Redoubler D’Efforts) Group

texts.fr:
Cesiri est un regroupement de six femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 30 ans et de 3 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Sanoubougou II de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Liées par des relations d’amitié et de voisinage, elles font le commerce de pagnes wax, de bazins, du bois de chauffe, de tissus brodés et de savons de fabrication locale.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs entreprises, ces femmes ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé son premier prêt solidaire, ce groupe de l’association Soleil  de Sanoubougou II,  est à son deuxième prêt. Qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de savons de fabrication locale, 30 mètres de tissus brodés, 15 pièces de pagne wax, 2 chargements de camion “10Tonnes”en bois de chauffe et  24 mètres de bazins(moins riches).
Les femmes du groupe Cesiri ont comme principales sources d’approvisionnent possibles les villes de Sikasso et de Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali). Les produits sont vendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso et de façon ambulante dans les quartiers à une clientèle contituée généralement de femmes. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune  un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et les conjoints à subvenir  aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Cesiri is an association of six married women who are on average 30 years of age with three (3) children. They live in large traditional families in Sanoubougou II in the city of Sikasso ( third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Joined by reasons of friendship and neighbors, they are in the business of selling wax pagne (decorative cloth), bazin (undyed fabric), fire wood, embroidered fabric and locally made soaps.

In an effort to increase the size of their enterprise, the women had decided to associate with the Soro Yiriwaso microbank. After successfully completing their first loan, this group, which is part of the "Soleil de Sanoubougou II", has taken out a second loan, which will be used to purchase, 5 sacks of locally made soap, 30 meters of embroidered fabric, 15 pieces of wax "pagne", 2 truck loads (10 ton trucks) of fire wood and 24 meters of fabric (medium quality).

The women of the Cesiri group usually use the cities of Sikasso and Bamako ( capital of the Republic of Mali ) as their principal source of products. These products are sold at retail for cash or credit at the various markets in the city of Sikasso and door to door around the neighborhoods to a clientele made up mostly of women. They each hope to earn an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA per month which would be used to make the loan payments and assist their husbands in meeting family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various small business products such as: wax "pagne" (dcorative cloth), fabric (medium quality), firewood, embroidered fabric and locally made soaps.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen U. is 40 years old and is married with two children. Maureen sells foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions. Her store is located in a busy area. Maureen hopes to make more sales during this festive season.

Maureen needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions to sell. She would like to thank everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en: Mrs. Srorn C. was born in 1973, and she now lives in Kampan Village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hit Khin, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Although they try to work hard on their plantation, they still can earn little rice revenue to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Srorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy 125 ducks to start duck breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her ducks. Mrs. Srorn C. has six children -- one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school and the youngest one is only one year old and too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 125 ducks to start duck breeding business.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn S. has one child, and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She raises pigs from her home and normally makes around $3 per day. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice and typically contributes his daily income to the family savings.

Sorn S. is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase a grinding mill. She thinks she can earn additional income with the grinding mill. In the future, Sorn S. would like to save enough money to invest in a grocery business rather than raising pigs.

loans.use: Purchase grinding mill

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella pose un negocio de artesanías a base de bayeta y lana (bordados); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió materiales para seguir sus bordados. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas; podrá adquirir mas materiales para realizar bordados y tejidos a crochet; y llevar sus tejidos a los lugares turísticos de la región puesto que tiene varios pedidos y su mercado va creciendo, su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para poder estar junto con sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Nely is an associate of the communal bank "03 de Mayo," located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 26 years old, is married, has three children and has completed her elementary education.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, and has a handicraft business selling woolen-embroidered cloth. Her first loan was for 500 soles, with which she purchased materials to continue with her embroidery.

With this loan of 1200 soles, an amount which she undertakes to pay off in five instalments, she will be able to purchase more materials to make embroidery and crocheted fabrics, and to transport her fabrics to the tourist areas of the region, since she has several orders and her business is growing. Her desire is to buy a house in the city of Ilave in order to be able to be together with her children and to offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make embroidery and crocheted fabrics, and to transport her fabrics to the tourist areas of the region.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Elizabeth N. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 14 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents do not take care of them.

Elizabeth has been running a beauty salon since 2007. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee.

Elizabeth currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more salon products like weaving, short hair, long hair and curly hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more salon products like weaving, short hair, long hair and curly hair

loans.name: Brenda Azucena

texts.es:
Brenda inició el negocio para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y para tener
dinero  para poder pagar  sus estudios, ya que no tienen mas ingresos adicionales.
Comenzó el negocio  en 1992 desde muy chica le ayudaba a su mamá a vender en mercados rodantes y con lo que ella le pagaba fue ahorrando y  comprando su mercancia, entonces empezò a vender por su cuenta, hasta que puso su propio puesto en el mercado.

Actualmente tiene su propia camioneta la cual compro usada pero funciona muy bien y es en la que mueve la mercancia, también  ha podido comprar  su propia estructura para colocarse en los mercaditos informales, de diferentes colonias .

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $8480 para dar el anticipo de otra camioneta mas nueva, porque quiere ampliar más su negocio, y para esto necesita tener otro vehiculo mas eficiente para mover su mercancia.
texts.en:
Brenda started the business to help her mother with household expenses and to earn money to pay for school because there was no other source of income. She started the business in 1992. From the time she was a girl, she helped her mother at the temporary market where they went to sell their merchandise and, with what she was paid, she saved and bought merchandise. Then she began selling on her own, eventually setting up her own stall in the market. Now she has her own truck which, though used, works just fine and which she uses to transport merchandise. She's also been able to buy a stand that she sets up in the informal markets that spring up in various neighborhoods. She needs a MXN$8480 loan for a down payment on a newer truck because she wants to expand her business. She needs a more efficient vehicle to move her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck for retail business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Ашурова Дилором житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 34 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.работает на рынке "Саховат".Торгует тканями, которые привозит из города Душанбе.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Этим она сможет обеспечить рынок современными и модными товарами. иИ таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Dilorom A. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old, married and has five children. She works on the market Sahovat. She sells fabrics which she brings from Dushanbe. She has been in this business for eleven years. She decided to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. By doing this Dilorom can supply the market with modern and trendy goods and also attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe Juárez Guzmán  y su esposa desean poner losa en la planta alta, ellos con el transcurso del tiempo con ahorros fueron construyendo las paredes. Su esposo con compañía de un primo fueron poniendo block por block hasta llegar  a la altura necesaria para una recamara. El proyecto de esta familia es hacer un cuarto más ya que su hijo mayor que esta en la pubertad tiene 15 años quiere su propia privacidad su casa no es muy grande solo son dos recamaras y son mas hijos. Ahora esta familia ya se le terminó sus ahorros y necesitan comprar más material para terminar su proyecto. Entre el es empleado de maquiladora y su esposa enfermera y entre los dos aportan ala casa.
texts.en:
Felipe Juárez Guzmán and his wife want to put flagstones on the upper floor. With the passing of time and with savings, they have constructed the walls. Her husband, with the assistance of a cousin, have been building block by block to get the height needed for a bedroom. This family project is to make another room, as their eldest son, who is in puberty and is 15 years old, wants his own privacy. His house isn’t very large, there are only two bedrooms and there are more children. Now this family has used their savings and they need to buy more materials to finish their project. He is the employee of a factory and his wife is a nurse. Between the two of them they contribute to the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Edna Patricia

texts.es: Edna Patricia C. V. D. C.  vive en San Salvador capital D. El Salvador. Edna tiene 43 años D. edad es V. y madre un hijo. Edna recibe una pensión luego fallecimiento D. su esposo. Edna es odontóloga D. profesión tiene un consultorio ubicado fuera D. la ciudad, ya que la competencia en la capital es más granD., Edna solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar un compresor para su trabajos dentales y un aire acondicionado para su consultorio.
texts.en:
Edna Patricia C. (widow of C.) lives in San Salvador, the capital of El Salvador. She is a 43-year-old widow with one son. Edna has received a pension since her husband's death, but also works as a dentist; she has an office outsiD. the city as there is too much competition in the capital itself. Edna needs this loan to buy a compressor for her dental work and air conditioning for her office.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a compressor and air conditioner for her dental practice

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La señora María Marta Julián Gutiérrez tiene 55 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Completa  ella es Profesora de Primaria, tiene 1 nieto que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la Venta de esteras, madera este negocio se inicio hace 15 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de Productos como esteras, madera de Guayaquil.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de Productos como esteras, madera de Guayaquil.
María tiene como sueño tener su ferretería  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Marta J. G. is 55 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She finished college and is a primary school teacher. She has one grandson who depends on her economically. Maria has been selling mats and wood from her home for the past 15 years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase mats and wood from Guayaquil. This loan of 800 soles will be used to purchase the same kind of products.

Maria’s dream is to own her own hardware store in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mats and wood

loans.name: Maymunatu

texts.en:
Maymunatu I. sells provisions in Cape Coast. Maymunatu has received no formal education. She is married and has three children. 

Maymunatu has been selling provisions for quite some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay the rent, utility bills and other family financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Hồng

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị Hồng (1814071309) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, P. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. P. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. P. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alambiri

texts.en:
Alambiri is forty years old and is married with five children, who are currently in school.

Alambiri is a taxi driver and has been driving for the past fifteen years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks up passengers from the local lorry (truck) stations and takes them to the nearby towns at a fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head. Through this business he has managed to raise enough capital to support his wife’s business.

Alambiri requests the loan to enable him to maintain his taxi to resume his business to make income to support his family and get his kids back to school. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. sells jewelleries at Elmina. Charity has received junior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a steel burner. Charity has been selling jewelleries since 2005. She helps in the upkeep of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale. She hopes  to reinvest into her business with the new profit she will be making.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
LUIS vive en la  Av. Jaimes Freyre en la zona Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz, vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja con su movilidad propia. el crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su vivienda.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con unas pequeñas herramientas de mecánica y capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luís lives on Jaimes Freyre Ave. in the Alto Sopocachi neighborhood in the city of La Paz in his parents' home, but he has his own transportation for work. The loan that he seeks is to renovate his home. Thanks to the previous loans he has received, he has some small mechanical tools and some working capital, which have improved his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing tools

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame Sadio C. est une femme mariée, âgée de 34 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants et ses coépouses dans une famille traditionnelle à Ouéléssébougou situé à 80 kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) et relevant de Koulikoro,  deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Madame Sadio C. exerce plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus mais excelle beaucoup plus dans celle de la  restauration au niveau d’une gargote sise au marché de Ouéléssébougou, qui se trouve être la gare routière de la même localité. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés ses six premiers prêts (tous des prêts solidaires), elle est son septième prêt, (cette fois-ci, un prêt individuel).
Avec ce prêt individuel, elle compte acheter, 320 kilogrammes de tubercules, 200  kilogrammes de couscous d’igname séché appelé « Sado » : (une alimentation très prisée dans la sous région) qui se mange avec du poisson, et 100 kilogrammes de poisson de mer, qui seront préparés  en différents plats alimentaires avant d’être revendus. 
Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Bamako et vend sur place au marché dans sa gargote et devant les établissements scolaires à une étale à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elle compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les échéances du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille et réinvestir dans son entreprise.

loans.use: Achat d’ingrédients pour la restauration.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 31 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hijo. Ella es una mujer entregada a las labores agrícolas y se siente muy a gusto de trabajar en cada uno de sus cultivos bajo el liderazgo de su esposo. En esta época han sembrado grandes extensiones de papa y arveja, de las cuales la más rentable es la papa, ya que la vende tanto para consumo y como semilla en una sola cosecha. Para el caso de las papas de consumo las envía directamente al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, el más importante de su región, donde en promedio, demora memos de media hora en terminar de vender la camionada de papas. Por otro lado, las papas como semilla las guarda en su depósito hasta que lleguen los compradores de la costa hasta su chacra, quienes les compran por kilos y a un buen precio. Es por ello que Gladys quiere comprar más chacras, de ese modo evitar arriendar algunas tierras y el pago que debe hacer por ellas.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y se siente muy bien con todos sus compañeros, pues todos la han acogido muy bien, a pesar de haberse incorporado posteriormente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Gladis is 31 years old and she lives with her husband, the father of her son. She works in agriculture and really likes working with each of her crops, with the leadership of her husband. This season they have planted a large area with potatoes and beans. The potatoes are more profitable, since they can sell them as food and as seed tubers from the same harvest. In the case of food potatoes, she sends them directly to the wholesale market in the city, the most important one in the region. On average, it takes less than half an hour to finish selling a truckload of potatoes. As for the potatoes for seed tuber, she keeps them in storage until buyers from the coast come to her fields. They buy the potatoes by the kilo, and at a good price. This is why Gladys wants to buy more fields, so she can avoid having to pay to rent them. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is part of a communal bank and she gets on well with the other members because they have all been very welcoming toward her, even though she joined after the rest. She plans to use the money she is requesting to buy chemical fertilizers for her next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anabela's Group

texts.es: El grupo de 6 personas llegaron a la Asociciòn ASDIR  para pedir ayuda, para incrementar  sus capitales ya que ellos se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica, y esto a servido para el mantenimiento coticiano para la susistenicia y ellas quiren seguir apoyando a sus hijos e hijas para tener un mejor nivel de vida y para ello acuden para apoyarles en sus capitales y asì poder tener màs sutido sus mercancia y vender a otros pueblos la ropa tipica.
texts.en:
This group of 6 persons came to the ASDIR Association to ask for help to increase their capital; they are engaged in the business of buying and selling clothes in styles that are typical of the area. This business has served to provide their daily needs for sustenance and they want to continue to support their sons and daughters so that they can have a higher standard of living. For this reason they look for support to increase their capital; in this way they can have a greater supply of merchandise and can sell their clothing in other towns.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Edgar Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Edgar O. está comprometido con su familia por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda ya que ha establecido brindarle a su pequeño hijo un techo digno donde habitar y para ello se está esforzando grandemente para lograr esto.

Por tal motivo, ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así iniciar a lo inmediato la reconstrucción de la vivienda porque le es de mucha utilidad en estos momentos y así brindar a su familia entera las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Obregon is committed to his family for the reconstruction of their home, because he is determined to provide his young child with a roof where to live, and to achieve this he is working really hard. For this reason, he requested a loan to purchase construction materials to start immediately with the renovations of his home, because it would be very useful at this time and this way he can provide his family with all the necessary conditions for improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Manaia Solo

texts.en:
Manaia Solo O. is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Falelima.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  Manaia Solo grows and sells a variety of vegetables.  Manaia Solo has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 Samoan tala (about $120 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Manaia Solo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Manaia Solo is requesting her first loan from SPBD.   She is asking for 1000 tala which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Manaia Solo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda N. is from the village of Calao West. She is 51 years old. Erlinda is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle. Erlinda earns approximately 3,000 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en: Delgermaa S. is 25 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Delgermaa has a small clothes retail business with her husband. She rents a small stall at the local clothes market and sells various women's and men's clothes imported from China. Since the start in 2008, her small business has expanded fast. Her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 1,500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) in two years. She says that she would like to keep the pace at which her business is expanding and would like to add more variety of clothes for her customers. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Shodibek

texts.ru: Курбонов Шодибек проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Курбонов Шодибек имеет высшее образование. Шодибек более 8 лет занимается пчеловодством т.е. производством мёда. Кредит просит для покупки пчело- семей.
texts.en:
Shodibek K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He's 53, married with 3 children, and has a college education. He has been a beekeeper, producing honey, for more then 8 years. He plans to use his loan to buy bee colonies.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bee colonies.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar trabaja como transportista asalariado de trufi (es un taxi asignado a una ruta específica); siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos hermanos menores que están estudiando en la universidad pública. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Santiago primero de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una computadora que ayudará en forma muy importante a la formación profesional de sus hermanos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado por Edgar.
texts.en:
Edgar works as a salaried taxi driver, the taxi is assigned to a specific route. This is his main source of income, with which he covers the support of his two younger brothers that are studying in the public university. He lives with his parents in the Santiago zone One of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a computer that will greatly help the professional development of his brothers. This is his loan with IMPRO. The evaluation that was performed qualifies Edgar to be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for the education of his brothers that are attending a university.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and bread in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Lucia is 32 years old and is married to a businessman. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.es: Este cliente es Originaria del Municipio de Cinco Pinos, comarca el Espino, Departamento de Chinandega, la Señora María C. es dueña de su propia pulpería, está solicitando un crédito donde lo invertirá para surtir su negocio en compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, cajas de jabones, golosinas, para generar ingresos para el bienestar de la familia y seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria C. is from the community of Cinco Pinos in the El Espino region of the Departament of Chinandega, Nicaragua. Maria owns her own small grocery store, and is asking for a loan in order to invest in stocking her store with a greater variety of products. She will buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, and candies in order to increase her earnings. This will benefit her family's well-being and will allow her to move ahead with her business venture.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, beans, corn, sugar, a glass case, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Milagros Isabel

texts.es: Milagros Isabel de 33 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como administradora en una Farmacia desde hace 6 años, tiene 2 niñas, Cristina de 12 años estudiando 1er año de secundaria y la menor Ivonne de 9 años en primaria,  cuenta con el apoyo del padre de las niñas que asume los gastos escolares de las niñas y del hogar.  Milagros esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera ser beneficiada con kiva, pues desea mejorar su cocina construyendo un pantry, y poniendole el piso para mayor comodidad de la familia, si el dinero lo permite desea poner el techo donde tiene el lavandero porque como se acerca el invierno cuando lava la ropa se moja.  El mayor sueño de Milagros es tener su casa bonita con las comodidades que sus  hijas necesitan, ya que es la herencia que les dejara.
texts.en:
Milagros Isabel is a 33-year-old single woman who has been working as an administrator at a pharmacy for 6 years. She has 2 children: Cristina, age 12, who is in her first year of middle school, and Ivonne, age 9, who is in elementary school. Milagros has their father's support in that he covers both their school and household expenses. Milagros is requesting her second loan, and she hopes to obtain one from Kiva as she would like to remodel her kitchen by building a pantry and installing floor tile to provide more comfort to her family. If money permits, she would like to install a roof over her laundry area because when winter arrives, she gets wet while doing the laundry. Milagros' dream is to have a beautiful house with all the amenities that her daughters need because her house will be their inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a married woman who is a seamstress at Jukwa. She makes both male and female clothing, but most of her customers are females. Customers come to her home to place their orders. 

Esi has junior high school education and has a child. Her husband is a teacher. She helps her husband pay for accommodation and utility bills. She will add the loan to her income to buy materials to sew and also to buy ladies shoes as an additional product line (goods for sale). She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded trade to save up to acquire a shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and ladies shoes as an additional product line

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Olga es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Acosvinchos, Olga se dedica a la compra de cereales que luego vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Olga tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Olga sueña con tener una ferretería y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgen Mary). She is 37 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the District of Acosvinchos. Olga buys grain to sell later in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a grocery store in her home.

Olga needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of grain. She dreams of opening a hardware store and providing her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is continually working in her rice field. She works hard in tilling the land to have an abundant harvest. However, she lacks capital to buy farm supplies. That’s why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan.

Caridad requested 7,000 Php to supply her rice field. She has five children and hopes that her family will be sustained.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Brillando El Sol Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Brillando El Sol” y está conformado por 16 socios pertenecientes a la comuna de Victoria, ubicada aproximadamente a 1 hora de Temuco, que es la capital regional. Sus principales negocios son la venta de plásticos, hilos y agujas, telas, manteles tejidos a crochet, ropa juvenil, joyas, cosméticos, artesanía en maderas, comida, pan amasado, confección y venta de cortinas y centro de Internet.
La socia entrevistada fue Marjorie, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, en primer lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste buzo negro.
