Ella vende juguetes en una vega en el centro de la ciudad, donde trabaja medio mes todos los días y sólo los días sábado, la otra mitad del mes. Invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, es decir, en  juguetes que estén de moda y los que son más vendidos siempre, como pelotas, pistolas y barbies. 
El sueño de Marjorie es tener un local propio o arrendado, ya que en la vega donde trabaja ahora no tiene un puesto establecido.
 A Marjorie le gusta de Fondo Esperanza el trabajo en grupo, ya que ha podido compartir experiencias y buenos momentos con sus compañeros. También le gusta la posibilidad de obtener sus préstamos sin muchos requisitos y la forma de pago semanal, ya que así se le hace es más liviano y fácil el pago.
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Brillando El Sol” (Shining Sun) and is made up of 16 members from the town of Victoria, located approximately 1 hour from Temuco, the region's capital. The members have retail businesses selling plastics, thread and needles, fabric, crocheted blankets, children's clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, wooden crafts, food, homemade bread, and curtains, as well as a tailor's shop and internet cafe. The member interviewed is named Marjorie, the group's secretary. In the photo she can be seen in the first row, first on the left, wearing a black sweatshirt. She sells toys in a lot in the city center; half the month she works everyday, and the other half she works only Saturdays. She will invest this loan in merchandise, the most popular toys such as soccer balls, toy guns, and Barbie dolls. Marjorie's dream is to have her own store space or rented stall, since she currently doesn't have a stand in the lot where she works. What Marjorie likes about Fondo Esperanza is working in a group. She has already been able to share experiences and good times with her group. She also likes the ability to access loans easily and the weekly repayment, which is regular and easy to remember. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise: toys

loans.name: Ayelé Mawunya

texts.fr: cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle exerce son commerce au marché local d'akodessewa, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement elle sent le besoin d'agrandir son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 10 sacs de maïs,8 sacs de farines et divers. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This a woman who has a revenue-generating business involving grains. She operates this business at the local market of Akodessewa and has been doing so since 2003. Her customers include anyone. She currently feels the need to expand her stock of merchandise. This is the reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of corn, eight sacks of flour, and other items. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, flour, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of materials (wood, nails, zinc, flooring)

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita P. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she provides videoke services and also runs a mini-store, selling a variety of products to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $62 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Estelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: San Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Lucia de la ciudad de Caacupe.
Con el apoyo financiero que la fundación Paraguaya les brinda, las integrantes se sienten seguras trabajando en sus propios negocios ya que pueden cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes y amentar los ingresos a la unidad familiar.

A esta fecha operan con la fundación paraguaya en el ciclo número 4 del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, emprendiendo cada día proyectos de mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de las familias.

La señora Salustiana, es una de las integrantes y ella se dedica a  la venta de pollos en su barrio.
Esta actividad consiste en que ella compra pollos del mercado en gran cantidad, y los vende a sus vecinas y también provee a algunos negocios del barrio.
Este negocio actualmente resulta mucho para ella ya que la genta prefiere comprar pollo por los altos precios de los otros tipos de carne.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas pollos para vender.
texts.en:
The women of this group are originallly from the Santa Lucia district of the city of Caacupe. With the finanacial support provided by Paraguayan foundation (Kiva Field Partner) the members feel free to work in their respective businesses because they are able to keep up with client demand, while increasig the income for their families. To date, these hardworking women are currently on their 4th cycle with the Paraguayan foundation, working hard every day on their businesses to improve the quality of life for their families. Salustiana is a member of the group and she sells chickens in her neighbourhood. This business consists of purchasing chickens on a wholesale basis in the markets and reselling them to her neighbours. She is also a provider to some businesses in the district. This business is very profitable because everyone prefers to purchase chicken from her, given the high prices for other types of meat in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchae more chickens, destined for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in a one-room brick house in a historic city called Multan. Multan city is famous for its history and hot weather. 

She is a 30-year-old lady who got married at an early age. She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her two elder children are getting their education while the younger ones are too young to attend to school. 

Her husband sells clothes. He purchases clothes from Faisalabad, and from their native city as well, and sells them at the local market and to rich families of the city. He has 20 years of experience in this business. He doesn’t has a shop to display the variety of clothes, but he goes to different areas on his bicycle and announces his products in a loud voice to attract people to his clothes collection. 

Nazia helps her husband financially by doing embroidery works. She has good contacts and a customer base so she receives regular orders.
 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy clothes in bulk. This will not only help him in cost reduction but also enable him to offer more variety to his customers. 

Nazia is a new loan user and this is her first loan cycle. She hopes this will be a good experience for her and her family as well.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel, tiene treinta y cuatro años D. edad, curso el quinto grado primaria, tiene tres hijos varones D. diferentes edades el mayor D. dieciocho años y el mas pequeño D. doce años, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares y especialmente con los estudios D. sus hijos, ya que el mayor estudia el ultimo año D. su carrera D. Maestro D. Educación Primaria, se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con una tienda D. consumo diario, ya que tiene 8 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina EL MILAGRO, el nombre fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales, servicios, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para incrementar los productos D. su negocio, así generar más ingresos, con lo cual espera mejorar las condicones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is 34 years old and completed the fifth graD.. She has three sons of different ages. Her oldest son is 18 years old and her youngest one is 12 years old. Isabel’s husband works as a mason while she helps with a few family expenses, especially the education of her children. Her oldest son is in his final year before earning his degree in Elementary Education.

Isabel engages in traD. and has eight years of experience. She has a store where she sells daily consumer products. Having enthusiasm and the desire to succeed, she decided to organize a group in order to apply for a loan. The Communal Bank is called “El Milagro” (The Miracle), a name that was selected by all of the members. The group consists of ten women who are involved in different business activities which incluD. raising animals, providing services, and selling daily consumer products and traditional clothing.

This loan will be used to increase the inventory of products for her business so that she can generate more income. With this she hopes to improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Mirriam Jeptonui

texts.en:
Mirriam Jeptonui C. is 33 years old, married and has five children aged sixteen, fourteen, eight, five and three years old. Her husband, William Kipsang, is employed and contributes to the family’s household needs, such as school fees and food. Mirriam sells cereals and dried legumes in the town of Eldoret. She has been in business for the past five years and makes 4000 KES per month.

Mirriam learned about KADET through a friend. This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock like bags of maize and beans. With the income from these sales, she plans to pay back the loan and grow her business. With her husband’s help, Mirriam plans for her children to have the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina A. Báez tiene 47 años,  es soltera y tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Anteriormente Cristina era empleada de un local comerciante importante de la zona. Como en aquel entonces era muy poco lo que percibía como salario decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio. Fue así que habilitó un puestito de ventas de verduras y frutas en el mercado de la cuidad.
Gracias a sus ingresos de las ventas de frutas y verduras pudo lograr que sus hijos terminaran sus estudios secundarios.
En la actualidad quiere seguir ampliando su stock en mercaderías para así poder tener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Crisitina A. B. is 47 years old and she is single and she is the mother of 4 grown children. Previously Cristina was an employee in a larger business in the region. But her salary was very meager and so she decided to go into business for herself. She set up a stand from where to sell vegetables and fruits in the city's market. Thanks to the profits she has earned selling fruits and vegetables she has managed to send her kids to school and to see them graduate high school. Currently she requests a loan to supplement her stock of merchandise, to have greater quantity of products to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Limaniya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe LIMANIYA  (des femmes mariées et veuves) ont en moyenne 35 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le premier prêt fut correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait  en générale la vente de tissus et chaussures avec  AMI B., l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe et de l’encens.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 colis de chaussures et  20 pagnes wax.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché auprès des grossistes et vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et e femmes, d’une façon ambulante et à domicile.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the LIMANIYA group (married women and widows) average 35 years of age and three children; they live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region). This is their second collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers' needs. The first loan has been correctly repaid. This group of women generally sells fabrics and shoes (especially B. Ami) and trade in food condiments, burning wood and incense.
Mariam plans on purchasing ten shoe packages and twenty wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) with this loan.
She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the grand market and sells retail, cash or credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women, either door-to-door or from her home.
She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 50,000 CFA francs, some of which will be used to support her husband for expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: Purchase of various articles

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun S., 47, is married and lives with her six children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, whiles her husband, pictured here, works in construction, making $2.50 each day. Three children are in school and two are employed in a garment factory. 

Loun S. is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for her son, who stays at home, to start a new business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Activas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Roció es una de las integrantes del comité, y se dedica a la fabricación de bijouterie.
Ella compra los accesorios, y fabrica pulseras, gargantillas, aros y bordados en zapatillas y otros. Todos los trabajos son muy admirados y muy solicitados por los clientes.
Con los créditos que ella recibe junto a las demás socias del comité compra los accesorios de acuerdo a los pedidos, y a los gustos de los clientes. 
En esta ocasión solicita nuevamente el crédito para la compra de lentejuelas, mostacillas, flores artificiales, zapatillas y otros. 
 Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 2  hijos y su marido es constructor de obras.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) Committee was formed by several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso who decided to join together. All of the committee members have developed independent businesses, such as preparing and selling fast food. The members who make up this group are very close and work together in their activities to strengthen their friendship.

Sra. Roció is one of the committee members who makes trinkets. She buys the accessories and produces bracelets, necklaces, earrings, embroidered slippers, and other items. All of her works are greatly admired and in great demand among her customers. With the loans that she will receive along with the other committee members, Roció will buy accessories based on the orders and preferences of her customers. Upon receiving this new loan she plans to buy sequins, beads, artificial flowers, slippers, and other items. She has a very close family, which consists of two children and a husband who works in construction.

loans.use: Purchase sequins, beads, artificial flowers, slippers, and other items

loans.name: María Maritza

texts.es:
María Maritza tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace tres años aproximadamente, ella cría cerdos, pavos, patos y otros animales en diversos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde reside y también en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María desea realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente realizar arreglos en su corral y comprar alimentos, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y que siempre apoya a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
María Maritza is 23 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives in the village of Quemazón, a rural area located in the Mórrope district in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked raising and selling young animals for about three years.  She raises pigs, turkeys, ducks, and other animals in different areas located close to her home.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the merchants that visit the area where she lives and she also sells them in the main market in the city of Chiclayo.

María would like to make some improvements to her business, including repairs to her corral and purchasing animal feed.  In order to meet her goal, she has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a young entrepreneur, and she always supports her family.  People that know María think very highly of her and respect her.

loans.use: Repair corrals and purchase animal feed

loans.name: David Omar

texts.es:
David, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de video juegos, reparación de consolas y venta de CD Y DVD.
Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el negocio lo atiende en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera, este es la principal fuente de ingreso para el hogar. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de temporada como películas y CD de música navideña, esta inversión le ayudara a tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes en este tiempo de mayor demanda.
El objetivo de David es crecer poco a poco con el negocio para ayudar a su familia para que estos tengan una vida confortable.
texts.en:
David lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  He sells video games, CDs and DVDs and repairs games consoles.

David lives with his wife and three children.  He works in his business in the town market of San Francisco Gotera.  This is the main source of income for his household.  He is currently requesting a loan to buy seasonal products such as Christmas movies and Christmas music CDs.  This investment will help him to have a variety of products to offer his customers in this time of high demand.

David's goal is to grow in his business little by little so that he can help his family to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
K. Oliver is an individual client from Kihihi. She is 33 years old and married. She has a 9-year old child and a set of 7-year old twins.

Oliver is a salary earner who is also a farmer. She sells her produce to the local community, and the profits help her to provide for her family's needs. Oliver is requesting a loan to be able to buy more land for agriculture.

loans.use: To buy land for agriculture.

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura M. S. vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México es casada con el señor Jesús Gomes P. y con quien procreo cuatro hijos  que a un están a su responsabilidad  son: Manuel de Jesús de diesi seis años, la otra es Alejandra  Guadalupe de trece años, Ana Isabel de diez años y la ultima es reina del rosario.
            
                El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra y venta de catálogos, como  son: labiales, perfumes, desodorantes, entre oros, con esta actividad lleva tres años y cometa que le va bien ya que a obtenido buenos resultados de su negocio.

               Comenzó con esta ya que mucho más antes ya había tenido otros préstamos y que también era para tener o emprender un negocio y desde entonces le pareció buena  idea  es así como sigue trabajando.

                Con las ganancias invierte comprando mas mercancía  la cual su clientela le compra ya que es un producto de buena calidad selo compran muy bien, ya que se da cuenta que le deja buen resultado.
Su deseo es que con el tiempo logre ahorrar parque con ello saca delante sus hijos dándoles una buena educación y logren tener una carrera de los que puedan ejercer.

                Su grupo se llama  campo verde  y se integra de tres señora que cada una tiene diferente actividad, la razón del nombre es porque  por donde ellas viven es un luguar fresco y con pastos verde. 

              Las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:

      Antonia Gómez P.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaboración de tamales.
      
       Rosaura M. S.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos por catálogos como son: labiales, perfumes, desodorantes, entre otros.

       Amelia P. T.: invertirá el préstamo en la venta de tortilla para luego venderlo en la misma localidad.
texts.en:
Rosaura M. S. lives in Coapila, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married to Jesús Gomes P. and they have had four children together who are still in their care.  Her children are 16 year-old Manuel de Jesús, 13 year-old Alejandra Guadalupe, 10 year-old Ana Isabel and their youngest Reina del Rosario.

She will invest her loan in her catalog sales business, buying products such as lipsticks, perfume, deodorants, etc.  She has been in this business for three years and she comments that it is going well and she has obtained good results from her business.

Rosaura invests her profits in buying more merchandise.  Her customers buy from her because she sells good-quality products.  She makes good sales and obtains good results.  Her wish is that, over time, she will be able to save to get her children ahead in life, providing them with a good education and enabling them to have a professional career.

Rosaura's group is called 'Campo Verde' (Green Countryside) and it has three members in total who each have a different business activity.  The group has this name because the ladies live in a cool place with green pastures.

The members of the group are as follows:

Antonia Gómez P. who will invest her loan in buying ingredients for making tamales

Rosaura M. S. who will invest her loan in buying catalog products such as lipsticks, perfume, deodorants, etc.

Amelia P. T. who will invest her loan in buying tortillas which she will then sell in her neighborhood

loans.use: To buy Avon and Fuller brand catalog products such as perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo forma parte del banco comunal “El Altillo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Puerto Montt. Él fabrica estructuras metálicas como por ejemplo vitrinas y exhibidores de collares y joyas en general, entre otras cosas. También arrienda un local en donde vende artículos de bazar y paquetería, ubicado en el Mall Costanera de la ciudad, desde hace 8 años. Este local lo atiende su esposa y su hija en la semana y el fin de semana lo atiende una persona contratada. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería para el bazar.
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en sus negocios y contratar a otra persona para que atienda el bazar.
Tiene 2 hijos universitarios que aunque trabajan, viven aún en la misma casa.
Para Segundo Fondo Esperanza ha significado una gran ayuda, para seguir con su negocio, ya que como su arriendo es caro, antes, cuando no contaba con los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, a veces le faltaba dinero para comprar la mercadería. También le es muy grato participar en las reuniones de grupo.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
Segundo is a member of the communal bank "El Altillo" located in the city of Puerto Montt. He is a blacksmith who makes metal projects such as display cases, jewelry boxes, jewelry items, and other products. for the past 8 years he has also had a small general store and delivery service located in the Mall Costanera in the city.  This store is managed by his wife and daughter during the week and on the weekends they have an employee to help them. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for their general store.

His dream is to keep working at his businesses and to hire an additional person to help with the store. He has 2 children who are in university and are employed, and they both still live at home. 

For Segundo, Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) has been a great source of support for his business. The maintenance of the business is expensive and before he had access to loans from Fondo Esperanza, he sometimes didn't have enough money to purchase merchandise. He is also very happy to attend the group meetings. 

Puerto Montt is a city in the southern region of Chile and it is located in the region of Los Lagos. some of the attractions in Puerto Montt are the beautiful green landscapes, the isolated beaches, the traditional foods (especially seafood), and the local crafts. This is also the point of entry for the island of Isla Grande de Chiloe, a location rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Ruth Deisi

texts.es: La señora Ruth de 27 años de edad tiene un hijo de un año, no es casada pero tiene pareja,  la señora Ruth vive en casa familiar (Madre) ubicada en el Barrio San Pedro, la Sra. Ruth ambula por las calles de Santa Cruz  vendiendo toallas grandes medianas pequeñas, franelas  y secadores. La clienta se dedica al rubro  hace  4 años  ella está satisfecha con su trabajo ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas. El dinero que solicito en  EMPRENDER es para la compra de (Toallas secadores u otros). La Sra. Ruth está muy agradecida con la Institución por haberles otorgado el crédito en tan poco tiempo y por la atención que recibió.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth is 27 years old and has a one-year-old son.  She is not married but has a live-in partner.  They live in her mother's home in the San Pedro neighborhood.  

Mrs. Ruth is a merchant who sells large, medium and small towels in the streets of Santa Cruz.  She has been active at this job for four years and is very satisfied with the income she makes from her sales.  The loan she has requested from EMPRENDER is to buy more towels.  She is very grateful to the institution for granting the loan in such a short period of time and for the kind assistance she received.

loans.use: To buy towels in bulk

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad lives in a small city of Pakistan, called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Punjab province and is known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area named Shanti Nagar and contains 2 rooms. She has been living there for the past 15 years with her family. 
She is 40 years old, married to R., and has a daughter who is 16 years old and stays at home. Shamshad couldn’t provide her education fees due to the poor financial conditions of her family. She is a great wife and mother. She manages her household responsibilities as a mother and wife very well. 
He husband owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is a very hard worker and works 8-12 hours a day. 

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow crops on his land. Shamshad is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his crop production and will earn more profits.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for growing crops

loans.name: Las Tres Marías Group

texts.es:
El grupo las 3 Marías está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Mercedes L. de 55 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada desde hace tres años. Ella trabaja con sus hijos y dos vendedoras quienes se encargan en distribuir l ropa. Su mayor meta es tener una gran tienda de ropa usada.
Las otras dos integrantes son María de los Ángeles H. vende prenda desde hace 4 años y María Elena Leyla vende nacatamales y cobertores…etc.
texts.en:
The 'las 3 Marías' (Three Marías) group is made up of three hard-working, motivated and enterprising women.  One of them is 55 year-old María Mercedes L. who has been selling used clothes for three years.  She works with her children and two saleswomen who take care of distributing the clothes. Her biggest goal is to own a large, used-clothes store.

The other two members of the group are María de los Ángeles H., who has been selling clothes for 4 years, and María Elena Leyla who sells tamales and bedspreads, etc.

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fishing/fish selling and tricycle transport. She lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Maricar is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase fishing nets for her fishing business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maricar aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a hardworking 28 year old man who needs a loan to buy Maize for resale.  He hails from Kyenjojo Uganda and he is a married man with one child who is 2 years old.  He dreams of acquiring land to set up a good livestock farm and of educating his children.

He sold a cow that was given to him by his grandfather to start the maize selling business that he is dealing in today.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, se dedica al cultivo agrícola de maíz y pipián, él vive con sus padres y su esposa, trabaja desde hace 10 años y aprendió el oficio por su padre, todos los días atiende las actividades necesarias para cuido y mantenimiento de la tierra.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario para realizar el cultivo y obtener posiblemente una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es mantener un trabajo honrrado del cual pueda recibir ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in Concepción Batres in the Usulután department. He cultivates corn and squash. He lives with his parents and his wife. He has done this work for 10 years and learned the job from his father. Every day he does the necessary care and maintenance activities for his land.

He needs a loan for the purchase of agricultural tools, manure and fertilizers. This loan will help him to have everything necessary for cultivation and to possibly have a good harvest.

His goal is to maintain a respectable job from which he will be able to make an income in order to cover his household costs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con sus padres, es soltero y su padre le enseño a conocer el proceso de la agricultura, actualmente necesita dinero para comprar los materiales para iniciar el proceso de la milpa.
El solicita un préstamo que le ayude para preparar la tierra, comprando fertilizantes, tratamientos para plagas y abonos, con esto estará dispuesto a iniciar la siembra.
Su aspiración es crecer en conocimientos agrícolas, tener mejores ingresos y ayudar a la familia con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Santa Elena, Usulután Department.  He’s a farmer and cattleman.  He lives with his parents and is single.  His father taught him farming and he needs money to buy farming supplies to start processing corn.

He is asking for a loan to prepare the fields buying fertilizer, insecticide and manure which will make him ready to start the planting.  His goal is to increase his knowledge of farming, to earn better income and to help his family with whatever is needed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and manure.

loans.name: Tatiana Emerida

texts.es: Tatiana Emerida,  D. 35 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su compañero D. vida y dos hijas una D. las cuales se encuentra estudiando. Durante mucho tiempo Tatiana ha trabajado para aportar un poco D. ingreso a su familia ya que su sueño es que sus hijas tengan una realidad diferente a la D. ella. Posee un puesto en el mercado Municipal del Municipio en que resiD.. Su negocio consiste en la venta D. piñatas y recuerdos usados en fiestas y ocasiones especiales. Sus productos son muy demandados ya que siempre cuanta con variedad, calidad y el mejor precio. Además es muy conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Últimamente ha notado que su clientela ha aumentado por lo que sus productos son muy demandados. Debido a esto ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en las materias primas necesarias para mantener abastecido el negocio y satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes. El crédito lo invertiría en: papel, alambre, pega, variedad D. recuerdos y otros artículos que ella ofrece en algunas ocasiones. Confía en Dios que esto le va a traer buenos resultados y logrará dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Tatiana Emerida, 35, lives in her own home with her life partner and 2 daughters, one of whom is in school.  For a long time Tatiana has worked to contribute to the family's income, since her dream is for her daughters to have a better life.  She has a stall in the municipal market in the town where she lives.  She has a business selling  piñatas and keepsakes used for parties and special occasions.  There is a lot of demand for her products, since she always has a variety of high quality products at the best price.  In addition, she is well known in her neighborhood for being a hardworking and responsible woman.  Lately she has noticed that her customer base has increased, since her products are very much in demand.  Because of this, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the raw materials she needs to keep her business well-supplied so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.  She will invest the proceeds of this loan in: paper, wire, glue and a variety of keepsakes and other items that she occasionally offers her customers.  She trusts in God that this will bring her good results, and that she will be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paper, wire, glue, and a variety of keepsakes and other items

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 46-year-old, sells items such as pegs, ropes and soap dishes in an open-air market. Being a mother of four school-aged children, she works hard in her business to ensure that she meets her family’s expenses.  

Lucy has been operating her business for two years without a permanent business premise but on displays her goods on a wheelbarrow and sometimes moves around as she sells. Her dream is to own a permanent business premise in the future. She has requested for 20,000 KES to buy pegs,cooking pots and a table for displaying her goods.

loans.use: to buy a table for displaying her goods, pegs and cooking pots.

loans.name: La Proyeccion De San Jose Group

texts.es: L. señora Rocio pertenece al alcom L. Proyeccion D. San Jose conformado por 11 socios elL. ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, tiene 38 años es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos los cuales son menores D. edad, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza pero tambien junto a su esposo tiene un taller en donD. realizan servicos D. costura. Empezo en el negocio D. venta D. productos por una amiga que L. inscribio actualmente tiene varios clientes y realiza buenas ventas. Su deseo es poder incrementar su negocio y tambien ayudar a su esposo en el taller para asi poder dar estudios a sus hijos. El prestamo lo invirtio en L. caompra D. productos D. belleza para poder stoquearse por campaña.
texts.en: Rocio is a member of L. Proyeccion D. San Jose which has 11 members.  Rocio is 38, a secretary, is married and has two young children.  She sells beauty products and also helps her husband run a sewing workshop. A friend helped Rocio begin her beauty sales business, and she now has many customers, and her sales have have been brisk. She hopes to continue to grow her business to proviD. a solid future for her children.  Rocio plans to use this loan to buy more product stock inventory for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional product inventory

loans.name: Cesenia

texts.en:
Cesenia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Cesenia has a retail shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more sacks of rice.

Cesenia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Absa Diakhate Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Absa est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles ont longtemps travaillé ensemble dans le même groupement; il est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010.


La responsable madame Astou est âgée de 39 ans, mariée elle est mère de trois enfants et a en charge sa petite sœur; elle mène une activité de produits divers et a son actif un réfrigérateur qui lui permet de vendre de la glace et du jus de fruits.Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en camisole rose bleu.



Elle achète ses produits(sucre, café, ail, oignons, poivre, piment....)  au marché central du village et revend dans son quartier.



Astou souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son activité en ayant un bon stock de bissap, pain de singe et de sucre pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Ses bénéfices obtenus lui servent à améliorer le bien être de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Sokhna Absa support group is made up of eight women who live in the same neighborhood and who are united by familial and neighborhood connections. They have been working together for a long time; the group was created on September 21, 2010. 
The leader, Mrs. Astou, is a 39-year-old married mother of three who also takes care of her little sister. She sells diverse products and has a refrigerator that allows her to sell ice cream and fruit juice. In the photo, she is the one standing to the far right dressed in pink and blue.
She buys her products (sugar, coffee, garlic, onions, peppers, spices, …) at the village’s central market and sells it in her neighborhood.
Astou wishes to use her loan to grow her business by having a good stock of hibiscus flowers, baobab tree fruit, and sugar to be able to earn more money.
The profits will help her to improve her family’s well being and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food goods to be sold

loans.name: Dellanira Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dellaneira, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y una de 17 años, sus dos últimas hijas aun viven con nuestra amiga y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga al ver que lo que  su esposo llevaba al hogar no alcanzaba para los gastos tanto del hogar como de los estudios de sus hijas hace dos años atrás emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa interior y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y sus hijas le ayudan vendiendo a sus compañeras de clases, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lo que más venden son los perfumes y los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva  en el Grupo de Crédito 8 años y nos dice que el grupo es como su familia en la que está muy contenta por la ayuda que le han dado. 

Sus sueños son ver que sus hijas sean profesionales y que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Madres para un Futuro Mejor' (Mothers for a Better Future) community bank meet in 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  This area is known for its beautiful landscape, its woods, its wide variety of fauna and for its kind and hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 45 year-old Dellaneira who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are already grown up and her youngest [daughter] is 17 years old.  Our friend's two youngest daughters still live with her and are studying at university.  Her husband is a builder.

Seeing that the money her husband was bringing home wasn't enough to cover their household expenses and their daughters' education expenses, our friend decided two years ago to start her own business selling underwear and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and her daughters help by selling products to their classmates.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that what she sells the most of are perfumes and cosmetics.

Dellaneira will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She has been a member of her community bank for eight years and she tells us that the group are like her family and that she is very happy for the help they have given her.

Dellaneira's dream is to see her daughters become professionals and enjoy a good future.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Darwin Javier

texts.es:
Darwin es un hombre de 27 años, vive con su esposa María Fernanda también de 27 años con quien tiene un bebe recién nacido hace un mes. Viven en Santo Domingo, en la parroquia de "Río Verde" de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas", una provincia que se encuentra al sur del Ecuador densamente poblada, su clima es cálido por lo que la producción frutal es una de las principales actividades económicas.

Hace 6 años atrás Darwin inició su negocio propio de venta de vidrio cortado a la medida para ventanas tras trabajar para una empresa privada de donde aprendió este oficio. Hoy da trabajo a dos personas, de lo cual se siente muy orgulloso. El necesita comprar materia prima de oportunidad por lo cual necesita un crédito. Fundación Alternativa en cumplimiento de su misión ha ayudado a este microempresario a lograr su objetivo para que, de esta manera pueda incrementar su ganancia y por ende sus ingresos.

Él sueña con tener una gran empresa que se dedique a esta misma actividad.
texts.en:
Darwin is a 27-year-old man. He lives with his wife María Fernanda who is also 27, with whom he has a newborn baby of one month. They live in Santo Domingo in the Río Verde parish of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a densely-populated province located the southern part of Ecuador. Its climate is hot and so fruit orchards are one of the primary economic activities. 

Six years ago Darwin began his business selling custom-cut glass for windows, after working for a private company where he learned this line of work. Today he provides work for two persons, of which he is very proud. He needs to buy some raw materials, taking advantage of a special opportunity, and so he needs a loan. 

Fulfilling its mission Fundación Alternativa has helped this micro-business owner to achieve his objective and so, in this way, to increase his earnings and thus his income. 

He dreams of having a large enterprise in this same line of business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, glass and metal.

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1963 and lives in the village of Le Phap, Tien Duong commune, Dong Anh district. Tinh has a daughter who attends school. Her husband is an electrician and she is a farmer. Her main job is farming and breeding.

Tinh has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has always repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 654,000 VND to buy one pig.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Ha is 48 years old and has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Du is 42 years old and has four children. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy one pig.

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por doce personas  indígenas  que se dedican a diferentes  actividades  económicas, ellas formaron el grupo  para hacer mas grande su negocio, son vecinos de la misma localidad.
Este grupo se llama  LAS COMADRES   pues la mayoría de las integrantes son comadres y vecinas de la misma  localidad. La representante  de este grupo es la  señora  Teresa  tiene  cuarenta y cinco años de  edad  esta  felizmente casada  con el señor  Luís Ignacio  ambos tienen la cantidad de dos hijos .La señora Teresa  fue quien enviíto a  sus vecinas a formar parte  de este grupo; ella se dedica  al trabajo de estilista   desde hace cinco años, tiene un local en su casa  donde vas sus clientes a que  les brinda su servicios. Estudio hasta la preparatoria  terminada, los domingos  asiste a cursos de computación, le gustaría  superarse. Ella  pidió el préstamo para comprar  mas material para su estética como es: tijeras, pinzas, pasadores, acrílico para uñas, tubos para chinos, liquido para alaciado.  Uno de sus sueños  es hacer  su negocio mas grande  y que sus hijos terminen sus  estudios  ya que ella trabaja para  ayudarle  a sus  hijos  y a su esposo  en los gastos de la casa.
Los otros integrantes que forman parte de este grupo son:
Adelfa – se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Margarito- se dedica a la venta de  zapatos.
Pedro- se dedica a la venta de  pescado.
Librada – se dedica a  la venta de  comida.
Lorena- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de  zapatos.
Isabel – se dedica a  la venta de  zapatos.
Rosa- se dedica a la venta de  pescado.
Teresa- se dedica a la venta  de  antojitos mexicanos.
Tomasa – se dedica a la venta  de  antojitos mexicanos.
Rosa Elia se dedica  a la venta de zapatos.
Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que las ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de este milagro par tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group has 12 indigenous members who are engaged in different business activities.  They set up their group in order to expand their businesses.  They are all neighbors from the same town.

This group is called 'Las Comadres'.  Most of the members are friends and neighbors from the same town.  The group's representative is Teresa who is 45 years old and happily married to Luís Ignacio.  The couple have two children.  It was Teresa who invited her neighbors to join this group.

Teresa has been working as a hairdresser for five years.  She has a place in her home where she serves her customers.  Teresa finished high school.  On Sundays she attends computer courses as she would like to improve herself.  Teresa requested this loan to buy more products for her salon such as scissors, tweezers, hair slides, nail acrylic, rollers and hair straightening liquid.  Her dreams are to expand her business and for her children to finish their studies.  She works to help her children and to help her husband with their household expenses.

The other members of this group are:
Adelfa - who sells Mexican snacks
Margarito - who sells shoes
Pedro - who sells fish
Librada - who sells food
Lorena - who sells perfume
Guadalupe - who sells shoes
Isabel - who sells shoes
Rosa - who sells fish
Teresa - who sells Mexican snacks
Tomasa - who sells Mexican snacks
Rosa Elia - who sell shoes.

The group thank Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given them to help them get ahead in life and fulfil their dreams.  They would like to thank them for being part of this miracle which helps them enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a businesswoman aged 33. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been selling plastic plates, bags and sandals to earn a living. She works hard in her business to provide for her family.  

In the next five years, she wants to operate a wholesale business. Her dream is to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sandals and utensils.

loans.use: To buy sandals and utensils.

loans.name: Amirchon

texts.ru: Амирчон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Amirchon lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 30 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Amirchon provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy aims to improve her business to increase her income. She manages a general store where she sells grocery items in the local community. She is also raising pigs as an additional source of income. With patience, she believes she will be able to grow her businesses and make them viable in the long run. 

She wants to ask for a loan of P25,000 to buy groceries, such as biscuits, canned goods and noodles, to sell, and to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

Daisy is now 30 years old, single, and lives with her family. Because of her determination to improve her family's living situation, she does everything to attain a prosperous living in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as biscuits, canned goods and noodles to sell and to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
Ibrahima is originally from West Africa. He has been is the United States since 1997, and when he first arrived he became a truck driver. After a few years on the road, Ibrahima knew he wanted to become more independent and start his own business. Six years ago, he opened a store selling sports apparel and urban style clothing. He says starting a business is all about taking chances, and that’s exactly what he did. With the store, Ibrahima is helping support his wife and three children.

In view of the upcoming cold season, Ibrahima needs to stock the store with warm clothing. He will use this loan to buy inventory such as coats, sweaters, and boots.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as coats and boots for the upcoming winter.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de uma filha ja casada. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ele.


Saiu da Matola para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. É comerciante ha mais de 29 anos , e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos diversos (farinha, sumos, arroz, oleo, peixe, batatas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende adiquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no escoamento do produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He is married and has a daughter who is already married. He completed 9th grade and didn't continue because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his parents who live with him.
He left Matola for Boane in search of better living conditions. He has been in retail for over 29 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase various goods (flour, juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.) in order to increase the amount of his merchandise.
He promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future he intends to purchase a vehicle to help him sell his merchandise. For that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (flour, juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.).

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 36-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Emelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages.

Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan es socio D. la alcancía “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”  es casado y tiene 02 hijos  trabaja como chofer D. transporte publico  lamentablemente  sus ingresos no le permiten cubrir algunos gastos es por eso que ayuda a su esposa  en la venta D. productos D. belleza, sus amistades y compañeros D. trabajo son algunos D. sus clientes, muchas veces acompaña a su esposa a realizar cobranzas y visitar clientes así ambos pueden tener otros  ingresos que le permiten tener una mejor calidad D. vida y darle a sus hijos estudios y alimentación, ahora están pensando en iniciar un negocio con atención  al público y vender no solo productos D. belleza sino otras cosas como regalos, bijouteria etc.  y lo harán en su misma casa esta vez usaran su préstamo para comprar productos D. belleza como maquillaje, perfumes, talcos, champú etc. Aprovecharan estas fechas que hay mucha demanda por fiestas naviD.ñas, el grupo al cual pertenece es “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”  esta formado por 07 miembros todos son vecinos D. Ventanilla Callao.
•	El Sr. Juan viste camisa amarilla.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is a member of the communal bank "SIEMPRE ADELANTE".  He is married, has two children, and works as a public transport driver.  Unfortunately his income does not cover all of the household expenses so he helps his wife with her beauty product sales business.  Some of the customers are friends and work colleagues.  Many times he accompanies his wife to visit customers and handle payment collection.  This allows them to have extra income so they can enjoy a better quality of life and give their children an education and proper nutrition.  They are thinking about opening another business to sell not only beauty products but other items such as gifts, costume jewelry, etc. out of their home.  The loan will be used to buy beauty products such as make-up, perfumes, talcum powder, shampoo, etc.  They want to take advantage of this time of year when there is more demand because of Christmas parties.  The communal bank "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" is comprised of seven members who all live in Ventanilla Callao.
•	Mr. Juan is the one in the yellow shirt.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married. He owns houses which he rents out. Christopher began his real estate business by using his personal savings to buy a piece of land. He then started building houses which he rents out. 

He is applying for a loan of KES 80,000 in order to renovate his rental properties. Christopher also owns a public service vehicle which plies inside Mombasa. His main challenge is the high cost of building materials. The income from this loan will enable him to save and develop other plots of land.

loans.use: To renovate the houses he rents out.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth 36, is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the past sixteen years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business, her other source of income. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Nueva Esperanza “están en el Séptimo Ciclo con 15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable, además de eso son mujeres trabajadoras, quienes se esfuerzan al máximo por poder ayudar a sus familias.
Tomasa es una de esas mujeres, ella nos comenta que para ella lo más importante es darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que debido al tiempo que lleva en esto ya pudo formarse muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" is in its seventh cycle and comprised of 15 members.  The group is known in its neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  The members are hard-working women who make the maximum effort to help their families.

Tomasa is one of the members.  She says the most important thing for her is to give her family everything they need to lead a decent, dignified lifestyle.  She sells all kinds of clothing and claims to have developed a solid customer base in the time she has been in business so she has a high sales volume.

She is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing to meet customer demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old. She is married to Peter and they have five children. She has been farming for the last 11 years and she earns a monthly income of Kes 9,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET,LTD. of KES15,000.  She will use the loan to buy more farming land. She was introduced to KADET, LTD. by a credit officer.

She hopes to expand her farming skills and venture into commercial farming.

loans.use: To buy more land for large-scale farming.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La socia Ernestina continua con su pequeño taller de elaboración de artesanía en su casa. La socia desea seguir trabajando unos buenos años mas a eso mismo ritmo para poder terminar de construir la base para mejorar la economia de la familia la socia desea en esta ocasión obtener el credito para invertir en la compra de materiales como son arcillas, oxidos naturales, pinceles, entre otros para implemntar su taller.
texts.en: The member Ernestina continues with her small craft-making workshop in her home. She wishes to continue working a few more good years at the same pace to be able to finish building the foundation to improve the economy of the family. She wishes, on this occasion, to obtain a loan to buy supplies such as clays, natural oxides, brushes, among other things to run her workshop.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as clays, natural oxides, brushes, among other things to run her workshop.implemntar su taller.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.en:
AVEC-Mali is a women’s association based in Mopti, Mali. Association members are engaged in a variety of activities, such as selling improved cook stoves, teaching reading and writing to women’s groups, and educating women in their community about family planning.

Korotoumou is one of nine members of AVEC-Mali who sell solar lamps. She is 47 years old and has six children. In addition to her work with the women’s association, Korotoumou is the matron at a health center in Mopti, and she sells grains. In July, she started selling solar lamps to fisherman, students and farmers, who are reliant on kerosene and flashlights for light. With a solar lamp, her customers can save money. Kerosene and mobile phone charging currently cost about $110 per year; whereas, a solar lamp costs $25 and has a lifetime of about five years. These solar lamps can provide up to 16 hours of light and can charge a mobile phone.

On top of being less expensive, solar lamps are more durable and reliable and keep people from stealing mobile phones. “With a solar lamp, you don’t have to go to a mobile phone charging station and give your phone to someone who may steal your phone or use the call credit you have on your phone,” says Korotoumou.

On top of benefiting consumers, selling solar lamps provides income for the women and for the association, AVEC-Mali. The women earn about $2 per lamp that they sell, and the association earns $3, which is then invested in a warehouse to store solar lamp inventory and motorcycles to distribute the products.

The solar saleswomen are well organized – each responsible for her own sales territory. They educate their communities about the benefits of solar lights and generate lamp sales through group meetings and demonstrations at night.

Since paying for the lamps up front is simply too expensive, the women need working capital. A Kiva loan will allow the group to obtain solar lamp inventory from NOTS Lampe Solaire and pay for it in installments.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp inventory that they will sell in their communities.

loans.name: Kaharou

texts.fr: Marié à une marchande du nom de Kafayath et père de sixième enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge, Kaharou est âgé de 42 ans. Kaharou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Kaharou subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Kaharou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Kaharou vend du ciment dans sa région depuis sept ans. De façon secondaire, Kaharou vend aussi du sable lagunaire, cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, Kaharou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tonnes de ciment.

loans.name: Gigla

texts.en:
Gigla, 51 year-old married man, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia with his wife. Gigla earns a family-living with working as an private artisan. As it becomes harder to make financial stability, Gigla decided to be involved in his own business and open a auto repair center. To realize his desire, Gigla had started to seek the credit among local financial institutions. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The loan of 850 USD will be great support to this hard-working man and his family, as he will purchase a special auto crane and start repairing cars on his own. Gigla will generate much more income as now and will lead the business in a profitable way.
The loan will greatly assist Gigla, and she will be able to continue his lovely job. Due to his kind and nice attitude toward clients, Gigla has a big list of loyal customers. He will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a special crane and open auto repair center

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: LEONARD L. is 52 years old and married with five children. He lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. L. owns and runs a refreshment center located near his residence. He is a retired civil servant, and the business is the sole income generating unit for the family. In his center, he sells cold drinks, alcoholic drinks, and different kinds of snacks. His center is used by the people of the area as a place to refresh themselves after working hours. He has a plan to improve the business by stockpiling enough drinks and, more importantly, sitting chairs and tables. He experienced a shortage of chairs and tables during the time around Christmas. He does not like to lose as many customers as he lost during Christmas due to insufficient chairs and tables. He also wants to buy a pool table to make his center even attractive. Pool has become very popular nowadays in Dar es Salaam. People travel a long way to find places to play pool. To make his plan work, L. is in need of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and serving vessels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Evelyn would like to buy iron sheets, timber, nails, stones and cement to put up a room for her retail shop.

loans.name: Khanqulu

texts.en: Khanqulu N. is 50 and he has two children. In 1996 he started his small store where he sells cosmetics, bath accessories and household supplies. He borrowed a $1200 USD loan to improve his business, and he plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make it even bigger and better.

loans.use: Mr. Nadirov would like to improve his business and enlarge his cosmetics and household supplies store.

loans.name: Tiwara Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is a widower and has four children. The death of his wife in the year 2005 left him alone to cater for the children. His first loan from GHAPE in 2005 was invested in pig farming and the profit he got was used for feeding and education of his children. With a new academic year starting in September, he will be facing a lot of challenges buying books and paying tuition fees for his children. 

Given a loan of $200, Sylvester plans to buy 2 more piglets and 800kg of feed as he already has three bigger pigs which will soon be ready for the market.

He plans to repay the loan within the loan term.

loans.use: Fattening of pigs for sale.

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady is a 34 year-old woman with two kids who are currently in school. Her husband left to work in Spain in order to increase the family income. For that reason, Lady lives in her father-in-law's house which is located behind Saguapac on Choretti street. Lady sells shoes on the sidewalk of Aroma street, which is located in Los Pozos market on the corner of Antonio Vaca Diez in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She is requesting funds because she doesn’t have a lot of merchandise and she needs credit in order to acquire more shoes for her business.

Lady has been working in this area for ten years, and hers is practically a family business since her mother sells shoes next to her and has taught her the business since Lady was young. There is quite a bit of competition in Lady’s area. There are 15 or 20 other people who set up their stalls where Lady sells, but her friendliness and attention to the clients help her have a strong clientele. The prices of the shoes vary according to the models and also depending on if they are for men or women. Regarding Lady's credit history, it is not negative.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Lady es una señora de 34 años, tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando en el colegio, su esposo (concubino) se fue a españa a trabajar para mejorar los ingresos de la familia, es por esta razón que Lady vive en la casa de su suegro que se encuentra ubicada detrás de Saguapac en la calle Choretti. Lady se dedica a la venta de zapatos en el mercado de Los Pozos en la acera de la calle Aroma esquina Antonio Vaca Diez, en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. El motivo de la presente solicitud es porque no tiene mucha mercadería y requiere del crédito para adquirir más zapatos para su respectiva comercialización. Lady trabaja en este rubro desde hace diez años atrás, negocio que es practicamente familiar ya que su mamá también vende zapatos al lado suyo y le enseño el negocio desde bastante joven. Existe bastante competencia en este rubro, donde ella vende hay unas 15 o 20 personas más que instalan sus puestos para vender, pero su amabilidad y peculiar atención a los clientes le ayudan a tener buena clientela. Los precios de los zapatos varian de acuerdo a los modelos y también dependiendo si son para varon o mujer, en cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios, no son negativos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Lelis Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Lelis Francisca is 28-years-old and lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad. She only went to school until third grade, and she has one son who still depends on her. Lelis makes a living by selling bread and cheeses and also knows how to weave. She makes tablecloths and bedspreads and sells them on Tacna street in the province of Otuzco.

Previously she didn't have a business; she only tended to the farm and to raising her animals, but thanks to the first loan that Manuela Ramos offered her, she was able to start her business and continued to raise her animals to sell them. She is a new member of the Communal Bank "Sagrado Corazón" (Sacred Heart), and has recently obtained her second credit of 300 nuevos soles ($100), which she will pay back in 4 months. With this amount she purchased candy and bread to sell and used another portion on feed for her animals

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lelis Francisca tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad. Ella estudió solo hasta el tercer año de primaria; tiene 1 solo hijo el cual aun depende de ella. La señora Lelis se dedica a la venta de pan, quesos y también sabe tejer hace algunos tapetes, colchas y eso los vende en la calle Tacna de la provincia de Otuzco.

Anteriormente no tenía negocio, solo se dedicaba a la chacra y a la crianza de sus animales pero gracias al primer préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos pudo poner su negocio y continúo con la crianza de sus animales para venderlos. La señora es una socia nueva en el Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón”, recientemente ha obtenido su segundo crédito por S/.300.00 ($100), que será cancelado en 4 meses, con este monto compró dulces y pan para venderlos y otra parte lo empleó en la compra de alimento para sus animales.

loans.use: Purchase of candy and bread.  Purchase of feed for animals.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.en: Abdukahor S. lives in Mastchoh and he is married and has five children. Abdukahor S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and his income increase. He has the wide-side business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a milk cow for further meat and milk and sour milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and the family is secure by the milk products). He plans to include an assortment of the following milk and sour products as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr.Sulaimanov requires a loan in 1000 STJ for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase that will allow him to significantly increase the family income and will also permit him to plan further business and to widen his assortment.

loans.use: Abdukahor would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
After eight years of operation, Maximina’s cafeteria has become one of the most popular gathering places of the community. At the beginning, things were not easy and it was almost impossible get capital to maintain the cafeteria. Now, her business’ success outweighs all the pains she’s endured to make her dream come true.

Maximina says she has to keep working as hard as before to improve things and move her business forward. With her loan, she will purchase raw materials to prepare her delicious meals. She will also buy napkins, disposable plates for food to go services, and new plates and tablecloth so as to give a new face to her cafeteria. Given this loan, this twenty-year-old mother of four children will maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and invest in other goods to make more attractive a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Lukoto East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty M.. She is currently in the business of selling cabbages and is requesting a loan to purchase more cabbages from the villages. Betty is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 5 children ranging from age 8 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Rose K., Beatrice K., and Janava Bakubyewala. Rose K. has a business selling matooke and wants to increase capital stock. Beatrice K. is currently operating a business rearing cattle and wants a loan to buy cattle feed and insecticides. Janava Bakubyewala operates a retail shop business and wants to increase the stock of items in the shop.

loans.use: To add to cabbage business and increase stock

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(Vi) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nulu L.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes in large quantities. Nulu is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier for work. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Nulu makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Nulu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more shoes and the loan was paid back on time.

Nulu is joined in her small group by Esther W. and Hadija N.. Esther W. operates a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to boost business. Hadija Nabawabuka is currently operating a business in tailoring and selling clothes and intends to buy more fabric and add to her stock with the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory in shoe business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is thirty-two years old and a mother of three children. She is a member of Eagle Women Group (a system through which a group of women co-guarantee to obtain a loan). Through the loan, she started a grocery store six months ago where she sells products like oats and other cereals, hair food, liquid soaps, margarine, toiletries, etc. 
Ama is very happy now because she has a livelihood. She will use her next loan to buy more items wholesale to avoid price hikes and to increase the number of customers she can satisfy.

loans.use: To buy  of cereals, toiletries, cartons of liquid soap, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Mrs. Susan O. is 41 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.
