She sells fairly used clothes, a trade she learned for 6 months and started on her own in 1998. She is requesting the loan of $875 to buy more fairly used clothes for sale. She is very happy about the loan. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for sales

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en:
Fariz is 39 years old.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Fariz is married, with 2 children. They have settled in Baku city, Sabunchu region.
 Fariz started his business 8 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji, the wife of M.A., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a two-room mud house and is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has a business changing oil in automobiles, so she is applying for a loan to buy more oil and other supplies for his enterprise.

Anwar baji is joined in her loan group by four other members: Zubaida baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Tahira baji wishes to buy buffalo for her livestock business; Imtiaz baji wants a loan for her shuttering business (renting wooden beams for people to use temporarily to support their roofs), while Ayesha baji has a mobile phone shop that she wishes to expand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana B. K. sells saucepans, clothing, and fabric. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Joana and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Maria James's Dira Group

texts.en:
Maria J., age 49, is married with 4 children (ages 22, 18, 14, and 7). She has 2 businesses, catering and raising chickens. She started these businesses in 1980. She does catering twice a week. She works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $522.

Maria has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more equipment for the catering business. She hopes for a new loan to buy a cow for a milk business. She will share this loan with her subgroup (Dira) members, who sell meat, clothing, vegetables, and drinks and own some shops.

In the picture Maria is 3rd from the left.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milk sales

loans.name: Yesenia Aparicia

texts.es: La Sra. .Yesenia tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Campo Bruce tiene  tres hijos de 3, 4, y 5 años de edad, su esposo es dueño de una unidad de taxi y lo trabaja todo el día.  Doña Yesenia es una mujer trabajadora pues desde horas muy temprano se levanta para hacer el desayuno a su familia ya que el niño mayor va al colegio y tiene que alistarlo para que su esposo lo pase dejando, ya que su negocio es una pulpería y le toca  atender a sus clientes, y por las mañanas se vende bastante, la pulpería la puso desde hace cuatro año con ayuda de su esposo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar insumos diarios para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de productos a si como incrementar las ventas, pues este es su cuarto crédito con la institución ya que con la facilidad de los prestamos ha podido surtir mas su negocio y a futuro desea poner una miscelánea  donde pueda vender de todos los productos lo cual esto le generaría mejores ingresos, también ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 36 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Campo Bruce. She has three children ages three, four and five. Her husband owns a taxi and works all day. Yesenia is a hard working woman. She gets up in the early hours of the day to make breakfast for her family. Her oldest son goes to school so she has to get him ready so that her husband can drop him off at school since Yesenia has to attend to her business. Yesenia has a grocery store and she sells quite a bit in the mornings. Yesenia established her store four years ago with the help of her husband. She is asking for this loan to purchase daily supplies so that she can offer her clients a variety of products in order to increase her sales. This is the fourth loan that she has received from this institution and with this help she has been able to increase the stock in her store. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a general store where she can sell all kinds of products which will allow her to generate more income and to help her children with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs retail to her customers.

Grace needs a loan for N52,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kinyerezi Group

texts.en:
Obadia N. is a 30-year-old married man with a 4-year-old daughter. He owns and operates a shop where he sells beauty supplies and toiletries in an area called Kinyerezi. He started this business one year ago, and he works on a daily basis from 8 am until 6 pm. By doing so, he is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $244.

This is the second loan that Obadia has sought via Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the first loan to increase the inventory at his shop, and he proudly states that he promptly repaid that particular loan. Now, he is seeking another loan in order to again expand his shop's inventory by purchasing items such as lotions, perfumes, and hair products. Notably, Obadia will share the loan proceeds with his loan group, Kinyerezi. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. In the picture, Obadia is standing on the right; also pictured are Rose I. (a shop and taxi owner) and Rose C. (a shop owner).

loans.use: To further expand his store's inventory by purchasing additional perfumes, lotions, and hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Hat C., a 26-year-old widow with no children, is a villager in Chi Paing village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In vegetable farming, she grows potatoes on 2-hectar field. Since this field is too big for her, Mrs Hat C. has decided to ask for a loan of $500 to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on that field.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom K. sees herself as a calm, hard-working, and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for another income as her husband didn’t earn enough and now he is working in Russia. They have a child who is growing each day, as well as their general needs. She began some time ago selling various products and even had a home-made food shop which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent, and because the owners were asking for the shop. So, one of her friends convinced her to sell clothes and offered to take her to places where she could buy clothes at good prices. She followed her friend’s advice and began to sell clothes 2 years ago. Her sales went very well after she got started. She now has a fair number of customers.

Dilorom is asking for 4000 Somoni which she will repay in 10 months, to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and have a more diverse variety of garments for her customers, which will allow her to increase her sales.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for children for re-sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señorita Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la compra y venta de chuño negro y tunta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir papas y transformarlo en chuño para su venta al por mayor en las ferias locales. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá invertir en su negocio y aumentar su capital, quiere comprar mas papas para poder procesar en chuño, así como algunos materiales necesarios (mallas, sacos, etc.), de esta manera piensa llevar a los mercados de Arequipa  y Tacna. Con las ganancias ella quiere comprarse un carro para poder trasportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Community Bank "Ciudad Blanca" in the town of Chijichaya, of the district of Ilave in the province of Del Collao in Puno. She is 19 years old, she is single and she has no children in her care. She has a grade 9 education.

She is involved with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) organization for the past 6 months. Her business is the buying and selling of dried and frozen potatoes. Her first loan was for S/ 500 nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase potatoes to prepare for wholesale in the local fairs.

With this loan of S/1000 nuevos soles, sum of which she promises to repay in 3 monthly payments, she will be able to invest in her business and increase her capital. She wants to purchase more potatoes to prepare and few other needed items (fabrics and bags, etc.). Thsi way she hopes to bring her products to the markets in Arequipa and Tacna. With the earnings she wants to purchase a car to be able to transport her products.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes to make her products.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Juliana K. from Mwanza. She is single and has one 23-year-old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent because his parents do not take care of him.

Juliana has been running a nursery school since 1998. She is a wonderful woman who has devoted her career to the care and education of the Tanzanian young: she nurtures young Tanzanian boys and prepares them to enter elementary school. We could really use more dedicated people like her.

She works at the business eight hours per day, five days per week, and is assisted by 30 employees. Juliana currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to build new classrooms. In the future, she plans to expand her school. Juliana thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To build new classrooms.

loans.name: Ismaël

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismaël N.  est un boutiquier qui vend divers produits il est marie  il gère aussi une télé centre et est à son premier prêt. Il est marié et a des enfants, il habite à Diourbel une petite ville à 150 km de Dakar. Son boutique est son lieu de travail d’où les revenues lui permettent de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ismaël N. is a shopkeeper who sells various items. He also manages a telephone center and is on his first loan. He is married and has children. He lives in Diourbel, a town located 150 km from Dakar. His shop is his workplace, and the revenues from it allow him to feed his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
R. Naim is 23 years old. He is married and has a small child. Naim is a very diligent and hard-working young man. With his car he provides taxi services. For the last 5 years the current business had been the main income for the family allowing Naim to improve the living conditions of his large family. In addition to his wife and small child he is also supporting his parents.

As with any business generating income the business of Naim also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some repair. For this purpose Naim requests US $800 for the term of 9 months. Naim promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repair of vehicle used as taxi

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are girls. She says all of her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Joyce is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles such as clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for nine years and desires to expand her business. Joyce hopes to improve upon her standard of living and sponsor her children to the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en: Ansu G. is forty-six years old and married with five children. He lives with the family at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. He buys vulcanizing materials from Kumasi and uses them to work on his clients' cars. He is consistent with his work but he is handicapped by low working capital since car tyres and rims are very expensive. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy additional vulcanizing materials to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income for his business. He says he would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy vulcanizing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Aterei F Asio Helen Group

texts.en:
Helen A. is 36 year old, married, with nine children. She has been in her business for three years. Helen requests a loan to purchase veterinary drugs for livestock, to meet her customers’ demands.

She also advises people about livestock. Her future dream is to purchase a motorcycle so she can be of better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase veterinary drugs to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. sells doughnuts, which are normally served with porridge and eaten as breakfast in Zion in Cape Coast. Rose has received a junior high education.  She is married and has six dependents. 

Rose has been selling doughnuts since 1999. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, clothing, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, vegetable oil and other ingredients to enable her to increase the production of doughnuts. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to support her husband in saving towards acquiring a piece of land on which to build a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, vegetable oil and other ingredients to enable her to increase doughnut production

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Managing a general store is a risky business, says Raquel. There are debtors who pay late, so sometimes she has a problem with cash flow. However, with her skill in customer service, her business continues to slowly grow.

Like other businesswomen, Raquel is interested in venturing into other businesses in order to earn more income for her family, so she decided to borrow from Kiva. She knows that with PHP 5000 she can start another type of business. “With my determination, I know that I will be able to manage another business in addition to my general store”, Raquel said.

Raquel's husband, Jonard, is a construction worker. They are helping one another support the needs of their children, most especially their education.

loans.use: Start-Up Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Rubenia Isabel

texts.es: Rubenia Isabel N. Vda. D. S. D. 51 años D. edad vive en Cuscatancingo municipio D. San Salvador. Rubenia posee su propio negocio, una panadería donD. recibe la ayuda incondicional D. su esposo Don Cruz , quien trabaja en la panadería como panificador, también viven con ellos sus dos hijas Daysi D. 17 años y Catherine D. 13 años ambas niñas se encuentran estudiando. A pesar del pesado y extenso trabajo que lleva consigo Rubenia con la panadería, también  logrado montar una tienda la cual es D. gran ayuda para los ingresos que la familia necesita, ahora Rubenia esta solicitando un crédito por que quiere seguir expandiendo con productos su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Rubenia Isabel N. Vda. D. S. is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the Cuscatancingo municipality in San Salvador. Rubenia has her own business, a bakery in which she receives unconditional help from her husband, Mr. Cruz, who works as a baker. Their two daughters—Daysi, age 17, and Catherine, age 13—live with them. Both girls currently attend school. Despite Rubenia’s heavy and extensive work at the bakery, she has also managed to set up a general store, which is a big help with the family income. Rubenia is now requesting a loan because she wants to keep expanding store inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
"Asenati M. (0) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Foaluga.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Asenati owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Asenati has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Asenati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Asenati is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Asenati is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Asenati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kossiwa Natewyéné

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente d’une bouillie très appréciée de la population dénommée « akloui zogbon ». Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1995. Son mari est professeur de CEG et cela lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Grâce à son mari, elle pu trouver une place dans l’enceinte du collège, ce qui lui permet de vendre sa bouillie aux élèves. Elle est la seule à vendre de la bouillie « akloui zogbon » ; elle vend aussi des beignets accompagnant sa bouillie. Actuellement elle a besoin de constituer des stocks pour continuer ses activités ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 4 sacs de farine de blé. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de farine de blés

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad B. is from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Caridad owns and operates a tailoring business, providing women's tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be her 9th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Sha Nawaz Group

texts.en:
Parwen is the group leader of 'Sha Nawaz' group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Parwen and Bibi Safya want to take out a loan for their husband’s general stores. They want to expand their businesses.

Dall J. and Farzana want to a take out a loan for their tailoring businesses. They would like to buy necessary materials for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani and want to thank Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: expanding their businesses

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pedro V. se dedica a laborar arduamente para llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación y para ello ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda con el propósito de brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Es importante destacar que a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ha atravesado se ha comprometido en realizar esta reconstrucción de su casa de habitación. 

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado de inmediato para iniciar la tarea y de esta manera adquirir los materiales de construcción para realizar la reconstrucción de su vivienda y así tener un techo digno donde habitar junto con sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Pedro V. works arduously to bring well-being to his home and, because of this, has begun to reconstruct his house with the intention of offering his family the necessary conditions for development. It's important to emphasise and consider the difficult economic circumstances that he has gone through in undertaking the reconstruction of his house.

He hopes that the loan will be awarded shortly to begin the task and, in this way, acquire construction materials to reconstruct his house with a decent roof, where he can live together with his loved-ones.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en:
Nuufou M. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Nuufou owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Nuufou has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nuufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nuufou is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Nuufou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang N., 48, is married with a child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector, growing rice, and she rents a plot of land for a phone company, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is also a rice farmer, and he plants several types of vegetables, earning an income of US $2 per day. These sources of income from N. and her husband help cover the family expenses.

N. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to start a new business selling groceries.

loans.use: buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Vilma is married and has two school-age children. 

Vilma owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in which she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is fifty-three years old. He is married and has five children who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

As the man of the family, Stephen works very hard to be able to cater for his home. He runs a provision store by the roadside in his community, procuring his goods from Accra. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: M. Laurence

texts.fr: Née en 1961, H. M. Laurence vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Tokpota à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Laurence est divorcée de son mari, et est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Laurence vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Laurence a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Suite à son échec, Laurence a commencé par vendre des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, haricot, etc.), une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis une quinzaine d'année et qui lui permet de faire face à ses différents besoins. C'est à Ikpinlè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin que Laurence se ravitaille. Mais Laurence vend ses produits à Porto-Novo. Laurence a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Actuellement, Laurence éprouve des difficultés financières pour s'approvisionner et augmenter le stock de ses produits. C'est dans cette optique, et pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Laurence sollicite un deuxième pêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Laurence H. has been living for 10 years in the Tokpota neighbourhood of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Laurence is divorced from her husband and has a school-age child. Laurence lives alone and is solely responsible for the household expenses. Laurence attended school up until High School. When she failed her school year, Laurence began selling foodstuffs (maize, rice, beans, etc.) and has been doing so with great energy for roughly 15 years; this allows her to meet her various needs. Laurence buys her goods at the Ikpinlè food market of Benin, but sells them in Porto-Novo. Laurence has had a prior loan with Alidé which was repaid in full. Laurence is currently experiencing financial difficulties to purchase and increase her inventory. Because of this, and in order to better satisfy her customers, Laurence is asking for this, her second loan.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun Y. is a local cultivator who has been farming since 2000. She, age 41, is married with two kids, both of them attending school. Her husband helps feed the family by investing in the ox-sale trade.

Soeun Y. needs some supplies to serve her in her farming business this year. Therefore, she requests a loan of 500 USD to to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a water pump, which will allow her to grow crops on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and a water pump

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Plaridel, in Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items and expand her product offering. This loan will be Lourdes’ 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to help sustain their daily needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin C. was born in 1956. He is married to Salina, who is 48 years old. They have four children: Isaac, Norah, George and Douglas. Benjamin runs a charcoal business that he started ten years ago. He gets a profit of Kshs 5,000 every month from this business. His business is in Kabarnet, a town where competition among charcoal suppliers is rare, so he has very loyal customers.

Benjamin was introduced to KADET by existing clients. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 20,000 that he will use to buy more sacks of charcoal for his business inventory. If this loan boosts his business, he will use the extra profit to expand his business and sell in wholesale quantities. 

Benjamin hopes to be a famous charcoal wholesaler and own a lorry which will enable him to supply charcoal to big towns. He describes himself as hardworking, faithful and God-fearing.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: One-Word Group

texts.en:
This group is named “One-Word Group”, a Krio phrase for unity. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first Kiva loan through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy more goods for their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. Therefore, they are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader, 37-year-old Isatu K. I. (pictured right) has been selling cooked rice for three years now. She will invest her share of the loan into her cooked rice business by buying cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale.  Isatu who was born in Sanda village, northern Sierra Leone is married and has four children who are attending secondary school.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials like rice, palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Alymbaeva Mayramkul Group

texts.en:
A. Mayramkul is the leader of the group. Mayramkul is the resident of Karabalta, a small town nearby the capital - Bishkek. She's 50 years old, married and raised 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. The older son is 21, he works in a police department. The other one is 19 and he's a loader. A 13 years old daughter studies at school, her older sister is 15, she works as a seller. Mayramkul's husband works in village police department, he's a deputy chief over there. 3 years ago Mayramkul got a loan, on money received she bought groceries for retail selling. The initial amount was 15000 soms (327,36 $). Her older daughter always helps her in their business activity. As a result of this activity they could buy cattle for breeding and now they earn nearly 4000 soms (87.3 $) per month. They need  a loan for purchasing consumer goods to increase the turnover and further resale it. In future she's planning to open a new store.

K. Edil is 37 years old. He's married and has 2 daughters. The older one is a pupil. Edil is engaged in private transportation of passengers around the city. He began his business activity 2 years ago, the initial sum was 1000 $.On this money he bought a car and began to transport passengers, so now he earns 8000 soms (174.5$) per month. His wife sells dishes on the market. Thanks to their activity they could buy 2 cows and 10 sheep. Money received from loan, they will spend on purchasing different dishes in order to increase a range and a turnover. In near future Edil plans to increase the livestock.

K. Daktoorkan is 43, she's married and has 3 children: a son and 2 daughters. Her son and an older daughter are students, the younger one studies at school. Daktoorkan and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding for 16 years, in order to make money she also sells milk. The initial amount of their business activity was 15000 soms (327.4$). They got these money from loan, so they could buy cattle and now their monthly income is 6000 soms (130.95$). Daktoorkan wants to get a loan, because they need money to cultivate the land. In future she wishes to buy a big house.

T. Gulzat is the treasurer of the group. She is 25. 2 years ago, she had 1500 soms (32.73$), and her sister suggested her to buy a sewing machine for providing sewing services. On this money Gulzat bought a machine, and started to sew different clothes for selling. Now she earns 4000 soms (87.3$) per month and she wants to get a loan, because she needs more fabrics in order to expand her business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: for purchasing consumer goods to increase the turnover

loans.name: Enrrique De Jesus

texts.es: Enrique De Jesús tiene 46 años, el tiene 2 hijos menores que están a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de moto taxi, pues tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad para él es muy importante ofrecer un buen servicio ya que así obtiene más clientes. Por lo que su esposo también labora para ayudar a sufragar los gastos de la familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como llantas, cambio de asientos y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Enrique De Jesús, 46, has two minor children under his care. He provides mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo)transportation services; he's been in this line of work for 3 years. It's important for him to provide good service because that leads to more customers. His wife also works in order to contribute to household expenses. The funds will be used to buy raw materials like tires, replacement seats and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, car seats and other materials.

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es:
Humberto de 39 años de edad, es casado con la Sra. Alba Luna, quien trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, tienen 2 hijos: Alexis de 20 años que trabaja y apoya con los gastos y Lesbia de 6 añitos que esta en 1er grado de primaria. Don Humberto trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 6 años, desempeñandose como  inspector de transporte. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, construyendo la cocina, pues actualmente la tiene al aire libre, y con las lluvias a la hora de cocinar su esposa se moja y por eso quiere darle mayores condiciones a su familia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver su casa bonita y con las condiciones que su familia se merece, ademas desea que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de mucho provecho para el pais.
texts.en:
Humberto, age 39, is married to Alba Luna. She works and helps with the household expenses. They have two children. Alexis is 20, and she works and helps with the expenses. Lesbia is 6, and she is in first grade. For six years Humberto has worked as a transportation inspector for the Juigalpa municipal government. He is requesting his sixth loan to improve his house by building a kitchen. The kitchen is now outside, and when it rains his wife gets wet cooking. That is why he wants to give his family better living conditions. His greatest dream is to be able to see that his house is pretty and in the condition that his family deserves. He also wants his children go to school and become a great benefit to the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
41-year-old Arlene A. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Described as honest and understanding by family and friends, she makes sure to be a role model to her children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ym

texts.en:
Ym S. owns a medium-sized stone house and a workshop which is a good location for her to earn daily revenue. In her store, she stocks various groceries that she sells to people who are her nearby neighbor. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, rice, plastic goods, snack foods, and some sweets for kids. By doing this, Ym S. is able to generate around US$ 7 each day to help cover the daily expenses of her family. She has two other wage-earners in her husband and her son: her husband is a civil servant and her son works in a mobile phone company. 

Recently, some of her items have been exhausted, so she wants to restock and is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, to accumulate extra inventory for her store.

loans.use: To accumulate extra inventory for her store.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur Huseynovu 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey .Oni vsey semyoy jivut v Baku qorode. Yeqo deteam 2 let devochka i 7 let malchik. Yeqo sin uchitsya v shokle i mama eqo polojila chtob on xodil na tanci nacionalniye. 

Zaur uje v etom biznese virashivaniye kuric zanimayetsya 5 let. U neqo yest spesialnoye mesto qde on ostavlyayet kuric . Seychas on nujdayestya v 2000 AZN chtobi  kupit novix kurit i korm dlya nix .Tak kak seychas leto v Baku ludi yedat bolshe kuricu  i poetomu on bi xotel uvelichit ix kolichestvo.
texts.en:
Zaur H. is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. Their family lives in the city of Baku. His children are two year old daughter and seven year old son. His son goes to school and his mother also enrolled him in a dancing school so he can learn the national dance. Zaur has been in the business of growing chickens for five years. He has a place where he keeps the chickens. At this time he needs 2,000 AZN to buy new chickens and food for them. In the summer time in Baku people eat chicken more so he wants to increase the quantity.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and food

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan S. has won a kickboxing champion’s title on multiple occasions. This well-known kickboxing trainer received a trauma after which he was unable to continue his active involvement in martial arts. Vardan started his business in 2003, selling computer accessories and discs. He takes care of his pensioner mother. 

Vardan is planning to extend his business by introducing program discs and more computer accessories in his shop.

loans.use: purchasing program discs and computer accessories

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Pilar is the coordinator of her group, Unidos por el progreso 2 & 3 (unite to progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with 3 children and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook an go to the church.

Pilar is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than 5 years, starting with a small amount of money that she saved to start a business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying charcoal, baked foods and candies. She will use the profits to help her children, to save and finish building her house and she is planing to finish her high school studies.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because, she says "I really like what Esperanza offers". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane T. is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the town of Trento. Jane is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. Jane has been in business for over ten years.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid her first loan. Jane is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to pay school tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su ferretería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the community bank "Development Bank".  The bank is located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.

Carmen Rosa is 30 years old and is a single mother to one child.  She works at her hardware store from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  This business allows her to improve the life of her child, so she would like to expand the business.  She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for the hardware store.

She appreciates everyone who is a part of making her dream come true, and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her hardware store

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira K. is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married. She has three daughters. Her two older daughters are married and live separately with their families and the third daughter is at school. Damira is engaged in cultivating strawberries and her husband works as a taxi-driver. Damira wants to start a cattle breeding activity. She hopes to obtain the loan to purchase cattle. In the future she wants to purchase a house.

Gulaisha S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 50 and married. She has a daughter and two sons. She works as a janitor and her husband works in construction in Kazakhstan. Gulaisha wants to start a cattle breeding activity. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase cattle in order to resell them at a higher price after fattening. 

Nurlan S., 30, is married.  He has two daughters; both of them are preschool age (under seven).  Nurlan makes money by selling clothes on the market. In this way he makes 11700 soms per month. He hopes to obtain the loan because he wants to expand his business and purchase more clothes. 

Omurbek K., 31, is married. He has a newborn son. Omurbek works in construction, he is also engaged in farming. He cultivates strawberries. His wife wants to start selling clothes at the market. Omurbek hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase clothes for sale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya Davtyanlives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the village of Haritch. She is a widow with five children – three daughters (twenty, twenty-five and thirty years old) and two sons (twenty-eight and thirty-two years old). Olfelya helps support her daughters’ families with meat and produce from her farm. She is a hardworking person with over thirty years of experience in raising livestock.

As the family is large, she wishes to save money to help with the purchase of an additional house. Ofelya is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock. According to her business plan, she expects the investment to increase the family income by twenty percent. Since she is quite experienced in cattle breeding, she has chosen to expand her business. Ofelya considers herself fortunate to live in Haritch as she is surrounded by her family, relatives and close friends.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana M. P. tiene 38 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Maria pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta pasar tiempo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Juana M. P. is 38 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and their 5 children.  She lives in Guaranda Canton in Bolívar Province.

Maria belongs to the Ventanilla Guantucoto communal bank, which is located half an hour from Guaranda proper.  The members are people who make their livings in agriculture and ranching.  They plant corn and potatoes in the mountainous regions and rice in the coastal regions.  Their communal bank has 25 members. 

Maria has made her living in agriculture for many years.  She plants corn and potatoes.  In addition, she raises animals and livestock to sell.  She purchases them in Guaranda and sells them in the wholesale market of the same city.

She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to plant corn and potatoes.  The loan will help her financially in supplementing her family's needs.  They face challenges like plagues and disease in their crops.  Her hope is to purchase a vehicle and a house. 
She likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: Supplies for planting corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is a 53-year-old single mother of five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to educate her children to attain better qualifications. She has been a farmer for over 20 years and she still realizes increased returns despite the problem of pests and diseases. Tereza intends to use the money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Luís Misael

texts.es:
Luís Misael S. V. tiene 35 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho además es chofer profesional. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir incrementando los cultivos para dar mejor futuro al hijo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Misael S. V., 35, is married and lives with his wife and son in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has one son.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  They belong to Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming chores and other professional chores.  It has 17 members.

Luís is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer; he’s also a professional chauffeur.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells at the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for the loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to increase his crops to provide a better future for his son.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Isaac Nduati

texts.en:
Isaac is 58 years old and married to Scholar who contributes to the family income. He has a dairy farm which he has been running for the past 3 years with an income of about Kshs 5,000 a month.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy a dairy goat. This, he hopes, will greatly increase his yield and thus his income as well.

He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming to increase his profit so that he will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Mercurio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “MERCURIO” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro  Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  A la cabeza se encuentra la señora presidenta Ana Maria, seguida de la tesorera la señora Beatriz y la secretaria de Actas la señora Silvia.  Los negocios que llevan adelante cada una de estas señoras son diferentes, por ejemplo tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chicharrón de pollo, venta de pollo, venta de juguetes, costura de chamarras y trabajo en carpintería.

En el caso del negocio de la señora presidenta, su negocio es la venta de ropa.  Ella ya tiene experiencia en el ramo, más de cuatro años vendiendo ropa, cuenta con un puesto fijo en la Zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.  Este es su primer ciclo, por lo que la señora Ana María considera que el crédito le servirá para incrementar la mercadería.
texts.en:
The Mercurio Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the Germán Busch regional office.  The bank is comprised of eight members.

Ana Maria is at the head of the group, and she is the president.  Beatriz is the treasurer, and Silvia is the secretary.  

These women carry out different business activities.  Examples of their activities are selling clothes, selling deep-fried chicken, selling chicken, selling toys, making jackets, and doing carpentry work.

The president sells clothes.  She already has experience in this field, as she has been selling clothes for over four years.  She has a fixed stand in the Ballivián Zone in the city of El Alto.

This is her first cycle, and Ana María will use the loan to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Brenda Macarena

texts.es: Brenda Macarena tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de repostería y piñatas. Hace más de 19 años que tiene este negocio, sus inicio se dan como una fuente de ingresos necesarias para su hogar, es una persona muy responsable inicio por su Mama quien le enseño este medio de vida la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están al pendiente de la elaboración de sus deliciosas  repostería y piñatas. A pesar de la gran competencia que tiene no deja de vender sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de mantequilla, queso, huevo, harina, colorante y materiales para la elaboración de sus piñatas.
texts.en:
Brenda Macarena is 47. She sells pastries and piñatas. She has had this business for over 19 years and it provides the necessary source of income for her home. She is a very responsible person. She started her business because of her mother, who taught her this way of life.
The majority of her customers are always looking forward to her piñatas and delicious pastries. Despite the great competition, she is still selling. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, cheese, eggs, flour, colouring, and materials for making piñatas.

loans.use: working capital; the purchase of butter, cheese, eggs, flour, colouring, and materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Fátima Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima Maribel G. P. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público “Ernesto Che Guevara” de Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Docente tiene  Veinte y tres  años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente de la educación, es casada actualmente  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatima Maribel Garcia P. is an active employee of the Ernesto Che Guevara Public School, located in villa del Carmen. She has been a teacher for twenty three years in this school. she is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had seven past loans with Ceprodel  (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been invested in the purchase of construction materials,  such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks, etc., which were used to expand and  improve her house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and through them she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda runs a clothing store in the city of Nablus. She is the mother of eight children. Her husband drives a van, transporting goods for shops and factories. Raeda started her own business to help support the family. She requested a loan from FATEN to purchase winter clothes to sell and increase the store returns.

Raeda is photographed with her youngest son.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Ta-Kuru Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta-Kuru” group from northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek their first loan. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mariatu B.. She was born in the village of Marampa 28 years ago. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader and her children are in primary school. Mariatu has been selling cooked bulgur wheat for 5 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking materials like bulgur wheat, oil, fish, margi, onions, etc. in order to cook a large quantity of bulgur for sale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients like bulgur wheat, oil, fish, margi, onions, etc. in order to cook a large quantity of bulgur for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria se dedica a la costura, realiza artesanías las mismas las comercializa en la feria de la zona 16 de Juliode la ciudad de El Alto; también forma parte de un grupo musical donde tiene ingresos extras , el crédito lo requiere para comprar una maquina overlock de coser ya que es una herramienta de trabajo que necesita para realizar los trabajos con mayor rapidez .Vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Maria works in sewing. She makes handicrafts, which she sells in the market in the July 16th zone of the city of El Alto. She is also a member of a musical group, which brings in extra income. She needs the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, which she needs to do her work more quickly. She lives in a rented house in the Villa Dolores neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She is single and has one son. This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia nació en la histórica ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Eusebia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació donde la gente es amigable y alegre, ella es una mujer trabajadora que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos, ella trabaja en el INPE (Institución de Penitenciaria del Cusco) y está encargada de la seguridad de los reclusos. Ya son 10 años que trabaja en la institución y le ha ido muy bien.  Eusebia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para abrir una tienda para vender ropa tanto para caballeros, damas y niños. 

Eusebia es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 41, was born in the historic city of Cusco.  She still lives in that charming city of friendly, charasmatic people.  Eusebia works hard, striving to support her four children and get ahead in the world.  She works for INPE--the Spanish initials for Peru's prison-management organization--with responsibility for prisoner security.  She has worked for INPE for 10 years and is glad to have the job.  Eusebia is applying for a loan because she wants to open a clothing store where she will sell clothing for men, women and children.

Eusebia is a responsible woman.  She's a member of the Puntualito community bank, a group sponsored by Cusco's Asociacion Arariwa bank.

loans.use: to open a clothing store

loans.name: Johana María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 30  años, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque el banco le ha ayudado a comprar ciertas cosas necesarias en su negocio.

Ella tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza diversos trabajos como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.  También vende ropa de todo tipo en su local ya que allí tiene vitrinas para mostrar sus prendas, nos dice que tiene su salón de belleza 17 años, que le ha ido muy bien y que poco a poco la ha ido creciendo.
  
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes de cabello, permanentes y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud y que nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Sweet Friendship (Dulce Amistad) meet every two weeks in the canton of Rocafuerte. This location is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals, which are recognized throughout the country. The people are very warm, friendly and hardworking.

Mrs. Johanna lives here and is 30 years old, married with a son age 11 from this relationship, who attends school. Her husband is a merchant.  She has been in the community bank for three loan cycles and likes it because the bank has helped her to purchase items required in her business.

She has a beauty salon, where she performs various jobs such as dyeing, cutting hair, painting nails and others. She works from 8:00AM to 9:00PM and sometimes even later if customers require her services. She also sells clothing of all types in her shop and has windows to display these clothes.   She communicated that her beauty salon is 17 years old.  The business has performed very well and has grown gradually.
  
She is going to use this loan to buy hair dye, supplies for permanents and clothing of all kinds.
 
Her dreams are to have good health and never be left without work.

loans.use: buy hair dye, supplies for permanents and clothing of all kinds

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, ropa nueva, cocos, sandia y maíz, todos estos productos los vende desde hace 10 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, reside en Usulután.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para mejorar el vehículo y la compra de más productos para la venta, dicho préstamo le ayudara para pagar mecánico, comprar maíz y mariscos, esto le permitirá estar en mejores condiciones.
Su objetivo es ampliar las rutas de ventas, comprarse un vehículo más nuevo,  y crecer en las ventas, de esta manera garantizar una vida más confortable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto sells seafood, new clothing, coconuts, watermelon, and corn for a living. He has been selling all these products for 10 years. He lives with his wife and children in Usulután.

He is currently requesting a loan so that he can repair his vehicle and purchase more merchandise. This loan will help him pay the mechanic and purchase corn and seafood, which will allow him to obtain a better quality of life.

His goal is to expand his sales area, purchase a newer vehicle, and boost sales, thus guaranteeing a more comfortable life for his children.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic and purchase corn and seafood.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis, tiene la edad de 56 años, está casado  y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son su prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra del abono para la fertilización de su cafetal. El cuanta con el terreno sembrado y en producción. El quiere aumentar la cosecha este año por lo cual lo asistirá de esa manera. El quiere seguir creciendo como caficultor y fortalecer su proyecto aun mas cada día para llegar a ser un buen caficultor de la zona y a su vez generar las ganancias para su bienestar familiar. 

Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 56 years old and married.  He lives with his son and wife who are his main priorities in life.  He intends to use this loan to buy manure with which to fertilize his coffee plantation.  He has land which is currently sown and producing crops.  Alexis would like to increase his harvest this year and this will help him to do that.  He would like to continue growing as a coffee farmer and continually strengthen his project of becoming a good regional coffee producer.  He would also like to make good profits for the well-being of his family.

This is the first loan that Alexis has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any prior loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 19 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Florence has a poultry business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business doing outdoor catering.
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale and more feed. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale and more feed.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo  2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo 2 & 5 (Christ and Our Effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and one of their 2 children. She says that her most important challenge is saving enough money to buy a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying and attending Church.

Yaquelin is excited to be taking a 7th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around three and a half years, starting with a some money she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for sale in her house and by walking around in the community and selling it. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dream come true, which is to have her own house.

Yaquelin's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 36 years old and single. She has been in farming for 12 years and employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces tea and milk, which are sold to the local market.  She resides in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya.

Evalyn has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the loan will improve her family income, which will be used to repay the loan as well as provide the family with basic needs.

Evalyn says that animal diseases and lack of animal feed are the challenges faced in dairy farming.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Doña Florinda D. 27 años casada y tiene un hijo su esposo trabaja como albañil D. obras independiente, doña Florinda venD. frijol desD. hace cuatro años en el mercado municipal D. su comunidad, sus ventas han incrementado últimamente por su buena atención y precios cómodos, venD. un quintal D. frijol al día el fin D. semana y días D. mercado venD. más D. lo normal, ahora necesita otro crédito para poder comprar productos comestibles y lograr tener mayor ganancias y ayudar con los gastos D. su hogar,a su esposo.
texts.en:
27-year old Sra. Florinda is married and has a son. Her husband works as an independent construction worker. Florinda has sold beans for four years in the local municipal market. Sales have increased recently because of the good service and prices she offers. She sells a quintal (100 lbs/ 46 kg) of beans a day at the weekends and on market days she sells more than normal.

Currently she needs another loan to buy food items so that she will earn more money and help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita, 56, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a retail shop selling charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconut shells for charcoal-making.

Purita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Purita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal-making.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es: La señora Mireya oriunda del Jorochito de santa cruz, vive con el sr. Santiago tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en zona el torno, su actividad económica es venta de comidas en su propio domicilio hace un año, el destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos,  es una persona muy trabajadora y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Mireya, native of Jorochito de Santa Cruz, lives with Mr. Santiago. They have two school aged children. The live in their own home located in "el torno" area. Her business has been selling food in her home for a year. Her loan will be used  to purchase consumables to make her dishes. She is a very hardworking person and she is grateful to the institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: purchase consumables for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, age 31, earns a living by selling glass. He has been engaged in his business for the last four years. Previously, he used to work in construction. He and his wife have a seven-year-old child who is enrolled in school.

Vincent is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy glass to offer for sale. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially by providing easy access to finances.

His goal for the next five years is to transform his business into a hardware shop.
