loans.use: to buy glass to offer for sale

loans.name: Jose Bitelio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia esposa y dos hijos, el negocio comenzó por el apoyo de su padre, quien le enseño el cuidado que necesita la crianza de los cerdos, esto le ha permitido tener experiencia en su granja.
Actualmente invertirá un préstamo en la compra de cerdos, con este préstamo aumentara su granja, dándole más oportunidad de venta.
Esta compra le ayudara a ampliar el negocio, dandole la oportunidad de ganar más ingresos, mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children and his business is raising pigs.  He started his business with the support of his father who taught him the care that is needed in raising pigs.  This enabled him to gain experience on his farm.

José will invest this loan in buying pigs.  This will increase the size of his farm and give him more sales opportunities.  The purchase will help him to expand his business and give him the opportunity to make more income.  This, in turn, will enable him to improve his business and his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is shown above with some Fante kenkey, or fermented corn dough, for sale at Essiam near Abura. She is a widow and responsible for paying for the utility bills and for her accommodations. 

Her loan will be used to buy more bags of corn to prepare the Fante kenkey. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more bags of corn to prepare Fante kenkey, or fermented corn dough.

loans.name: Pain De Vie Plus Group

texts.en:
“Pain deVie Plus” is a group of 27 owners of small businesses chaired by Philo. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Philo’s main activity is selling purified water. Besides that, she also sells prepaid cards. She is a hard-working woman who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organisation and good management. Philo is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying some containers of purified water and some prepaid cards in order to meet the high demand of her customers in her community and generate more profit. Her business brings in profit of US$20 each day. 

Philo is confident with her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Philo’s medium term plan is to open a purified water facility in order to store more containers to meet her community’s needs for purified water. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children aged 21 and 23.

loans.use: to purchase containers of purified water and prepaid cards for resale.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly (in the photo) is a weaver. Her husband sells cows. He buys cows from the nearby district and sells to a middleman who comes to buy cows from him at his house. The couple has been married since 2001 and has one daughter, who attends school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokly is in the process of building a new house to stay in. However, she lacks some money to complete it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the build.

loans.use: To complete building her house.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, nuevamente está solicitando préstamo, en este ocasión para la compra de abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz, ella se decidió por este nuevo préstamo por la respuesta rápida, la buena atención. 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho y su condición actual ha cambiado en la tienda, ya que compro mercaderia para ofrecer a los clientes, gracias a las inversiones que realiza y el buen manejo del préstamo esta logrando mejorar.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting another loan, on this occasion to buy fertilizer and herbicides to grow corn. She decided on this new loan thanks to the rapid response and the good service. 
 
The previous loan helped her very much, and her current condition has changed in her store, since she bought merchandise to offer to her customers. Thanks to the investments she has carried out and her good management of the loan funds, she is succeeding in improving her situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her corn crop.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a 43-year-old married woman. She and her husband Juma are blessed with eight children and four are currently enrolled in school. Nyevu crafts brooms and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for four years and her customers are primarily her neighbors and other local residents.

Nyevu's other sources of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.   Nyevu plans to use this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more raw materials for making brooms. Nyevu aspires to open her own shop and become a wholesale supplier in the future. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because they are strong advocates for low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for use in making brooms

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Then is 35 years old and married. She has two daughters and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband is a truck driver and helps her to manage a general store.

Then runs a store at her house that sells many kinds of food, snacks, instant noodles, milk, fruit-juice bottles, and shampoo for the people in her community.

Then would like to take a loan to buy new products such as rice and beverages to sell to her customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new products such as rice and beverages to sell from her general store

loans.name: Urania Maria

texts.es: Urania, de 30 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Leon, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a atender una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio con ayuda de su abuelita quien se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería en general fue ella quien le dio la idea de que vendiera gaseosa para que tuviera su propio negocio y no dependiera de su esposo. De hecho ahora es su esposo quien le ayuda con la venta poco a poco fue comprando mercadería para su pulpería lleva 4 años con este negocio. Pero dice que le hace falta llenarla de mas productos variados , es por ello que realizo el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza, productos lácteos , ropa, juguetes, cosméticos ya que quiere tener una pulpería bien surtida e invertir en poner una pequeña tienda de ropa y juguetes para diversificar su negocio.
texts.en: 30-year-old Urania lives in the city of León.  She has a 5-year-old son.  Urania's business is running a grocery store in her home.  She started this business with the help of her grandmother who used to sell general merchandise.  She was the one who gave her the idea of selling sodas in order to have her own business and not have to be dependent on her husband.  In fact, now it is her husband who helps her with her sales.  Urania has gradually bought merchandise for her store and now she has been in the business for four years.  However, she says that she needs to fill her store with a greater variety of products.  For this reason, she is taking out a loan to buy basic grains, cleaning products, dairy products, clothes, toys and cosmetics as she would like to have a well-stocked store and invest in setting up a small clothes and toy store so that she can diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, dairy products, clothes, toys and cosmetics

loans.name: Alina

texts.ru:
Алина – замужем, у нее двое детей. Алина занимается фермерским хозяйством в своем родном селе Водяное. Она выращивает ранние помидоры. У Алины шесть больших теплиц, где она ежегодно садит 7 000 высокорослых помидор. Сельским хозяйством она занимается уже 8 лет. В хозяйство было вложено около 150 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 55 000 гривен. 

Кредит КИВА в размере 14 000 гривен Алине необходим для того, чтобы провести отопление в теплицах. Алина очень бережно относится к посевам и поэтому вовремя старается предусмотреть все необходимое для того, чтобы уберечь будущий урожай от холодов: натягивает второй слой полиэтиленовой пленки и устраивает в своих теплицах отопление. Улучшение тепличных условий предоставит Алине возможность вовремя высадить овощи в необходимом количестве и получить соответствующую прибыль.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alina is married and has two children. Alina is a farmer in Vodyanoye village. She grows early tomatoes. Alina has six large greenhouses, where every year she plants 7000 tall tomatoes. She has been working in agriculture for eight years. She has invested about 150,000 hryvnia in her harm. Each year, the cost of seeds and plastic sheeting is 55,000 hryvnia. 

Alina needs a Kiva loan of 14,000 hryvnia in order to heat the greenhouses. Alina is a very cautious farmer, and she is trying to provide everything necessary to protect her future crop from the cold, including using a second layer of polyethylene film and heating the greenhouse. Improving the conditions in the greenhouse will allow Alina to grow a greater quantity of vegetables and make greater profits.

loans.use: heat her greenhouses.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a widowed man with one child who attends school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a grocery-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and green vegetables for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Irma Jeaneth

texts.es:
Irma Janeth  tiene 34 años vive en Unión Libre, y vive con su cónyuge y su  hija, de 9 años. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.
Irma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, a criar gallinas chanchas. Desde hace cuatro años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, urea, fertilizante, abonos, insecticidas para la siembra del maíz, así también para la compra de la comida apropiada para criar sus gallinas y chanchos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder comprar un carro para poder movilizarse en el negocio y así poder  gozar de  buena salud y  estar unidos con la familia.

En los tiempos pasar más juntos con la familia  y con su hija.
texts.en:
Irma Janeth, 34, lives with her partner and 9-year old daughter in San Vicente Las Lomas, a small town in the Ecuadorean canton of Ventanas.

The members of the El Recreo community bank in San Vicente Las Lomas make their livings from farming.  They grow maize, rice, beans and soy.  
Irma, too, is a farmer.  She grows maize and beans and raises chickens and pigs.  She started the business four years ago.  She buys and sells what she needs in Ventanas.

Irma will use part of this loan to buy urea, fertilizer, manure, pesticides and other supplies for growing maize.  She will use the rest to feed for her chickens and pigs.  Borrowing helps her increase her family's income.  Irma's goal is to buy a cart for transporting goods to market.

In her spare time, Irma likes to spend time with her family and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming businesses.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret has applied for loans in the past and successfully used them to buy maize to sell to her customers. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the high cost of labor. Her goals for the future are to open a food store where she can earn enough money to pay for the education of her children and buy a plot of land on which she can grow her own crops. She is applying for this loan to buy maize to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Feury

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Feury works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Feury is borrowing PHP 6,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Omondeokou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OMONDEOKOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Sylviane, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans est mariée à un revendeur nommé Lucien. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge. Sylviane vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Sylviane et son mari. Sylviane a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour cette raison, Sylviane vend des plateaux d’œuf et de l'huile végétale par la technique de distribution depuis vingt ans. Sylviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sylviane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OMONDEOKOU un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des plateaux d’œuf et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira  is 48 years old, married woman and a mother of 7 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Tahira  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 51 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the  occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He has 3 children. Tahir and his family are settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village, built for IDPs. 
He has been in the cattle-breeding business for 4 years and now needs a loan of US$1200 to buy 2 cows in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia buys and sells clothing. She travels to the Guatemalan border to buy clothing and then her niece provides her with a space where she displays the clothing and sells it to people who live in her area. She is 43 years olds, has 6 children and her husband works as a driver for public transportation. She is a member of the microcredit group Agua 2 with Rosa Hernández Sandoval who sells sweets, tacos and empanadas at a public school, and Juana Bautista Montoya who sells fruits and vegetables. With their loan they hope to find spaces to sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

SILVIA, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, viaja a la frontera con Guatemala a comprar la ropa y posteriormente una sobrina le facilita un local donde exhibe su mercadería y ahí le compran las personas que habitan su localidad. Ella tiene 43 años, 6 hijos, y su esposo trabaja como chofer e la locomoción colectiva. Pertenece al grupo Agua 2 junto con doña Rosa Hernández Sandoval (vende en una escuela pública dulces, tacos empanadas) y doña Juana Bautista Montoya (vende frutas y verduras) Con el préstamo esperan habilitar locales en sus lugares respectivos para poder vender ahí sus productos.

loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad S. is 24 years old and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is single. For two years he has been running his own orchard, and this business gives him the opportuniy to support himself.  Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina has proposed to start a pork bun business with her first loan. She is grateful that SPBD is able to lend money to unemployed women like herself, and she is looking forward to the opportunity to start this business venture. She would like to expand her business in the future depending on how the pork bun business goes, and she will again seek assistance from SPBD to do that.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pork bun business

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en: Sulton S. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. He regards himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. His business is shashlik (roasted meat) and sambusa (the national flour product, with meat which is roasted in a special way). Sulton S. works in the bazaar. He has a wide assortment of national meat courses and has permanent clients. He works with clients of different income levels, and he is experienced in the business. Working in the bazaar, he is up against tough competitors, which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now he requires a loan of 3600 STJ for business support and additional inventory.

loans.use: To broaden the existing assortment.

loans.name: Rohayati

texts.en: Rohayati is a 39-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, which means she works alone to provide for her family needs. She sells bean sprouts, earning $5 a day. Rohayati is requesting a loan of $150 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add business capital

loans.name: Groupement Miwodeka

texts.fr:
The MIWODEKA Group was created five years ago by ten young women. It specializes in producing traditional soaps made from red oil. This soap is used mostly by the local population, which explains the strong demand. The income from their business enables them in part to cover household expenses. They would like to use this loan to buy a hundred 50-liter drums of red oil and to lease a store for stocking their production.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement MIWODEKA est créé depuis 05 ans par 10 jeunes femmes et spécialisé dans la préparation de savons traditionnels à base de l’huile rouge. Ce savon est utilisé en majorité par la population locale ce qui explique une forte demande. Les revenus de leur activité leur permettent de supporter en partie les charges de leur foyer. Elles souhaitent par ce crédit acheter 100 bidons de 50 litres d’huiles rouges et louer un magasin pour le stockage de leur production.

loans.use: To buy a hundred 50-liter drums of red oil and to lease a store

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Mrs. Da S. and her husband, Thy Hel, have been married for three years. They have no children. The family lives along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Da has been a silk weaver for twenty-three years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village. Her husband has been a driver for a company for six years.

She is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount $400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en: Amidu is 54 years old and married, with 19 children. He is an accomplished and experienced tailor, but he lacks the capital to purchase enough supplies to allow him to meet customer demand. He learned tailoring 10 years ago and has been sewing clothes ever since, especially for women in Makup Bana village. His service is very vital and saves women from travelling long distances to Makeni town to seek sewing services. Amidu would like to expand his business and is requesting a loan of approximately $700 US to purchase more cotton material, buttons, and other supplies for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase sewing and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is a petty trader who sells sugar, rice, soup and other foods. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is doing well but she wishes to increase sales to improve her income.

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
R. Gulnora is 31 years old. She is married with three children. Her eldest son is 8 years old and already goes to school, and her daughter is only 4. Her husband coaches karate. Gulnora is selling perfumery and cosmetics in the store she rents. She has been in this business for almost five years. Gulnora would like to expand the business by opening her own store and establishing contacts with suppliers of well-known products.

Gulnora and her husband are working hard to provide an education for their kids. They want to become highly-demanded experts in their professional careers. Gulnora is requesting 3400 Somoni ($1000 US Dollars) to purchase new perfumery and cosmetics: such as lipstick, mascara, powder, cream for skin, etc., for the purpose of expanding the variety of goods that she sells.

Gulnora would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling to increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat Zoirove lives in the town Tursun-zoda. She is married and has 3 children. She is in the business of sales. She doesn't have a permanent location, but she travels to villages. She goes from home to home and offers her goods. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She would like to obtain a credit and purchase school uniforms by the beginning of the season. School season is highly profitable, and for that reason, she needs to get a loan for 2500 somoni for 10 months as soon as possible.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Зоирова Мухаббат жительница города Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей . Торговую точку не имеет . Торгует покишлакам. Ходит из дома в дом и предлагает товар. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. К школьному сезону хочет получить кредит и закупить школьную форму. Школьный сезон очень прибыльный , поэтому она должна срочно получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони, сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya (her husband is pictured), born in 1981 and the mother of two children, is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region, and now lives in the town of Khirdalan. Her husband has run a taxi business for five years, and the family is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for the car. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 41 years old. She is married and earns income selling spices. Mariam works every day, making a monthly profit of about US$35 from the sales.

Mariam is now asking for a loan to expand her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser, ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo a quien ama mucho.  Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 5 años, pero no es el único ingreso que tiene, ya que también, dentro de su domicilio tiene una pequeña vidriería, a cargo su esposo, ella trabaja todo el día, y lo que le gusta de su negocio es que concurre mucha gente con quienes trata temas distintos y hasta incluso le enseñan muchas cosas que ella desconocía, lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado, ya que el espacio es muy reducido.  Trabaja arduamente para apoyar con los gastos familiares.  Solicita este préstamo para la ampliación e implementación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. They are her reason for being. She depends on the unconditional support from her husband, whom she loves so very much. For the past 5 years she has been selling soft drinks and basic needs products. But this is not their only income - her husband sells panes of glass. She works all day and she loves her job because she gets to meet so many different people and shares different ideas with them, and she even learns things that she never knew before. The hard part is that she doesn't have an adequate space to run her business - her current location is very small. She works arduously to help cover the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and expand.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing A. is 28 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Blessing sells provisions and hydraulic fluids. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and hydraulic fluids to sell
